See Attachment (F) Date(s) and place(s) of delivery and acceptance:?30 days after award to USDA-ARS-HCRL, 3420 NW Orchard Ave., Corvallis, OR 97330-5014.? All items shall be sent FOB Destination.?? ?(G) FAR Provision 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors-Commercial, is incorporated by reference and applies to this acquisition. Please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions for the submission requirements.? (H) Evaluation:? For the evaluation criteria, please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions.? (I) Offerors are required?to complete in full?FAR Provision 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications-Commercial Items,?with their offer?online at SAM:?www.sam.gov.??An offeror must state in their offer if they completed FAR 52.212-3 online and that is it up-to-date and valid.?See the?attached RFQ terms and conditions?for more requirements.? (J)?FAR Clause 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions-Commercial Items,?applies to this acquisition. Please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions for its Addendum.? (K) FAR Clause 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items,?is incorporated and applies to this acquisition. Please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions that are applicable to the acquisition.? (L) A statement regarding any additional contract requirement(s) or terms and conditions (such as contract financing arrangements or warranty requirements) determined by the contracting officer to be necessary for this acquisition and consistent with customary commercial practices: N/A.? (M) The Defense Priorities and Allocations System (DPAS) and assigned ratings are not applicable to this solicitation.? (N) Date,?time?and place offers are due.? Offers are due by June 10, 2022 Noon PST Submit offers to the following e-mail address(es), by the offer due date and time:? jennifer.olson2@usda.gov (O) Any and all questions regarding this solicitation shall be submitted in writing to?Jennifer Olson, jennifer.olson2@usda.gov?no later?than Noon, June 7, 2022?Pacific Time.?"

column1: Equipment: Air Circulation, Boilers, Furnace, Refrigeration Bids,PA,"4110-- 3-Door Roll in Refrigerator - Traulsen ""Name Brand or Equal""",Federal,,Department of Veterans Affairs,"Jun 6, 2022",Department of Veterans Affairs,https://sam.gov/opp/529e391ef647429b83059c2965f7ebcd/view,"36C24422Q0787
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-461-4300,Tyler.Karns@va.gov,,"THIS IS NOT A SOLICITATION ANNOUNCEMENT. THIS IS A REQUEST FOR INFORMATION ONLY. This Request for Information (RFI) is intended for information and planning purposes only at this time; and shall not be construed as a solicitation or as an obligation on the part of the Department of Veterans Affairs. Because this is a Request for Information announcement, no evaluation letters and/or results will be issued to the respondents. No solicitation exists. Therefore, do not request a copy of the solicitation and bids are not being accepted at this time. The Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), VISN 4, Network Contracting Office 4 (NCO 4), is seeking information and potential qualified sources that are SDVOSB s that are capable of providing the supplied equipment for a Brand Name, or Equal Requirement for (1) Traulsen Model #: ARI332L-FHS, 3 Door Roll-in Refrigerator for the Nutrition and Food Service Department. Requests for information from sources are due by June 6th, at 3 PM. The 3 Door Roll-in Refrigerator, is for the Pittsburgh VA Medical Center, located at the H.J. Heinz Campus in Aspinwall PA., located at 1010 Delafield Rd., Pittsburgh, PA 15215. Scope of work: The contractor shall be able to provide and deliver the new 3 door roll-in refrigerator to the loading dock at the H.J. Heinz facility. This refrigerator should consist of the following characteristics listed directly below: Exterior stainless-steel and interior aluminum construction. Three doors with lock. Exterior temperature display. Self-closing doors. Ability to accommodate racks up to 66 high. Automatically Activated Incandescent Lights. Automatic Non-Electric Condensate Evaporator. Stainless Steel One-Piece Louver Assembly. Stainless Steel Interior Rack Guides & Threshold Ramps. Not to exceed 102 in width, 30 in depth, and 86 in height. 90-degree door opening. 117.5 Cu. Ft. net capacity. R450A refrigerant. 115/60/1 phase electric. Not to exceed 20 amps. One-year warranty on parts and labor. Five-year warranty on compressor. Additional Information: There is no installation for this requirement. Delivery: Delivery shall be made to the following address location: H.J Heinz, VA Medical Center, located in Aspinwall, at: 1010 Delafield Rd., Pittsburgh PA 15215. This equipment needs to be delivered to the loading dock at Building 49, The Warehouse. All items can be received Monday Friday, from 8 AM to 4:00 PM, except for weekends, or holidays. The information identified above is intended to be descriptive, not restrictive and to indicate the quality of the supplies/services that will be satisfactory. It is the responsibility of the interested source to demonstrate to the government that the interested parties can provide the supplies/services that fulfill the required specifications mentioned above. Responses to this RFI should include company name, address, point of contact, phone number, and point of contact e-mail, SAM UEI Unique Entity Identifier, size of business pursuant to North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) 333415 (size standard of 1250 employees) and Socioeconomic Status Class. Please answer the following questions: Please indicate the size status and representations of your business, such as but not limited to: Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), Veteran Owned Small Business (VOSB), Hubzone, Woman Owned Small Business (WOSB), Large Business, etc.)? Is your company considered small under the NAICS code identified under this RFI? Is the product you are providing information about manufactured in the United States? If not, please provide the country where the unit is manufactured. If you are a large business, do you have any designated distributors? If so, please provide their company name, telephone, point of Contact and size status (if available). If you re a small business and you are an authorized distributor/reseller for the items identified above do you alter; assemble; modify; the items requested in any way? If you do, state how and what is altered; assembled; modified? If you intend to subcontract any work on this contract, what portion of the total cost will be self-performed/will be performed by your organization? Please provide estimated detailed percentage breakdowns related to subcontracted work and completion of job. Does your company have an FSS contract with GSA or the NAC or are you a contract holder with any other federal contract? If so, please provide the contract number. If you are an FSS GSA/NAC contract holder or other federal contract holder, are the items/solution you are providing information for available on your schedule/contract? General pricing of your products/solution is encouraged. Pricing will be used for the purpose of market research only. It will not be used to evaluate for any type of award. Please list if this pricing proposed is on your GSA Schedule or will it be Open Market? Please submit your capabilities regarding the salient characteristics detailed above to establish capabilities for planning purposes. Please review salient characteristics/statement of work (if applicable) and provide feedback or suggestions. If none, please reply as N/A. Please provide your SAM Unique Entity Identifier number. This RFI will be conducted in accordance with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Part 8. Telephone responses will not be accepted. Responses must be received via e-mail to Tyler.Karns@va.gov no later than, 11:00 AM Eastern Standard Time (EST) on April 27th, 2022. This notice will help the VA in determining available potential sources only. Do not contact VA Medical Center staff regarding this requirement, as they are not authorized to discuss this matter related to this procurement action. All questions will be addressed by the Contract Specialist, Tyler Karns. All firms responding to this Request for Information are advised that their response is not a request for proposal, therefore will not be considered for a contract award. If a solicitation is issued, information will be posted on the GSA eBuy website for all qualified interested parties at a later date and interested parties must respond to the solicitation to be considered for award. This notice does not commit the government to contract for any supplies or services. The government will not pay for any information or administrative cost incurred in response to this Request for Information. Information will only be accepted in writing by e-mailing the: Contract Specialist, Tyler.Karns@va.gov. DISCLAIMER This RFI is issued solely for information and planning purposes only and does not constitute a solicitation. All information received in response to this RFI that is marked as proprietary will be handled accordingly. Responses to this notice are not offers and cannot be accepted by the Government to form a binding contract. Responders are solely responsible for all expenses associated with responding to this RFI."

column1: Services: Debris Removal, Waste, Disaster Recovery, Recycling, Shredding Bids,GA,Clearing and Grading,State/Local,,Savannah Economic Development Authority,"Jul 8, 2022",Savannah Economic Development Authority,https://ssl.doas.state.ga.us/gpr/eventDetails?eSourceNumber=2233945SEDA-2022-001&sourceSystemType=doas,"SEDA-2022-001
column3: ",,,912-447-8450,sliotta@husseygaybell.com,,"1.Sealed proposals for Clearing and Mass Grading Improvements for Site 8, Crossroads Business Park, Savannah, Georgia will be received by the Savannah Economic Development Authority (SEDA), attention Mr. Trip Tollison, at the offices of Savannah Economic Development Authority at 906 Drayton Street, Savannah, GA USA 31401 until 11:00 a.m. on July 8, 2022 at which time they will be publicly opened. 2.The project consists of the following generally described work: Clearing and mass grading of approximately 40–acres (+/-) for a proposed industrial site. The site is known as Site 8 and located on Crossroads Parkway adjacent to Interstate 95. Access to the site is from Crossroads Parkway via an access road. The proposed work consists of the clearing, grubbing, and rough grading of the site, including all labor, equipment, materials, appurtenances, and incidentals required to complete the project. 3.Plans and Specifications are open to inspection at the office of Savannah Economic Development Authority at 906 Drayton Street, Savannah, GA USA 31401, or may be obtained from Hussey, Gay, Bell & DeYoung, Inc., 329 Commercial Drive, Savannah, Georgia 31406 upon payment of $100.00 (plus shipping charges as applicable) for hardcopies (Electronic copies are $0.00). The payment is non–refundable. Contact Steve Liotta, 329 Commercial Drive, Savannah, Georgia 31406 via phone 912–354–4626, or email: sliotta@husseygaybell.com to request plans and specifications."

column1: Services: Debris Removal, Waste, Disaster Recovery, Recycling, Shredding Bids,GA,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Dumpsters,Federal,,Department of Defense,Today ,Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/a99addd0ecce4ae2a250850fdc3cd74f/view,"M0026322AL04
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,kevin.ortega@usmc.mil,,"THIS IS A SOURCE SOUGHT SYNOPSIS ONLY. This is NOT a Request for Quotation and in no way obligates the Government to award any contract/purchase order. The purpose of this Source Sought Synopsis is to seek out interested businesses capable of fulfilling this product requirement. Regional Contracting Office Parris Island is performing market research to determine available sources that can provide Large Dumpsters in support of Hurricane evacuation efforts in Albany, GA.? In addition, interested vendors shall provide the following information: Is your business a small business under this NAICS code? Refer to the attached draft Performance Work Statement and respond base on the ability to provide those technical requirements. Are the services available under a GSA/FSS contract? If so, please provide the contract number. Cage code and DUNS number. Cage code and DUNS number must be registered in System for Award Management (https://www.sam.gov) Provide a contractor capabilities statement and electronic business card. The US Marine Corps, Regional Contracting Office, MCRD Parris Island, SC is issuing this Sources Sought/Request for Information (RFI) for Solid Waste Dumpsters: MCRDPI is looking for up to 10 Solid Waste Dumpsters:? -To incllude once a week trash removal/pickup. -Estimated Hurricane Season:? 1 June 2022 through 30 November 2022. Period of performance dependant on anticipated Hurricane season dates. There is not a defined requirement yet and this Sources Sought is for market research and information purposes only. The government reserves the right to issue multiple contracts for this requirement."

column1: Services: Debris Removal, Waste, Disaster Recovery, Recycling, Shredding Bids,ID,"Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5) Rodent Control Services for the USDA, ARS, USSES in Dubois, ID",Federal,,Department of Agriculture,"Jun 6, 2022",Department of Agriculture,https://sam.gov/opp/56701357db5a4089a7b6c44120f67409/view,"12905B22Q0068
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,504-426-0217,shelley.steen@usda.gov,,"his is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the procedures contained in FAR Part 12.6, Acquisition of Commercial Items, and FAR Part 13, Simplified Acquisition Procedures, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotes are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued.? This acquisition is for the selected contractor to provide rodent control of its facilities as described below.? Vendor to supply all supplies, materials, traps, and bait necessary to perform the service for two locations at the USDA, Agricultural Research Service, U. S. Sheep Experiment Station, near Dubois, Idaho. (A) The solicitation number is 12905B22Q0068 and is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ).? (B) The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) Number 2022-04 issued January 26, 2022.?? (C) This solicitation is issued as a total small business set-aside. The associated NAICS code is 561710.? The small business size standard is $500.? (D) List CLINS, ?descriptions, quantities and units of measure:? ?The USDA, Agricultural Research Service, U. S. Sheep Experiment Station, near Dubois, Idaho requires rodent control of its facilities as described below.? Vendor to supply all supplies, materials, traps, and bait necessary to perform the service.? PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE:? Base Year:? 01 July 2022 ? 30 June 2023, 1 year Option Year One:? 01 July 2023 ? 30 June 2024, 1 year Option Year Two:? 01 July 2024 ? 30 June 2025, 1 year Option Year Three: 01 July 2025 ? 30 June 2026, 1 year Option Year Four: 01 July 2026 ? 30 June 2027, 1 year (E) Description/Statement of Work/Specification:? Please see the attached Statement of Work.? (F) Date(s) and place(s) of delivery and acceptance:? The due date for this June 30 of the awarded year.? The work will be performed at the two locations listed in the Statement of Work. (G) FAR Provision 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors-Commercial, is incorporated by reference and applies to this acquisition. Please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions for the submission requirements.? (H) Evaluation:? For the evaluation criteria, please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions.? (I) Offerors are required to complete in full FAR Provision 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications-Commercial Items, with their offer online at SAM: www.sam.gov.? An offeror must state in their offer if they completed FAR 52.212-3 online and that is it up-to-date and valid. See the attached RFQ terms and conditions for more requirements.? (J) FAR Clause 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions-Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition. Please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions for its Addendum.? (K) FAR Clause 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, is incorporated and applies to this acquisition. Please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions that are applicable to the acquisition.? (L) A statement regarding any additional contract requirement(s) or terms and conditions (such as contract financing arrangements or warranty requirements) determined by the contracting officer to be necessary for this acquisition and consistent with customary commercial practices: N/A.? (M) The Defense Priorities and Allocations System (DPAS) and assigned ratings are not applicable to this solicitation.? (N) Date, time and place offers are due.? Offers are due by June 6, 2022 at 2pm Pacific Daylight time.? Submit offers by email only to shelley.steen@usda.gov (O) Any and all questions regarding this solicitation shall be submitted in writing to Shelley Steen, Purchasing Agent, shelley.steen@usda.gov no later than May 30, 2022 at 2pm Pacific Daylight time.? (P) There is no site visit scheduled for this requirement.??"

column1: Services: Debris Removal, Waste, Disaster Recovery, Recycling, Shredding Bids,IL,Recycling and Related Services for Six Chicago Locations,Federal,,General Services Administration,"Jun 17, 2022",General Services Administration,https://sam.gov/opp/24ef7e2323a3430cb05f518e0322bbc0/view,"47PF0022R0050
column5: ",Purchasing,,866-606-8220,jujuan.robinson@gsa.gov,,"47PF0022R0050, Amendment 0002 - Please see attachments regarding?Amendment 0002 47PF0022R0050, Amendment 0001 - Please see attachments regarding?Amendment 0001. Solicitation The United States General Services Administration (GSA), Public Buildings Service (PBS) has a requirement for all management, supervision, labor and equipment to pick up mixed office paper, corrugated cardboard, and commingled glass, plastic, and aluminum, at least 4, to 20 times per month (dependent on building size). The recycling services will be for six federal buildings located in downtown Chicago, Illinois at 230 S. Dearborn St., 219 S. Dearborn St., 77 W. Jackson Blvd., 11 W. Quincy Ct., 536 S. Clark St., and 610 S. Canal St. This requirement will be fulfilled through the award of a single, firm fixed price contract for a base period of one year, with the possibility of options to extend the services for four additional, one year option periods at the sole discretion of GSA. The total duration of this contract could be for five years. This contract may contain line items for electronic equipment, techno-trash, commercial plastic, batteries, wooden pallets, and composting, which may be ordered during the life of the contract. This procurement is unrestricted and open to all business concerns. The NAICS code is 562111. The method of procurement will be a competitive, negotiated, Request for Proposal (RFP). Full details of this requirement and the evaluation factors will be provided in the solicitation package. The solicitation is posted on SAM.gov on May 6, 2022; the actual date for receipt of proposals will be stated in the solicitation. All interested vendors must be registered with this website in order to download the solicitation and amendments. Offerors will be responsible for downloading the solicitation and for monitoring SAM.gov for amendments and/or additional information.Offer due date and time for receipt of proposals will be stated within the solicitation. All responsible small business concerns may submit a proposal which shall be considered by the agency. All offerors must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM), located at www.sam.gov, in order to be considered for award. All offers are to be submitted electronically to JuJuan Robinson at jujuan.robinson@gsa.gov.? Any questions regarding this notification should be directed to the Contracting Officer."

column1: Services: Debris Removal, Waste, Disaster Recovery, Recycling, Shredding Bids,IL,"Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Refuse Services IL190 Quincy, IL",Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 8, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/73ea646682f6458b95b0577a89e28d4a/view,"W911SA-22-Q-3089
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,kaleigh.n.nicksic.civ@army.mil,,"Solicitation W911SA-22-Q-3089 will be issued on Wednesday, 1 June 2022, and can be accessed at www.sam.gov. This requirement is for Refuse Services at one (1) location in Illinois. The performance period is 1 July 2022 to 30 June 2023 with four (4) option years and a six (6) month option to extend services. Quotes shall be emailed to Kaleigh.n.nicksic.civ@army.mil. Quotes are due to the Government on or before the date/time listed on the solicitation in central time. It is the contractor?s responsibility to ensure their quote is received by the due date and time.? As an Addendum to FAR 52.212-1, contractor shall submit all items in accordance with the Supplemental Information by the solicitation closing date and time.? The contractor SHALL provide all required documents with submission of quotes. Signed SF 1449, Completed information from the Supplemental Information section Completed Price Schedule Attachment. Signed Amendments (if applicable) If all required documents are not provided with the quote submission, your quote MAY NOT be considered for award. Place of Performance; IL190 located at 2611 Weiss Lane Quincy, IL 62305. ***A site visit will be held Monday, 6 June 2022 at 10:00 AM Central Standard Time (CST).*** Written questions must be furnished to the Government no later 10:00 AM CST, Tuesday, 7 June?2022. Telephone, written or electronic request for hard copies of the solicitation documentation will be discouraged. Vendors interested in this solicitation should access www.sam.gov for issuance of the solicitation, associated documents and solicitation amendments. Vendors will not be directly notified of solicitation amendments."

Services: Debris Removal, Waste, Disaster Recovery, Recycling, Shredding Bids,IL,Recycling and Related Services for Six Chicago Locations,Federal,,General Services Administration,"Jun 6, 2022",General Services Administration,https://sam.gov/opp/c822eacbde2243229f423777f85c587f/view,"47PF0022R0050
column5: ",Purchasing,,866-606-8220,jujuan.robinson@gsa.gov,,"Solicitation The United States General Services Administration (GSA), Public Buildings Service (PBS) has a requirement for all management, supervision, labor and equipment to pick up mixed office paper, corrugated cardboard, and commingled glass, plastic, and aluminum, at least 4, to 20 times per month (dependent on building size). The recycling services will be for six federal buildings located in downtown Chicago, Illinois at 230 S. Dearborn St., 219 S. Dearborn St., 77 W. Jackson Blvd., 11 W. Quincy Ct., 536 S. Clark St., and 610 S. Canal St. This requirement will be fulfilled through the award of a single, firm fixed price contract for a base period of one year, with the possibility of options to extend the services for four additional, one year option periods at the sole discretion of GSA. The total duration of this contract could be for five years. This contract may contain line items for electronic equipment, techno-trash, commercial plastic, batteries, wooden pallets, and composting, which may be ordered during the life of the contract. This procurement is unrestricted and open to all business concerns. The NAICS code is 562111. The method of procurement will be a competitive, negotiated, Request for Proposal (RFP). Full details of this requirement and the evaluation factors will be provided in the solicitation package. The solicitation is posted on SAM.gov on May 6, 2022; the actual date for receipt of proposals will be stated in the solicitation. All interested vendors must be registered with this website in order to download the solicitation and amendments. Offerors will be responsible for downloading the solicitation and for monitoring SAM.gov for amendments and/or additional information.Offer due date and time for receipt of proposals will be stated within the solicitation. All responsible small business concerns may submit a proposal which shall be considered by the agency. All offerors must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM), located at www.sam.gov, in order to be considered for award. All offers are to be submitted electronically to JuJuan Robinson at jujuan.robinson@gsa.gov.? Any questions regarding this notification should be directed to the Contracting Officer."

Services: Debris Removal, Waste, Disaster Recovery, Recycling, Shredding Bids,KS,RILEY KS & MINOT ND Regional HW Removal and Disposal,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 9, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/7d0c99f77fad4000ac2761ba2c353f0d/view,"SP4500-22-R-0013
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,Amy.Corder@dla.mil,,"Amendment 0003 Extends the due date. Amendment 0002 Extends the due date. Amendment 0001 is issued to address questions received, to adjust the QTY for CLIN PC04C8 and to update the POC information for proposal submissions Combined Synopsis/Solicitation SP450022R0013 has been prepared in accordance with the procedures in FAR 12.603(c)(2)(i?xvi).? Work will consist of the removal, transportation, and disposal of government generated hazardous and non-hazardous wastes located on or around military installations or within a 50-mile radius of any pickup point listed on this contract in the states of Iowa, Kansas, Missouri, Nebraska, North Dakota, and South Dakota. The following additional information is provided in accordance with FAR 12.603(c)(2).? (i) ?????????? This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice.? This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. (ii) ????????? Solicitation SP450022R0013 is issued as a request for proposal (RFP). (iii) ???????? This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-05, effective March 07, 2022.? (iv) ???????? This acquisition is being issued as Full and Open Competition; the associated NAICS code is 562211; the small business size standard is $41.5M. (v) ????????? See the attached Price Schedule. (vi) ???????? See the solicitation for a description of the requirement. (vii) ?????? The contract is anticipated to have a 30-month base period from July 2022 to January 2025 and a 30-month option period.? See the solicitation for a list of pickup locations. (viii) ????? The provision at FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors -- Commercial, applies to this acquisition.? See the solicitation for addenda to the provision. (ix) ???????? The provision at 52.212-2, Evaluation -- Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition.? See the solicitation for addenda to the provision. (x) ????????? Offerors are advised to include a completed copy of the provision at FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications -- Commercial Items, Alternate I, with your offer. (xi) ???????? The clause at 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions -- Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition.? (xii) ??????? The clause at 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders -- Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition.? See the solicitation for 52.212-5 clauses applicable to this acquisition. (xiii) ????? See the solicitation for additional contract terms and conditions. (xiv) ????? The Defense Priorities and Allocations System (DPAS) is not applicable. (xv) ?????? Proposals are due by 1500 EST on May 20, 2022.? Proposals shall be emailed to amy.corder@dla.mil, and hazardouscontractswest@dla.mil.? (xvi) ????? Offerors must submit all questions regarding this solicitation in writing via email to? Steven Schultz at steven.schultz@dla.mil and Amy Corder at amy.corder@dla.mil.? The cut-off date for the receipt of offeror questions is 1500 EST on May 10,2022.? Questions received after that time may not receive an answer.?"

column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,504-426-0217,christopher.keck@usda.gov,,"Request for Proposal Disclosure of the magnitude of construction project: Between $100,000 and $250,000 Project location: This project is located at the Great Onyx Job Corps Civilian Conservation Center located 100 miles from Louisville, Kentucky. The offeror shall return the documents as outlined in the solicitation to be considered responsive to this solicitation. Proposals and the above documents shall be e-mailed to the following e-mail address: Christopher.keck@usda.gov"

column1: Services: Concessions, Food Services, Catering, Vending Bids,ND,Exclusive Soft Drink Pouring and Vending Rights Agreement,State/Local,,"Bismarck, North Dakota","Jul 20, 2022","Bismarck, North Dakota",https://www.bismarcknd.gov/bids.aspx?bidID=1036,"Bid
column4: Request for Proposals - Exclusive Soft Drink Pouring and Vending Rights Agreement

column1: Exclusive Soft Drink Pouring and Vending Rights Agreement ISSUE DATE: June 1, 2022

Introduction: The Bismarck Event Center (hereafter referred to as the “Event Center”) is issuing this Request For Proposals (RFP) to obtain written responses from interested parties for exclusive soft drink pouring and vending rights at the Event Center. For the purposes of this RFP, the “Event Center Facilities” refers to the Event Center Arena, the Exhibit Hall and the Belle Mehus Auditorium.

Project Description: The Event Center is seeking an exclusive beverage contract with a nationally recognized beverage company to create a partnership. This partnership includes exclusive soft drink pouring and vending rights as well as on-premises advertising opportunities.

Objectives: The Event Center intends to support its programs and goals through the pouring rights royalties, vending commissions and advertising opportunities provided to the Event Center for the period of the contract. In addition, the Event Center’s goal is to improve beverage services and sales by maximizing the availability of product and by developing and offering marketing and sales opportunities that benefit the Event Center and the beverage provider.

It is anticipated that an exclusive, long-term agreement for beverages will provide additional resources to support the Event Center’s operational and capital needs and in return the Event Center offers a business opportunity that can be beneficial to the selected vendor.

Beverages Covered: For the purposes of this RFP, ""Beverages"" means all carbonated and noncarbonated, frozen and unfrozen, natural or artificially-flavored nonalcoholic (less than 3% alcohol content) beverages for independent consumption and for use as mixers with alcoholic beverages and otherwise, including, but not limited to: nonalcoholic beverages with nutritive or nonnutritive sweeteners; packaged waters; natural or artificially flavored nonalcoholic fruit juices; fruit juice- containing drinks; fruit-flavored drinks (sweetened or unsweetened); 100% fruit juices, fruit punches and ades; hypertonic, hypotonic and isotonic energy and fluid replacement drinks (sometimes referred to as ""sports drinks""); packaged waters; bottled tea and coffee drinks and all drink or beverage bases, whether in the form of syrups, powders, crystals, concentrates or otherwise, from which any of the foregoing drinks and/or beverages are made.

Beverages do not include milk, flavored milk, milk-based products, brewed coffee, brewed tea, hot chocolate, fresh lemonade or any other beverage not expressly included in the definition of Beverages in this RFP. In addition, this does not include events with taste testings at trade shows or community events where we allow for free samples of the vendor’s product.

Exclusivity: “Exclusive” means the right to designate and supply the brand of Beverages to be served, sold, vended, dispensed or otherwise made available in the Bismarck Event Center Facilities for all events and all vending location. No other competitive products will be sold, dispensed or served at the Event Center Facilities including events served by caterers licensed by the Event Center except as agreed by the parties. In addition, this does not include events with taste testings at trade shows or community events where we allow for free samples of the vendor’s product.

No permanent advertising, signage, or trademark visibility for any competitive product will be authorized for display anywhere within the Event Center Facilities without the prior written approval from the Event Center Director and the selected vendor except for events with taste testings at trade shows or community events where we allow for the vendor’s booth signage to be displayed.

Responses to this RFP: Sealed proposals in response to this RFP, one (1) marked “ORIGINAL” and four (4) marked “COPIES, will be received at the office of the City Administrator, City of Bismarck, 221 North 5th Street, P.O. Box 5503, Bismarck, ND 58506-5503 until 3PM, July 20, 2022. Proposals arriving after that time will not be accepted. Each original shall be signed and dated by an official authorized to bind the proposer. Unsigned proposals will not be considered.
Proposals submitted via facsimile (FAX) machine, telephone, or electronic means, including but not limited to e-mail, in response to this RFP will not be accepted.
All proposals are subject to the provisions of this RFP/Instructions to Bidders and any amendments or additional information issued by the Event Center.

Site Visit: Proposers are invited to inspect the Event Center Facilities prior to submitting a response to determine all needs associated with the scope of work. Failure to inspect adequately shall not relieve a proposer from the necessity of furnishing and installing, without additional cost to the Event Center, any materials and equipment or performing any labor that may be required to carry out the intent of an agreement resulting from this RFP.
A Site Visit may be scheduled by contacting Charlie Jeske, Event Center Director at 701-355-1372 or by email at cjeske@bismarcknd.gov.

Questions: Submit all questions regarding this RFP in writing to Charlie Jeske at cjeske@bismarcknd.gov no later than Monday, July 18, 2022 at 12:00 noon. Please enter “Question for Beverage RFP as the subject line for an email.
Responses to all questions will be communicated to all persons who have supplied contact information to the Event Center. No telephone inquiries will be accepted.

Reference to Other Data: Only information which is received in response to this RFP will be evaluated. Reference to information previously submitted or submitted outside the response shall not be evaluated.

Cost for Proposal Preparation: Any costs incurred by proposers in preparing or submitting offers are the proposer’s sole responsibility; the Event Center or the City of Bismarck will not reimburse any bidder for any costs incurred prior to award.

Time for Acceptance: Each proposal shall state that it is a firm offer, which may be accepted within a period of 120 consecutive days from receipt by the Event Center. Although the contract is expected to be awarded prior to that time, the 120 consecutive day period is requested to allow for unforeseen delays.

Confidentiality of Proposals: In submitting its proposal, the bidder understands that, after all of the proposals have been open and read, the proposals or parts of the proposals not excepted by the North Dakota Open Records Law may be subject to disclosure upon request.

Right to Submitted Material: All responses, inquiries, or correspondence relating to or in reference to the RFP, and all other reports, charts, displays, schedules, exhibits, and other documentation submitted by the bidders shall become the property of the Event Center when received.

Proprietary Information: The Event Center recognizes that in responding to this RFP, the proposer may desire to provide proprietary information in order to clarify and enhance their response. To the extent permitted by law, the Event Center will keep confidential such information provided that:
The information submitted is arguably proprietary, and
The proprietary information is submitted in a separate book or section, and the separate book or section is clearly identified as containing proprietary information.

The reference to the proprietary information must be clearly made in the detailed response, and conversely the section in the proprietary information book shall be clearly labeled as to what in the detailed response it references.

Proposers should note that the City of Bismarck is a municipality, and as such its files are available for public review pursuant to the North Dakota Open Records Law. Proposers are cautioned to label as “proprietary” only that information which can be clearly demonstrated as being proprietary and not in common usage or common knowledge. Labeling as proprietary a complete proposal or information which is general in nature may be cause for rejection of a response.

Oral Presentations: All proposers should be prepared to present an oral presentation if requested by the Event Center prior to the award of the agreement. The oral presentation may be needed to supplement a proposal, if required, and shall be for proposal clarification purposes only.

Scope of Required Products and Services: The Event Center is seeking proposals from nationally recognized beverage companies to exclusively provide and sell specific beverages and/or soft drinks at the Event Center Facilities. The Event Center wishes to continue high levels of sponsorship and commission revenues through up-to-date equipment, efficient beverage marketing, sales and distribution, and competitive pricing and commissions as elements of an exclusive, long-term agreement. The successful proposer will apply its collective resources to continue to increase and improve the sale, service and availability of beverages at events at the Event Center Facilities.

It is the Event Center’s intention to establish a ten-(10) year agreement with a qualified beverage contractor (contractor) for the purpose of providing exclusive soft drink pouring and vending rights.
The successful proposer shall provide the following:

The contractor shall pay to the Event Center a lump sum payment, as a signing award, at the beginning of the agreement and an installment payment, as an exclusivity fee, each year on the anniversary date of the agreement for the entire period of the agreement. The proposal must contain a proposed signing award and annual exclusivity fee.

The contractor must provide a full list of all beverages intended to be served, sold, and distributed with the Proposal and the proposed pricing to the Event Center for each item including all Beverages, Approved Cups and related items.

The contractor shall provide a list of all equipment, including vending and dispensing equipment, that it would propose be located at Event Center facilities. All equipment provided by the contractor must be state of the art and in good operating condition.

The contractor must agree to provide, maintain, service and repair all equipment at the contractor’s expense. The contractor shall provide the labor and parts required for equipment repair at no charge to the Event Center. The contractor shall clean and service the soft drink dispensing and holding equipment. The contractor must work with the Event Center to provide appropriate inventory as needed by the Event Center.
The Event Center will provide such heat, water, electricity, and ventilation as are necessary and reasonable to operate the equipment and devices provided.

All losses of equipment supplied as a part of an agreement incurred by the contractor for whatever cause, including but not limited to fire, accident, theft or vandals, shall be the sole responsibility of the contractor.
In the proposal, the contractor should describe any contractor sponsored recycling programs available to the Event Center.

The proposal should describe the contractor’s program for repair service. At a minimum, the contractor should provide on call, as needed, vending and auxiliary equipment maintenance and repair service twelve (12) hours each day, seven days per week with a minimum response time of three hours.
The successful contractor will provide all necessary Approved Cups (trademark cups) for concession operations.

Advertising and Promotion: The contractor shall receive extensive visibility at the Event Center venues. The exclusive promotional and advertising rights for beverages includes the exclusive right to advertise and promote beverages in the Event Center Facilities including the following specific promotional rights:
Signage for Products:    Such signage shall include without limitation, the following: opportunity to name the Arena Catering Room.
two (2) sides of advertising panel measuring 4' H x 4' W each, to be located on the Bowen Avenue exterior marquee.
four (4) advertising digital spots to be located on the head scorer's table, Digital signage only, no permanent signage.
one (1) advertising panel measuring 3' H x 10' W, to be located on the 7th Street exterior marquee, Digital signage could be added.
one (1) advertising panel, measuring 4'H x 6'W, to be located on each of the east and west side of the south food court (total of two panels).
three (3) elevator door wraps located in A1 Lobby, Northwest Stair tower and Food Court freight elevator in the Arena.

If advertising space is remodeled or replaced, the contractor shall be entitled to the same or substantially similar advertising space on the replacement advertising space. In addition, this does not include events with taste testings at trade shows or community events where we allow for the vendor’s booth signage to be displayed.

Obligation to Maintain Signage: As owner, the Event Center shall maintain all scoreboards, signs and other advertising infrastructure in good order and repair. Print art, signs, panels or other materials supplied by the contractor shall be maintained or replaced by the contractor as necessary.

Point-of-Sale Advertising: Materials promoting beverages at the point-of-sale in the Event Center shall be clearly visible to the purchasing public and shall be displayed in a manner and location acceptable to the contractor.
Menu Board Advertising: The contractor’s beverages shall be prominently listed on the menu boards of all food and refreshment outlets at the Facility.

Approved Cups: Product Hawking: The Event Center shall ensure that all beverages served, sold or dispensed in cups at the Facility (including beverages sold, served or made available in locker rooms and players' benches) shall be served in Approved Cups.

Illuminated Signage: All lighted signs and panels promoting the contractor’s beverages shall be fully illuminated at all events in the Event Center Facilities for which any other signs are illuminated and scoreboard signs will be illuminated at any time the scoreboards are illuminated.

Access to Signage: The contractor shall have the right of access to its permanent signage at all reasonable times for the purpose of replacement or removal of the same or to modify, change or alter the promotional messages appearing thereon at the contractor’s cost and discretion.

The contractor shall have the right to promote the fact that it is a sponsor of the Event Center and the Facilities and that the beverages are available at the Event Center Facilities. Such promotion may occur on the packaging of (including cups) and at the point-of-sale of any and all beverages wherever they may be sold or served. Subject to the Event Center’s approval rights the Event Center will grant to the contractor a license to use the name and logos of the Event Center on a royalty-free basis, for the purposes of promoting the beverages in any and all packages in which they are sold, on promotional materials, packaging, premiums, electronic and print media and point- of-sale.
The contractor shall have the right to purchase prime location seating tickets to events that are held in the Event Center Facilities, when the Event Center controls ticketing to such events.

The Event Center will provide the contractor with 1/5th of the available message time during the operation of the electronic message centers w i t h i n t h e a r e n a and electronic message center of the scoreboard, at no additional expense. The Event Center also agrees to provide the contractor inclusion in the regular rotation on the two (2) outdoor marquees (5th and 7th Street marquees). The Event center shall cause its operators to program and display the contractor’s message on said message centers.
Permitted Exceptions: The following items shall be considered exceptions to the contractor’s exclusive rights as outlined in this RFP:

1 The Event Center shall have the right to make available for sale at the Event Center Facilities, (i) freshly brewed branded coffee, (ii) freshly brewed unbranded tea, (iii) milk, flavored milk or milk based products, (iv) hot chocolate, and (v) fresh lemonade, and (vi)alcohol beverages or other drinks not expressly defined as Beverages. This provision shall not be read to allow advertising or promotional rights with respect to such products except that trademarks for such products may be displayed on menu boards and on dispensing equipment.

2 The Event Center shall have the right to allow temporary signage, advertising or trademark display for competitive products to be displayed at the Event Center Facilities during up to five (5) ""Special Promotional Events"" (as hereinafter defined) per each year of the Agreement; provided, however, that the contractor’s exclusive promotional rights shall not be otherwise affected during such Special Promotional Events.  No competitive products may be sold during any such Special Promotional Event, but Competitive Products may be sampled during Special Promotional Events, provided that
such Competitive Products may not be sold through concession stands nor dispensed
through the contractor’s equipment. The Event Center agrees that the total number of
days which constitute Special Promotional Events shall not exceed a total of eight
(8) consecutive days in any Agreement Year of the Term.

As used herein, the term ""Special Promotional Event"" shall mean and be limited to (i) events which are part of a national multi-market/regional pre-sponsored touring show which is sponsored by a manufacturer or distributor of a competitive product or an affiliate thereof and for which advertising rights for a competitive product are mandated in a master agreement between such sponsor and the athletes or artists performing in such event, and (ii) locally sponsored charitable events held at the Event Center Facilities to the extent that such charitable events have preexisting agreements

with a competitive product. The Event Center shall provide the contractor with no less than thirty (30) days prior notice that it intends to designate an event as a special promotional event or events with taste testings at trade shows or community events
where we allow for free samples of the vendor’s product.

Account Manager and Personnel: The contractor shall provide during the life of the agreement one (1) person to serve as the day to-day primary liaison for issues regarding the agreement. This person must have the authority to make decisions on behalf of the contractor. This person should be identified in the RFP response.

The contractor shall be responsible for the supervision and control of its employees and agents at all times while on the premises of the Event Center. The contractor shall comply with all applicable government regulations related to the hiring, employment and compensation of its personnel. The Event Center reserves the right to request the removal of any contractor employee who fails to observe all policies and regulations of the Event Center.
Discounted Product: The contractor shall not furnish free or discounted beverages to Event Center Employees or City employees.

Records Retention and Inspection: The contractor shall maintain complete and accurate records in accordance with accepted industry accounting practices and shall keep all such financial records and statements pertaining to its operations at the Event Center for a period of five-(5) years from the close of each year’s operations. This shall include each vending transaction for each machine.
The City’s Chief Financial Officer shall have access all of the contractor’s records regarding
operations and sales at the Event Center during normal business hours and with reasonable notice. During the first quarter of each year, the contractor shall provide the Event center
with a complete accounting of all of the contractor’s operations at the Event Center for the previous year including a vending machine sale report and a concessions sales report.
Submitting the RFP: Each bidder shall present the response in the format as provided below:
Executive Summary: This shall be a letter from the contractor detailing its understanding of the scope of services as outlined in the RFP.

Corporate Background and Experience: This section shall include background information on the contractor’s firm. The bidder should give details of experience with other institutions on similar projects. In addition, this section should identify ownership of contractor’s firm.

Operations Plan: This section must include the proposed staffing, deployment and organization of contractor personnel to be assigned to service the Event Center. The proposer should detail the availability of its employees to service the Event Center both for routine issues and when called to an after-hour event. The proposer should present a clear and concise plan as to how it would service the Event Center including cleaning and maintenance of machines as well as inventory stocking and inventory control.

Equipment Proposal and Maintenance: The proposal should describe the specific equipment that will be used in vending locations of the Event Center Facilities including the number and model of each machine. The proposer should describe a maintenance program that specifies equipment and parts on-hand to meet emergencies and routine maintenance and repair issues that may arise during the life of the agreement.

Marketing Support: Describe who would provide marketing support, assistance and guidance for the Event Center. Describe the proposer’s vision of how marketing could help the Event Center maximize overall sales.

Additional Promotional Items: Describe in the proposal whatever additional support the proposer may provide in the sponsorship of events, banners for special events, seasonal promotions, T-shirts, and electronic message boards, athletic posters and schedule cards or any other promotional items would be made available to the Event Center. Describe what strategies would be proposed in the first year and the following years of the agreement.
Sample Reports: The proposer should attach samples of the reports that would be made available to the Event Center, in the format currently available.
Price list for all products to be served at the Event Center to include bottles, cans, bulk, cups, covers and related items.

References: The proposer shall provide contact information for current or former customers who are similar in size and operations to the Event Center that could assist the Event Center in the evaluation process.
Agreement Term: Any agreement resulting from this proposal shall be effective from September 1, 2022 and shall be for a term of 10 years from that date,
The contractor shall be responsible for all taxes (federal, state, and local) and license fees, or any other necessary expenses to the performance of this contract.
The agreement will be substantially in the form of the sample agreement attached to this RFP, subject to final negotiations between the successful proposer and the Event Center.

Annual Meeting: Annually by the end of the first quarter of each year, representatives of the Event Center and the contractor shall meet to review the financial reports, operations, promotions, marketing, and other plans or adjustments required for the upcoming year.
Selection: The selection of a contractor for award will be based upon an evaluation of the written proposal and oral interview, if offered. The factors to be considered during the review process are:
The proposed financial considerations. The Event Center requires a minimum initial payment of $100,000 and ten annual payments of $30,000 each year.
The proposed level of service to fit the needs of the Event Center and the proposer’s ability to provide that service including product pricing.
The proposer’s reputation in the industry.

Services: Concessions, Food Services, Catering, Vending Bids,PA,Food Service Management,State/Local,,"Lehigh County, Pennsylvania","Jul 13, 2022","Lehigh County, Pennsylvania",https://www.lehighcounty.org/Departments/Procurement/Bid-Advertisments,"(#22-017)

The County of Lehigh will receive sealed proposals until 4:00 P.M. Local Time, July 13, 2022, and will publicly open said proposals after 10:00 A.M. Local Time, July 14, 2022, for providing FOOD SERVICE MANAGEMENT at the Cedarbrook Senior Care and Rehabilitation Centers.
A complete set of Specifications may be downloaded for no charge via the View/Print option below.
A mandatory pre-proposal meeting and mandatory facility tours will be held June 13, 2022, as outlined below:
ü  Pre-proposal meeting at the Cedarbrook-Allentown facility (Main Lobby) located at 350 S. Cedarbrook Road, Allentown PA  18104, commencing at 10:00 A.M.
ü  Facility tour at Cedarbrook-Allentown will commence upon completion of the meeting, on or about 10:30 A.M.
ü  Facilty tour at Cedarbrook-Fountain Hill Main Lobby, will commence at 1:30 P.M.

Attendance will be limited to a maximum of four (4) representatives per firm. All representatives to the pre-proposal meeting must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and present either a COVID-19 vaccination card or digital image as proof.

In an attempt to safeguard all persons attending the pre-proposal meeting, attendees must abide by the same policies and procedures regarding COVID-19 as Lehigh County employees are expected to follow. The requirements include social distancing, proper face masks, temperature screenings prior to entry (if applicable), and adherence to all posted signage throughout County facilities.

column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com,,"This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The solicitation number is 392ndBCO00062022 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ), unless otherwise indicated herein. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 722320 with a small business size standard of $7.50M. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified sellers may submit bids. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2022-06-16 11:00:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be Tobyhanna, PA 18466 The MICC End User requires the following items, Brand Name or Equal, to the following: LI 001: Breakfast hot meal, delivered June 24,2022 2 Kosher Meals 138 hot meals 1 protein, 2 vegetables, 1 grain, 1 fruit, 1 dessert and water, 140, EA; LI 002: Lunch Hot meal, delivered June 24,2022 2 Kosher Meals 138 hot meals 1 protein, 2 vegetables, 1 grain, 1 fruit, 1 dessert and water, 140, EA; LI 003: Dinner hot meal, delivered June 24,2022 2 Kosher Meals 138 hot meals 1 protein, 2 vegetables, 1 grain, 1 fruit, 1 dessert and water, 140, EA; LI 004: Breakfast Hot meal, delivered June 25,2022 2 Kosher Meals 138 hot meals 1 protein, 2 vegetables, 1 grain, 1 fruit, 1 dessert and water, 140, EA; LI 005: Lunch hot meal, delivered June 25,2022 2 Kosher Meals 138 hot meals 1 protein, 2 vegetables, 1 grain, 1 fruit, 1 dessert and water, 140, EA; LI 006: Dinner Hot meal, delivered June 25,2022 2 Kosher Meals 138 hot meals 1 protein, 2 vegetables, 1 grain, 1 fruit, 1 dessert and water, 140, EA; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested Offerers must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, MICC End User intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. MICC End User is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerers that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerers that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerers that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerers may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should Offerers require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. This is currently an unfunded requirement with a high expectation that funds will be available. When and if funds become available a contract will be awarded at that time. The offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions: FAR 52.252-1, Solicitation. Provisions Incorporated by Reference; FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors; 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications; FAR 52.211-6, Brand name or Equal. The following clauses apply to this solicitation: FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions ? Commercial Items. The following FAR clauses in paragraph (b) of FAR clause 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, apply: 52.204-10, Reporting Executive Compensation and First Tier Subcontract Awards; 52.219-6, Notice of Total Small Business Set-Aside; 52.219-28, Post Award Small Business Program Rerepresentation; 52.222-3, Convict Labor; 52.222-19, Child Labor-Cooperation with Authorities and Remedies; 52.222-21, Prohibition of Segregated Facilities; 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity; 52.222-36, Affirmative Action for Workers with Disabilities; 52.225-13, Restrictions on Certain Foreign Purchases; 52.232-33, Payment by Electronic Funds Transfer--System for Award Management. 52.233-4, Applicable Law for Breach of Contract Claim; The following DFARS clauses apply: DFARS 252.04-7004, Alternate A System for Award Management; 252.211-7003, Item Identification and Valuation; 252.225-7002, Qualifying Country Sources as Subcontractors; 252.232-7010, Levies on Contract Payments; 252.203-7000, Requirements Relating to Compensation of Former DoD Officials; 252.225-7001, Buy American Act and Balance Of Payments Program; 252.225-7036, Buy American Act -- Free Trade Agreements -- Balance of Payments Program; 252.232-7003, Electronic Submission of Payment Requests; 252.247-7023, Primary and ALT III, Transportation of Supplies by Sea. IAW 52.204-7 System for Award Management (SAM) Registration (July 2013), the offeror must be registered in SAM and fully input their Representations and Certifications for a complete record. Information can be found at http://www.sam.gov or by calling 866-606-8220, or 334-206-7828 for international calls. 52.204-13 - System for Award Management Maintenance Shipping is FOB Destination CONUS (CONtinental U.S.). New Equipment ONLY. NO USED OR REMANUFACTURED PRODUCTS WILL BE ACCEPTED. Submitted Quotes will be valid for 45 days after the auction closing. This solicitation is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ), not an invitation for bid (IFB).). IAW FAR 52.252-2 Clauses Incorporated by Reference, for the extended description here is the website: https://www.acquisition.gov/ The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement can be found. The small business size standard for that NAICS code can be found at https://www.sba.gov/sites/default/files/files/Size_Standards_Table.pdf 5152.233-4000 AMC-LEVEL PROTEST PROGRAM (Feb 2014) (LOCAL CLAUSE) Prior to submitting an agency protest, it is preferable that you first attempt to resolve your concerns with the responsible contracting officer (Phone: (315)772-7272 or Email: usarmy.drum.acc-micc.mbx.micc@mail.mil). However, you may also file a protest to the Headquarters (HQ), Army Materiel Command (AMC). The HQ AMC-Level Protest Program is intended to encourage interested parties to seek resolution of their concerns within AMC as an Alternative Dispute Resolution forum, rather than filing a protest with the Government Accountability Office (GAO) or other external forum. Contract award or performance is suspended during the protest to the same extent, and within the same time periods, as if filed at the GAO. The AMC protest decision goal is to resolve protests within 35 calendar days from filing. To be timely, protests must be filed within the periods specified in FAR 33.103. If you want to file a protest under the HQ AMC-Level Protest Program, the protest must request resolution under that program and be sent to the address below. Headquarters U.S. Army Materiel Command Office of Command Counsel-Deputy Command Counsel 4400 Martin Road Rm: A6SE040.001 Redstone Arsenal, AL 35898-5000 Fax: (256) 450-8840 or email usarmy.redstone.usamc.mbx.protests@mail.mil The AMC-Level Protest procedures are found at: https://www.amc.army.mil/Connect/Legal-Resources/. If internet access is not available, contact the contracting officer or HQ, AMC to obtain the HQ AMC-Level Protest Procedures. ""52.204-9, Personal Identity Verification of Contractor Personnel; 52.204-10, Reporting Executive Compensation and First-Tier Subcontract Awards; 52.222-41, Service Contract Act; 52.237-2, Protection of Government Buildings, Equipment and Vegetation; 252.201-7000, COR Clause; 252.223-7006, Prohibition On Storage And Disposal Of Toxic And Hazardous Materials; 252.243-7001, Pricing of Contract Modifications; 252.246-7000, Material inspection and receiving report"" Representation by Corporations Regarding an Unpaid Tax Liability or a Felony Conviction under any Federal Law. (excluding the pallet), or exceeds 20 cubic feet, to comply with the requirements of Department of the Army Pamphlet 700-32 and MIL-STD-147E. IAW FAR 52.212-2; Evaluation - Commercial Items, the following factor shall be used to evaluate offers: technical capability of the item offered to meet the Government requirement and price. Technical capability is a pass fail requirement. Evaluation is based on a lowest price technically acceptable. No multiple awards will be made. Quotes received through Unison Marketplace will be evaluated and awarded on an ?all-or-nothing? basis. Wide Area WorkFlow Payment Instructions Please address your questions through the Unison Marketplace buy. If your questions are not being answered in a timely manner, please send your question to the S2P2 Contracting Officer - usarmy.drum.acc-micc.mbx.micc@army.mil or call 315-772-5582. In accordance with DFAR provision 252.225-7000 Buy American Act--Balance of Payments Program Certificate, I certify that each end product, except those listed in paragraphs (c)(2) or (3) of the attached provision, is a domestic end product. ****YOU MUST FILL OUT THE ATTACHED IF OTHER THAN DOMESTIC END PRODUCT IF YOU DO NOT FILL IT OUT AND YOU DELIVER OTHER THAN A DOMESTIC END PRODUCT YOUR DELIVERY WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED********** ****READ DFARs Clause 252.225-7001 to ensure your product comes from a QUALIFYING COUNTRY******* ****IF YOU QUOTE A PRODUCT OTHER THAN DOMESTIC FROM A NON-QUALIFYING COUNTRY YOUR QUOTE WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED***** Representation and Representation Disclosures The form(s) included in the buy must be returned with your quote. Failure to return the form(s) with your quote will result in your quote not being considered for award. Reporting During Contract Performance Equal Opportunity"

column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,blake.s.cromer.civ@army.mil,,"This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial supplies prepared in accordance with the format in Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotes are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. The solicitation number assigned to this action is W912QG-22-Q-0021. This acquisition is utilizing procedures in FAR Part 12 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ) from the United States Property and Fiscal Office for South Carolina, 9 National Guard Road, Columbia, S.C. 29201. This acquisition is made on an unrestricted basis, large or small business entities may provide a proposal. The applicable North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code is 722310 ? Food Service Contractors, with a size standard of $41.5M.The solicitation document and incorporated clauses and provisions are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06 dated 05/26/2022 ?? The South Carolina Army National Guard's (SCARNG) has a requirement for bulk rations for units annual training period at Poinsett Electronic Combat Range, 4001 Hwy 261 South, Wedgefield, SC 29168. The vendor shall make two deliveries: 7 July and 14 July, desired delivery time is 11:00a.m. Upon award the unit will coordinate with the vendor for desired items needed on each date/time. The Government intends to award a single Firm-Fixed Price contract without discussions. Therefore, offerors should submit their best offer up front. Do not assume you will be able to revise your offer. Pricing must be a fixed price for the entirety of work quoted. Award will be made only to responsible contractors meeting the conditions in FAR Part 9 and whose quote meets the requirements contained in the solicitations terms and conditions. Evaluations will be in accordance with FAR Subpart 13.106-2 and the criteria contained in FAR Provision 52.212-2, as shown in the attachment. Award will be made to the lowest priced offer that meets all the terms and conditions of the solicitation, especially in regards to providing all the items on the units order guide and ability to make all deliveries & times on the dates desired by the unit.? Past Performance will be evaluated utilizing a combination of information obtained from the Past Performance Information Retrieval System (PPIRS), and the Federal Awardee Performance and Integrity Information System. Award may be made without discussions. ? The attached Provisions and Clauses are applicable to this solicitation. SUBMISSION GUIDELINES: (1) Offerors shall read this solicitation, and all Provisions and Clauses thoroughly prior to submitting a proposal and before requesting additional information. The following provisions must be properly marked and returned with the offerors quote: ????? a. 52.204-24 ????? a. 52.212-3 Alt I ????? c. 252.204-7017 (2) Offerors shall provide a copy of the DHEC Facility Food Certification with their quote. (3) Offerors are highly encouraged to check System for Award Management (SAM) (https://sam.gov/content/home) on a daily basis for any modifications that may be made to the original solicitation posting. (4) IAW FAR 4.1102(a), all offerors shall be registered in SAM at time an offer or quotation is submitted or quote cannot be considered by the Government. (5) The solicitation closing date is 15 June 2022, 10:00a.m. (EST). (6) DO NOT upload proposals/offers to SAM send them directly to the Point of Contact (POC) Blake S. Cromer at blake.s.cromer.civ@mail.mil. (7) Offerors shall submit any requests for additional information by email to the aforementioned no later than (NLT)?8 June 2022, 11:00a.m. (ET), (questions or inquiries received by telephone will not be addressed). Information requested after this date will not be considered. All questions will be reposted to SAM for all to see that are considered to be of importance to all potential offerors. Any RFI?s received after this date & time are late and will not be considered. (8) Quotes shall be submitted under company letterhead, with CAGE code, DUNS number, FTID, Company Name, Address, POC and the solicitation number; (9) Offerors shall submit FFP price and discount terms (quote FOB Destination) for CLINs listed below. (10) Offerors shall review 252.213-7000 regarding Past Performance. There is no additional requirement to submit a history of past performance on similar projects. Past Performance will be evaluated utilizing a combination of information obtained from the Past Performance Information Retrieval System (PPIRS), and the Federal Awardee Performance and Integrity Information System (11) Prior to award, the offer shall have an active registration in SAM with no exclusions. (12) Offerors shall have electronic funds transfer (EFT) capability. Offerors shall be actively registered with Procurement Integrated Enterprise Environment (PIEE) (https://piee.eb.mil/) in order to submit invoices into Wide Area Work Flow (WAWF) for payment by the Government. Submit TOTAL FFP for the following CLIN(S): CLIN# Description Quantity U/M CLIN 0001 Bulk Rations per the attached ordering guide."

The Regional Training Institute (RTI) and South Dakota Army National Guard (SDARNG) has a requirement to support scheduled training with three meals daily. This requirement is achieved through contractor prepared and served meals at the Dining Facility on Camp Rapid, SD 57702 and Field Feeding at West Camp Rapid. The contractor shall provide all personnel, equipment, tools, materials, supervision, and quality control necessary, to perform Officer Candidate School (OCS) Meal Services. Presently it is anticipated that the proposal schedule will require proposals?for each of the following catagories: Breakfast Meal, Lunch Meal, Dinner Meal, and Sack Lunch/Dinner. The meals will be required during?the approximate time frame of July 16 - 29, 2022. With two potential Option Periods.? Potential contractor must complete the System for Award?Management (SAM) process prior to award of contract.? This acquisition shall be 100% small business set-aside. For NAICS 722310 for Food Service Contractor the small? business size standard is $38.SM. The vendor who is awarded the contract will be required to conduct a pre-performance meeting? scheduled approximately for July 12, 2022 at Camp Rapid, SD."
