column1: Supplies: Ammunition, Guns, Weapons, Flares Bids,TN,Holston Army Ammunition Plant - Facility Tour #3,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 30, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/7372392f17754cdab88013d0c3d4e886/view,"W52P1J-19-R-0142
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,benjamin.j.gillen.civ@army.mil,,"UPDATE 05/31/2022 - Holston Facility Tour #3 The Army Contracting Command - Rock Island, the Project Director Joint Services, and the Joint Munitions Command intend to host a third facility tour the week of July 19-21, 2022 for the planned competition for the production of explosives and the operation of HSAAP beginning in Calendar Year 2024. Interested participants must register by completing the Company Registration Form, Individual Registration Form, and HSAAP Request for Access Form accompanying this announcement. Completed registration forms shall be submitted electronically to Ben Gillen at benjamin.j.gillen.civ@army.mil and Jacob Harrison at jacob.t.harrison15.civ@army.mil no later than June 30, 2022. Each participant?s request must be approved by the Government prior to attendance. Late registrations will not be considered. UPDATE 04/21/2022 - Request for Information: Holston Facility Tour #3 The Government intends to hold a third on-site tour of the HSAAP facility in support of its upcoming competition. In an effort to maximize the value of this event, the Government is requesting specific feedback from industry on the manner in which tours should be conducted. Topics the Government is requesting feedback on include the following: Timing of event in relation to current competition milestones. In the event a second draft RFP is released, please identify if a tour is preferred prior to or after its release. Structure of event, to include the number of days and method of tour (i.e. building walkthrough, tour with equipment running or shut down, etc.). Tour locations, to include specific building locations and/or production processes, preferred sequence of viewing each location/process, time spent within each location, and specific information requested for each building to support tour narrative development. Desire for a fourth facility tour and the timing of the event in relation to current competition milestones. The Government requests submittal of feedback via email to Ben Gillen at benjamin.j.gillen.civ@army.mil and Jacob Harrison at jacob.t.harrison15.civ@army.mil no later than close of business on April 28, 2022. UPDATE 03/22/2022 - HSAAP Modernization Update This posting provides an updated schedule for ongoing modernization projects at Holston.? UPDATE 03/16/2022 - HSAAP Update This posting is being updated to include a revised milestone schedule for the Holston competition. One-on-one sessions, which were previously postponed, are rescheduled for the week of 18 April 2022. The contracting office will coordinate with each company that had previously registered to establish one-on-one times.? UPDATE 01/21/2022 - HSAAP Industry Day #3 Update Industry Day #3, to include Facility Tours and one-on-one meetings, have been postponed due to concerns with COVID-19. The Facility Tours have been rescheduled for March 1-3, 2022 with the intent to hold one-on-one discussions the week of March 7th.? Previous registrations will remain valid for this event and there is no requirement to revalidate submissions. The registration deadline has been extended to February 4, 2022 for any additional companies or individuals who wish to participate. Please continue to utilize the registration forms provided in the initial Industry Day #3 announcement provided on December 3, 2022. Please contact?both?Ben Gillen at benjamin.j.gillen.civ@army.mil and Jacob Harrison at jacob.t.harrison15.civ@army.mil if you have any questions.? UPDATE 01/07/2022 This posting is being updated to include Q&As from Industry Day #2. UPDATE 12/03/2021 - HSAAP Industry Day #3 The Army Contracting Command - Rock Island, the Project Director Joint Services, and the Joint Munitions Command will be hosting a 3rd Industry Day for the planned competition for the production of explosives and the operation of HSAAP beginning in Fiscal Year 2023. The event will include HSAAP facility tours February 1-4, 2022, followed by virtual one-on-one sessions the week of February 7, 2022.??A detailed agenda and schedule for both the tours and one-on-one sessions will be provided at a later date. Please see the attachment 'HSAAP Industry Day 3 Announcement' for further details.? Pre-registration is required for industry day attendance and participation in one-on-one sessions. Participants must register by completing the attached Company?Registration form, Individual Registration form,?and? HSAAP Request for Access form (if touring). All completed registration forms shall be submitted electronically to both?Ben Gillen at benjamin.j.gillen.civ@army.mil and Jacob Harrison at jacob.t.harrison15.civ@army.mil no later than January 4, 2022. UPDATE 07/15/2021 - HSAAP Industry Day #2 The Army Contracting Command - Rock Island, the Project Director Joint Services, and the Joint Munitions Command will be hosting a virtual Industry Day on September 15, 2021 for the planned competition for the production of explosives and the operation of the HSAAP to be awarded in Fiscal Year 2023. Industry Day will consist of an acquisition strategy briefing via Microsoft Teams, with one-on-one sessions following. The briefing will begin at 9:30 AM EDT. A detailed agenda and schedule of one-on-one sessions will be provided at a later date. Pre-registration is required for industry day attendance and participation in one-on-one sessions. Participants must register by completing the attached company and individual registration forms. All completed registration forms shall be submitted electronically to Ben Gillen at benjamin.j.gillen.civ@mail.mil and Jacob Harrison at jacob.t.harrison15.civ@mail.mil no later than September 1, 2021. UPDATE 06/09/2021 The 'HSAAP Facility Tour Announcement' attachments have?been updated to include the HSAAP Facility Tour Attendee List and HSAAP Facility Tour Narrative.? UPDATE 04/06/2021 The?'HSAAP Facility Tour Announcement' file has been revised to update the requirements for foreign participation.? UPDATE 3/16/2021 The Army Contracting Command - Rock Island, the Project Director Joint Services, and the Joint Munitions Command intend to host facility tours for the planned competition for the production of explosives and the operation of the HSAAP beginning in Fiscal Year 2023. The HSAAP facility tours are expected to occur the week of May 10-14, 2021. Please see the attached documents for additional details and registration information.? Edit: 3/17/2021 - Registration forms and Facility Tour Announcement have been updated to correct POC information. UPDATE 1/8/2021 This posting is being updated to include Q&As from Industry Day #1.?? UPDATE 12/28/2020 RFI - HSAAP Facility Tours Due to COVID-19 impacts, to date the Government has been unable to conduct tours of the HSAAP facility in support of its upcoming competition. In order to maximize the value of tours moving forward, the Government is requesting specific feedback from industry on the manner in which tours should be conducted. Topics the Government is seeking feedback on include, but are not limited to, the following: Number of visits and timing of each (i.e. immediately, pre-RFP release, post-RFP release, etc.) Tour duration (one day, two days, one week, etc.) Tour structure (i.e. on-site windshield tour, on-site building walkthrough, tour with equipment running or shut down, etc.). With your response, please identify those options which are non-value added. If on-site tours cannot be held and/or if offerors are not allowed in production buildings due to safety/security concerns, is there value in a virtual tour. The virtual tour would consist of an overview HSAAP buildings and facilities, to include utility maps, virtual maps, and pictures. Due to the sensitivity of data provided, the virtual tour would be held on-site at HSAAP. Areas of the plant to be seen and the amount of time spent in each specified area Number of individuals needed to maximize tour value Data/information needed to maximize tour value and support proposal development (i.e. equipment data, BFA/BECA, PWS, IP, etc.). If citing IP, please be specific. Impact of tours on proposal development. If facility tours are not able to be conducted due to COVID-19 impacts and/or if offerors are not allowed in production buildings due to safety/security concerns, please identify the impact it will have on your proposal decision. Industry concerns with COVID-19. Please identify any health or safety concerns you may have with COVID-19, to include your willingness to travel, take a COVID test, and quarantine prior to plant access (if required). The Government requests submittal of feedback via email to Ben Gillen at benjamin.j.gillen.civ@mail.mil and Jacob Harrison at jacob.t.harrison15.civ@mail.mil no later than close of business on January 12, 2021. UPDATE 10/27/2020 Attendee list included in attachments. Holston Army Ammunition Plant Industry Day #1 The Army Contracting Command - Rock Island, the Project Director Joint Services, and the Joint Munitions Command will be hosting a virtual Industry Day on October 20, 2020 for the planned competition for the production of explosives and the operation of the HSAAP beginning in Fiscal Year 2023. Industry Day will consist of a live, virtual acquisition strategy briefing via Microsoft Teams, with one-on-one sessions following. The virtual briefing will begin at 9:00 AM EDT. A detailed agenda and schedule of one-on-one sessions will be provided at a later date. Pre-registration is required for industry day attendance and participation in one-on-one sessions. Participants must register by completing the attached company and individual registration forms. Participants are also encouraged to submit questions and/or comments regarding Industry Day briefing charts and the HSAAP procurement in advance of the event by utilizing the attached Question/Comment Form. The Government intends to answer all questions received during the general briefing. The Government is working to allow interested contractors access to Holston AAP as early as 27 October for tours of the facilities. Additional details will be provided when available. All completed registration forms and questions/comments shall be submitted electronically to Ben Gillen at benjamin.j.gillen.civ@mail.mil and Jacob Harrison at jacob.t.harrison15.civ@mail.mil no later than October 7, 2020."

column3: ",Purchasing,,717-787-5733,,,"This request for proposals (RFP) provides to those law firms interested in submitting proposals for the subject procurement (?Offerors?) sufficient information to enable them to prepare and submit proposals for the Department of General Service?s consideration on behalf of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania (?Commonwealth?) to satisfy a need for legal matters relating to structuring and documenting investment transactions for the Ben Franklin Technology Development Authority (?BFTDA?) and other BFTDA related matters. column1: Consulting: Real Estate, Structure, Facility, Purchase and Lease Bids,PA,Purchase of Vacant Land,State/Local,,"Kingston, Pennsylvania","Jun 15, 2022","Kingston, Pennsylvania",https://kingstonpa.org/,"Bids
column3: ",,,,,,"LEGAL NOTICE INVITATION TO BID The Municipality of Kingston will be accepting sealed bids for the purchase of vacant land located at 52 - 54 South Atherton Avenue, Kingston, PA 18704. PIN: H9NE1-012 013. All bids must be received in the Business Office of the Municipality of Kingston located at 500 Wyoming Avenue, Kingston, Luzerne County, PA 18704 by 9:30 a.m. on June 15, 2022. All bids must include a Cashier's Check, Money Order or Bid Bond in the amount of $1,000.00 made payable to the Municipality of Kingston, which will be forfeited if the Bidder fails to complete the purchase. The bids will be publicly opened by the Administration of the Municipality of Kingston, 500 Wyoming Avenue, Kingston, PA 18704 on June 15, 2022 at 10:00 a.m. in Kingston Council Chambers. A Resolution to approve a successful bid will be presented at a Special Meeting of the Town Council of the Municipality of Kingston to be held on June 20, 2022. The minimum acceptable bid is $22,000.00 and the successful bidder will be the highest amount in excess of $22,000.00. Kingston's title to the land is based on a Quit Claim Deed. The Deed for the property will contain a covenant restricting the use of the property to a single family residence with construction to begin within six (6) months of the date of the Deed. Bid documents may be obtained at the Secretary's Office of the Municipality of Kingston. The Municipality of Kingston reserves the right to reject any and all bids. Valerie Norton, Municipal Secretary"

column1: Consulting: Real Estate, Structure, Facility, Purchase and Lease Bids,PA,"USDA Seeks to Lease Office and Related Space in Bedford County (Bedford, PA)",Federal,,Department of Agriculture,"Sep 30, 2022",Department of Agriculture,https://sam.gov/opp/ff5757fc97d04b4291cab290aa698837/view,"57-42009-21-FA-RLP
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,504-426-0217,shannon.schoening@usda.gov,,"RLP AMENDMENT NO.1 (05/06/2022) Attached is the Request for Lease Proposal 57-42009-21-FA (RLP) RLP Amendment No. 1 memorializing changes made in accordance with paragraph 1.07 of the RLP.? These changes include extension of the due date for offers and incorporation of Design Intent Drawings prepared by the Offeror prior to lease award.? Unless where otherwise stated in the RLP Amendment No. 1, the terms and conditions stated in the RLP shall remain unchanged. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Attached is the Request for Lease Proposal 57-42009-21-FA (RLP) for leasehold interest in office and related space in Bedford, Bedford County, Pennsylvania.? The RLP contains all leasing requirements and specifications.? All offers must be submitted not later than the due date and time established in the RLP.? Any offers received beyond this date are subject to rejection. Unsolicited offers must confirm they are within the delineated Area of Performance and not within a floodplain.? The USDA reserves the right to reject any unsolicited offer."

column1: Consulting: Real Estate, Structure, Facility, Purchase and Lease Bids,SD,Lease of Office Space within Region 8. Request for Lease Proposals (RLP) #22-REG08 - OFFICE SPACE,Federal,,General Services Administration,"Jun 7, 2022",General Services Administration,https://sam.gov/opp/c1f0e6937df44314b6c889c497a8c7f8/view,"2SD0119
column5: ",Purchasing,,866-606-8220,johnc.shin@gsa.gov,,"This advertisement is hereby incorporated into the RLP 22-REG08 by way of reference as an RLP attachment. U.S. GOVERNMENT seeks to lease the following office space through the Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP): City: Sioux Falls State: SD??????????????????? ??? Delineated Area:???? NORTH: E. 11th Street, EAST: S. 1st Avenue, SOUTH: W. 13th Street, WEST: S. Main Avenue. Minimum ABOA Sq. Ft.:???? 1,900 Maximum ABOA Sq. Ft.:??? 2,200 Space Type:????????????????????? Office Term*:????? 15 years, 13 firm Amortization Term: 8 years for Tenant Improvements? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ?? *Offerors are encouraged to submit rates for all terms available in the AAAP for consideration against future GSA requirements. Agency Unique Requirements:????none Agency Tenant Improvement Allowance:? ? $59.84 per ABOA SF IMPORTANT NOTES: Offerors are advised to familiarize themselves with the telecommunications prohibitions outlined under Section 889 of the FY19 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), as implemented by Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR). For more information, visit: https://acquisition.gov/FAR-Case-2019-009/889_Part_B Offerors are advised that all Shell work associated with delivering the Tenant Improvements are at the Lessor?s cost.? Please refer to Section 3?(Construction Standards and Shell Components)?and specifically to Paragraph 3.07?(Building Shell Requirements)?of the?AAAP RLP Attachment #2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA?Form L100_AAAP ) for more detail.? Tenant Improvement Components are detailed under Section 5 of the? AAAP RLP Attachment?#2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA?Form L100_AAAP) .? ? It is highly recommended that offerors start the SAM registration process directly following the offer submission. Refer to RLP Clause 3.06, Item 7. HOW TO OFFER: The Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP), located at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap, will enable interested parties to offer space for lease to the Federal Government in response to the FY22 AAAP RLP.? In addition, the Government will use its AAAP to satisfy the above space requirement. Offerors must go to the AAAP website, select the ?Register to Offer Space? link and follow the instructions to register.? Instructional guides and video tutorials are offered on the AAAP homepage and in the ?HELP? tab on the AAAP website. Once registered, interested parties may enter offers during any ?Open Period?. For technical assistance with AAAP, email LOP.help@gsa.gov. The Open Period is the 1st through the 7th of each month, ending at 7:30 p.m. (ET) unless otherwise stated by the Government and unless the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday. If the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday, the Open Period will end at 7:30 PM (ET) on the next business day. Refer to AAAP RLP paragraph 3.02.A for more details on the offer submission process. The Government reserves the right to allow for multiple Open Periods prior to selecting an offer for award to meet this specific space requirement.? Offers cannot be submitted during the Closed Period and will not be considered for projects executed during that time period. Lease award will be made to the lowest price, technically acceptable offer, without negotiations, based upon the requirements in this advertisement and in the RLP requirements package found on the AAAP website.? During an Open Period, offerors will be permitted to submit new offers or modify existing offers.? Offerors can draft an offer at any time; however, you can only submit an offer during the Open Period. The offered space must comply with the requirements in this advertisement and the RLP and must meet Federal Government, State, and Local jurisdiction requirements, including requirements for fire and life safety, security, accessibility, seismic, energy, and sustainability standards in accordance with the terms of the Lease.? The Lease and all documents that constitute the Lease package can be found at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap. ?If you have previously submitted an offer in FY 2021, the AAAP application has a copy feature which will allow existing offers to be copied over to the FY 2022 RLP in order to avoid having to re-enter all of the data manually. Please be sure to review FY22 AAAP RLP Package and each page within the AAAP Application prior to submitting your offer as some of the questions have changed. Agency Unique Requirements:????none Agency Tenant Improvement Allowance:? ? $59.84 per ABOA SF HOW TO OFFER: The Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP), located at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap, will enable interested parties to offer space for lease to the Federal Government in response to the FY22 AAAP RLP.? In addition, the Government will use its AAAP to satisfy the above space requirement. Offerors must go to the AAAP website, select the ?Register to Offer Space? link and follow the instructions to register.? Instructional guides and video tutorials are offered on the AAAP homepage and in the ?HELP? tab on the AAAP website. Once registered, interested parties may enter offers during any ?Open Period?. For technical assistance with AAAP, email LOP.help@gsa.gov. The Open Period is the 1st through the 7th of each month, ending at 7:30 p.m. (ET) unless otherwise stated by the Government and unless the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday. If the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday, the Open Period will end at 7:30 PM (ET) on the next business day. The Government reserves the right to allow for multiple Open Periods prior to selecting an offer for award to meet this specific space requirement.? During an Open Period, offerors will be permitted to submit new offers or modify existing offers.? Offerors can draft an offer at any time; however, you can only submit an offer during the Open Period. column5: ",Purchasing,,866-606-8220,eulando.hayes@gsa.gov,,"U.S. GOVERNMENT General Services Administration (GSA) seeks to lease the following space: State: TN City: Nashville Delineated Area: North:? 7th Avenue North and Charlotte Avenue West:?? 9th Avenue North and Church Street East:?? column1: Consulting: Real Estate, Structure, Facility, Purchase and Lease Bids,TN,X1AZ--36C249-22-AP-0044 - 614-22-4-5820-0001 - Millington CBOC Lease (VA-20-00099918),Federal,,Department of Veterans Affairs,Today ,Department of Veterans Affairs,https://sam.gov/opp/6be36c1f31c24ced817428aaed44bee6/view,"36C24922R0006
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-461-4300,Martin.Frazier@va.gov,,"The VA Medical Center Memphis is seeking to lease 33,901 rentable square feet (25,112 (ANSI/BOMA) of clinic space in Millington Tennessee for use by Tenant for personnel, furnishings, and equipment. The lease should be an existing building space. The space can be on adjacent levels. The space/building shall meet all current building, seismic, and ADA code requirements. A lease for up to 10 years will be considered, five (5) years firm and five (5) years non-firm."

column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,edward.lerma@us.af.mil,,"This is a solicitation Invitation For Bid (IFB) requirement for a Swing Space for the Special Warfare Training Squadron, located at JBSA Lackland AFB, TX. ?The Swing Space must meet the requirements and specifications IAW the following attachments: Attachment 1 - PWS B147 Swing Space Facility, Attachment 2 - B147 Swing SpaceFloor Plan Addendum 01, Attachment 3 - B147 Swing Space Site Location, Attachment 4 - Swing Space Location & Layout, Attachment 5 - TELECOMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS CABLING STANDARDS 15 June 21, Attachment 6 - UFC 3-380-01, Attachment 7 -2020-03-25 JBSA Label Diagram,? Attachment 8 - Questions and Answers from Synopsis - Swing Space B147. Please Note: ? ? - Appendix 3 - Revised 16007.222-GI103__Swing Space.dwg are the CADD drawings for the Swing Space Requirement.? ? ? - Appendix 4 -?2022-05-02_100percent Construction Plans are the plans for the infrastructure contract If you have any questions, please submit question IAW the instructions stated in Section H of the solicitation IFB.? All bids must be submitted IAW the instructions and at the location stated in Section H of the solicitation IFB, and must have the all requested documents completed.? For Bidders who choose to call into the Bid Opening, please call call-in number 210-925-1221 No Later Than 10:15am CT. (No access code or chairperson pins are needed with Meet-Me numbers. The phone will continue to ring for first person trying to join the meeting until a second person tries to connect. Once two people are on the line, others may join in without issue.) column1: Consulting: Real Estate, Structure, Facility, Purchase and Lease Bids,TX,Long Term Evolution (LTE) Request for Information (RFI) for Remaining Air Force Installations,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 20, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/116691afaf9140e286bc57417fc7712f/view,"AFCEC-22-R-0003
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,tonda.sallee.1@us.af.mil,,"The purpose of this RFI is to solicit input from the telecommunications industry to assist in developing a strategy for commercial cellular deployment on Air Force property. The Air Force requires coverage on all sites regardless of location or population. The Air Force team realizes each installation represents a differing business opportunity for cellular providers. The information requested via this RFI will assist the Air Force with assessing industry?s capability of expanding and constructing additional wireless infrastructure, while also working the current opportunities to lease."

column1: Consulting: Real Estate, Structure, Facility, Purchase and Lease Bids,TX,Lease of Office Space within Region 7. Request for Lease Proposals (RLP) #22-REG07 - OFFICE SPACE,Federal,,General Services Administration,"Jul 7, 2022",General Services Administration,https://sam.gov/opp/5823206bc1f0443ebaf198bac7915537/view,"22-REG07_1TX2656
column5: ",Purchasing,,866-606-8220,edward.budzinski@gsa.gov,,"This advertisement is hereby incorporated into the RLP 22-REG07 by way of reference as an RLP attachment. U.S. GOVERNMENT seeks to lease the following office space through the Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP): City:?? ?Richardson State:?? ?TX ? ? ? ? ? ? ??? ? Delineated Area:?? ?North: I75 & PGBT to S Garland Ave & PGBT East: Garland Ave & PGBT to S Garland Ave and I635 South: S Garland Ave & I635 to I635 and I75 ??? ??? ??? ??? ??? ?West: I75 & I635 to I75 & PGBT Minimum ABOA Sq. Ft:?? ?4,350 Maximum ABOA Sq. Ft:?? ?4,350 Space Type:?? ?Office Term*:?? ?15 years, 13 years firm? Amortization Term:?? ?8 years for both Tenant Improvements and Building Specific Amortized Capital ?? Agency Unique Requirements:?? ?None. Agency Tenant Improvement Allowance ? ? ? ? ? ? ?Existing leased space: ? ? ? ?? ?$50.456510 per ABOA SF Other locations offered: ? ? ??? ?$50.456510 per ABOA SF ? Building Specific Amortized Capital (BSAC) ? ? ? ??? ?Existing leased space: ? ? ? ??? ?$0 per ABOA SF Other locations offered: ? ? ? ?? ?$0 per ABOA SF ? IMPORTANT NOTES:? Offerors are advised to familiarize themselves with the telecommunications prohibitions outlined under Section 889 of the FY19 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), as implemented by Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR). For more information, visit: https://acquisition.gov/FAR-Case-2019-009/889_Part_B. Offerors are advised that all Shell work associated with delivering the Tenant Improvements are at the Lessor?s cost. ?Please refer to Section 3 (Construction Standards and Shell Components) and specifically to Paragraph 3.07 (Building Shell Requirements) of the AAAP RLP Attachment #2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA Form L100_AAAP ) for more detail. ?Tenant Improvement Components are detailed under Section 5 of the ?AAAP RLP Attachment #2 titled ""Lease Contract"" (GSA Form L100_AAAP) . ? ? It is highly recommended that offerors start the SAM registration process directly following the offer submission. ?Refer to RLP Clause 3.06, Item 7. (If applicable) The Government intends to award a Lease to an Offeror of a Building that is in compliance with Seismic Standards. Section 2.03 of the Request for Lease Proposals (RLP) outlines compliance activities required for all leases in moderate or high seismic zones. To determine if your property lies in a moderate or high zone, please reference the map and documents on our website. ? HOW TO OFFER:? The Automated Advanced Acquisition Program (AAAP), located at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap, will enable interested parties to offer space for lease to the Federal Government in response to RLP 22-REG07. ?In addition, the Government will use its AAAP to satisfy the above space requirement.? Offerors must go to the AAAP website, select the ?Register to Offer Space? link and follow the instructions to register. ?Instructional guides and video tutorials are offered on the AAAP homepage and in the ?HELP? tab on the AAAP website. Once registered, interested parties may enter offers during any ?Open Period?. For technical assistance with AAAP, email LOP.help@gsa.gov. ? The Open Period is the 1st through the 7th of each month, ending at 7:30 p.m. (ET) unless otherwise stated by the Government and unless the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday. If the 7th falls on a weekend or Federal Holiday, the Open Period will end at 7:30 PM (ET) on the next business day. Refer to AAAP RLP paragraph 3.02.A for more details on the offer submission process. The Government reserves the right to allow for multiple Open Periods prior to selecting an offer for award to meet this specific space requirement. ?Offers cannot be submitted during the Closed Period and will not be considered for projects executed during that time period. Lease award will be made to the lowest price, technically acceptable offer, without negotiations, based upon the requirements in this advertisement and in the RLP requirements package found on the AAAP website. ?During an Open Period, offerors will be permitted to submit new offers or modify existing offers. ?Offerors can draft an offer at any time; however, you can only submit an offer during the Open Period. The offered space must comply with the requirements in this advertisement and the RLP and must meet Federal Government, State, and Local jurisdiction requirements, including requirements for fire and life safety, security, accessibility, seismic, energy, and sustainability standards in accordance with the terms of the Lease. ?The Lease and all documents that constitute the Lease package can be found at https://lop.gsa.gov/aaap. ?If you have previously submitted an offer in FY 2021, the AAAP application has a copy feature which will allow existing offers to be copied over to the FY 2022 RLP in order to avoid having to re-enter all of the data manually. Please be sure to review FY22 AAAP RLP Package and each page within the AAAP Application prior to submitting your offer as some of the questions have changed. You must re-enter your space and rates on the ?Space and Rates? tab in the AAAP. Your previous offered space will not be copied. CONTACTS: Lease Contracting Officer: Ed Budzinski Edward.budzinski@gsa.gov 505-248-7359 Project Manager: Dennis Harper Dennis.harper@gsa.gov 817-978-8749 ?"

column1: Consulting: Education, Training, Testing, Leadership Bids,TX,Veterinary Support To Stability Operations (VSSO) Course,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 8, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/85e2f3917b2d44ee974fb3cf66ab6aec/view,"PANCHA-22-P-0000-005
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,gerry.d.coleman.civ@mail.mil,,"The Regional Health Contracting Office Central (RHCO-C), on behalf of Division Of Veterinary Sciences (DVS), JBSA Fort Sam Houston, TX, is conducting a Source Sought to determine interest for non-personal services contract to provide Veterinary Support To Stability Operations (VSSO) Course. The Veterinary Support To Stability Operations (VSSO) Course will provide education and training support services for various uniformed service veterinary personnel in accordance with performance work statement. The applicable North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code is 611430 Professional and Management Development Training. The Small Business Administration's size standard for NAICS 611430 is $12 million. Interested and qualified vendors shall submit product literature, and all pertinent information listed below, including company name, address, telephone number, contact point and DUNS number of your company. THIS IS A SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE ONLY. This notice does NOT constitute a request for proposal, request for quote, or invitation for bid. No formal solicitation document exists at this time. The Government will not pay for any information solicited. Contractors that can provide RHCO-C with the required training are invited to electronically submit an affirmative, written response indicating a bona fide ability to meet this specific requirements listed in the performance work statement. Responses should appear on company letterhead and include, at minimum, affirmation of active registration in the System for Award Management (SAM), Cage Code, your Data Universal qualifications, and any applicable technical data. All responses should include a point of contact, telephone number, and electronic mail address. Additionally, respondents should indicate whether they are a large business, small business, small disadvantaged business, 8(a) concern, women-owned small business, HUBZone, service disabled veteran-owned small business, or qualify as socially or economically disadvantaged and whether they are U.S. or foreign-owned. All responsible sources may respond to this sources sought and all responses will be considered by the agency. Responses should be furnished electronically to Gerry Coleman at Gerry.d.coleman.civ@mail.mil no later than 12:00 PM Central Daylight Time, 8 June 2022."

HISD is requesting to provide Pre-K – 12th grade Professional Development /Services and Support Materials, as applicable, related to Mathematics, Science, Language Arts, Special Education and Social Studies. Support materials include but are not limited to: testing materials, digital copies, software/online resources, teaching tools, workbooks, study guides, books, training consultants, and other professional learning services and support materials. Also include support materials to address the needs of all diverse learners to include, but not limited to: English Language Learners, Migrant Education, Single Gender Education, Special Education, Dyslexia, Pre-Advanced Placement, Counseling, Career Technical Education (CTE), Fine Arts, Advanced Placement and advanced learning for GT students."

The Harlandale Independent School District (“HISD” or “District”) seeks to provide speech therapy (consult and direct) and evaluations to students with disabilities who ARDC deems appropriate. The District seeks qualified and licensed speech therapy service providers to implement children’s speech therapy individualized educational plans, conduct evaluations/eligibility per District and Federal Educational guidelines, and attend meetings with multi-disciplinary teams to discuss such services. Speech providers must follow District standards for assessment/evaluation/eligibility and if eligible, develop individualized educational plans for those students eligible for services. Speech provider must comply with timeline for services per federal law. Completed evaluations and documentation must be submitted prior to billing."

The Houston-Galveston Area Council, the fiscal agent for the Gulf Coast Workforce Board, is issuing this Solicitation on behalf of the Board and Workforce Solutions and is seeking a qualified contractor to perform professional services for the Workforce Solutions system. Any subsequent contract awarded under this solicitation will be executed with the Houston-Galveston Area Council as the contracting entity.

The Workforce Solutions system is made up of contractors, partners, and vendors operating under a franchise model that governs how staff deliver service under the Workforce Solutions brand. The staff professional development contractor is an integral part of this system that ties the pieces together; helps contractors align with our purpose, mission, vision and values; helps ensure staff understand how they are connected; and drives system efficiencies by educating and mentoring staff in practices essential to providing exceptional service."

The Houston-Galveston Area Council, the fiscal agent for the Gulf Coast Workforce Board, is issuing this Solicitation on behalf of the Board and Workforce Solutions and is seeking a qualified contractor to perform professional services for the Workforce Solutions system. Any subsequent contract awarded under this solicitation will be executed with the Houston-Galveston Area Council as the contracting entity.

In close cooperation with Board staff, Employer Service staff helps area employers with a variety of human resource needs – including sourcing talent for open jobs, providing professional advice and resources for talent development strategies, and offering reliable, current data on labor market conditions such as local wage rates and employment numbers by industry and occupation.
Respondents that propose to operate Employer Service may not propose to operate any other portion of the Workforce System"

The Heart of Texas Workforce Development Board, Inc. (Board) dba Workforce Solutions for the Heart of Texas is seeking quotes for short-term technical skills training services. The Board’s purpose is to assist eligible individuals overcome unemployment setbacks offering training services that aid an individual in earning industry-recognized post-secondary credentials to help to begin, continue, or restart their careers.  Workforce Solutions for the Heart of Texas is the administrative entity for programs funded by the Texas Workforce Commission and Department of Labor. The Workforce Solutions for the Heart of Texas serves McLennan, Falls, Bosque, Freestone, Limestone and Hill Counties.

The Board seeks to procure and compile a listing of approved training providers that shall provide allowable short-term technical skills training that is either offered through in-person training, online training or a hybrid combination.  The initial contract period will begin on July 1, 2022.

The Request for Quotes (RFQ) may be obtained by contacting Erin Rea at (254) 296-5386 or via email at erin.rea@hotworkforce.com. The RFQ is also available on the Workforce Solutions for the Heart of Texas website. A virtual Bidders Conference will be held will be held via Zoom on May 31, 2022 at 10:00 AM (CST). To receive the access code and password please e-mail erin.rea@hotworkforce.com. Attendance is not mandatory, but strongly recommended.
Proposals are due no later than 4:00 PM (CST) Tuesday, June 14, 202 to:
Workforce Solutions for the Heart of Texas

The Heart of Texas Workforce Board, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer/programs and auxiliary aids and services are available upon request to include individuals with disabilities. TTY/TDD via RELAY Texas service at 711 or (TDD) 1-800-735-2989 / 1-800-735-2988 (voice)."

The Texas Education Agency (TEA) is requesting proposals to develop Career and Technical Education (CTE) documentation. Specifically, updating of approximately 60 student- and parent-facing documents that explain CTE programs of study, the updating of approximately five previously drafted district toolkits, the development of 14 career cluster planning guides (one for each state career cluster including energy and science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM), 14 Spanish language guides of the same content as English language for each career cluster, and other documentation. Program of study framework documents can be found at https://tea.texas.gov/academics/college-career-and-military-prep/career-and-technical-education/approved-cte-programs-of-study."

The Texas Workforce Commission (TWC) seeks grant Applications from eligible Applicants to administer and deliver services through the Family Math Literacy Initiative (FMLI). The FMLI will assist AEL-eligible participants and their families with learning basic math operations and enhancing digital skill building.

The General Appropriations Act (Senate Bill 1, Article VII-44, Rider 46, 87th Legislature, Regular Session (2021) (Rider 46)) requires TWC to ensure that digital skill building is an explicitly permitted use of existing workforce development grant programs and that federal funds are used to provide digital skill building, device access, and digital support for workers in workforce development programs."

column1: Consulting: Education, Training, Testing, Leadership Bids,VT,"Plain Language Training

This Plain Language Training (PLT) will help the Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC), within the Agency of Natural Resources (ANR), staff learn about plain language and how to incorporate it into permit applications, issued permits, and other informational and educational materials. Plain language is communication people can understand the first time they read or hear it. By using plain language, DEC staff can get our message across quickly, make sure more people understand our message, and save time explaining our message. In addition, staff can ensure applications, permits, and outreach materials are more accessible and easily translated into other languages. The purpose of this RFP is to collect proposals for Plain Language Training and instruction for DEC staff to make permitting and communications more transparent, clear, and user friendly.

column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,lareau.linda@socom.mil,,"The provisions and clauses included and/or incorporated in this solicitation document are those in effect through the Federal Acquisition Circular. This RFQ incorporates all provisions and clauses in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) 2022-06 Effective: 01 May 2022, DFARS Publication Notice (DPN) 20220428 Effective: 28 April 2022 and SOFAR Change Notice (SCN) 201811. SEE ATTACHED SOLICITATION FOR CLAUSES AND PROVISIONS. Offerors may submit written questions during the proposal preparation period. All questions shall be submitted electronically to linda.lareau@socom.mil and Emily.lonigro@socom.mil and must be received no later than 10:00 A.M. (EDT) on 08 June 2022 to allow adequate time to prepare a response prior to the date and time set for receipt of quotes.? Only written questions will receive a response.? It is required that each question shall include the document name, document date, specific page, paragraph, clause, or other definitive citation requiring clarification.? All questions shall be directed to the Contracting Office by email, citing the following subject line structure ?H92240-22-Q-2028_OFFEROR NAME_Question?. Quotes are due no later than 23 June 2022 at 10:00 A.M. (EDT). The quotes shall be valid for no less than 180 days from the date of RFQ closing, a statement affirming this fact shall be included in the Introduction. This combined synopsis/solicitation shall not be construed as a contract, a commitment to contract, or a commitment by the Government incurring an obligation of any kind."

column1: Consulting: Education, Training, Testing, Leadership Bids,VA,Electronic and Virtual Reality Training Learning Products,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 8, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/b4a984a565e044b2a69284db60956c9c/view,"N0018922Q0214
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,brittany.s.simmons3.civ@us.navy.mil,,"Description Subject to FAR Clause 52.215-3, entitled ?Request for Information or Solicitation for Planning Purpose,? this announcement constitutes a Sources Sought Notice for information and planning purposes. This Sources Sought Notice is to obtain access for 150,000 Navy users to contractor off the shelf electronic, virtual reality, and serious game courses.? The courses must contain certain subjects and scenarios and delivery distributed as asynchronous/self-paced course that is compatible for use on the on Navy eLearning system or provided via contractor system that tracks registration/completion. This is not a solicitation announcement for quotes and no contract will be awarded from this announcement. It is not to be construed in any way as a commitment by the Government, nor will the Government pay for the information submitted in response. The Government plans to procure these services as Commercial Item as defined in FAR 2.101. Place of Performance The contractor shall perform work under this contract at their place of business. NAICS Code The NAICS Code for this requirement is 611430, Continuing education online learning marketplace services (through a website or mobile application) and the size standard is $12.0 Million. Period of Performance The period of performance for this award will be for 12 months after award with four 12 month option periods and one 6 month FAR 52.217-8 option period. Please see Attachment I Draft Performance Work Statement (PWS). Responses to this Sources Sought request shall reference N0018922Q0214. Responses shall include the following information in this format: Company name, address, Point of Contact (POC) name, phone number, fax number and email address. Contractor and Government Entity (CAGE) Code. Size of business- Large Business, Small Business, Small Disadvantage, 8(a), Hubzone, Woman-owned and/or Veteran-owned, etc. If the services can be solicited from a GSA or SeaPort-NxG contract vehicle, provide the applicable contract number. Relevant past performance on same/similar work dating back 5 (five) years and your company?s capacity to perform the type of work. Documentation of technical expertise must be presented in sufficient detail for the Government to determine that your company possesses the necessary functional area expertise and experience to compete for this acquisition as specified in Attachment I Draft Performance Work Statement (PWS). Standard company brochures will not be reviewed. Submissions are not to exceed two (2) standard typewritten pages. All technical questions and inquiries may be submitted within the response. Indication if your company can be a prime contractor for this effort or, if not, whether your company can be a subcontractor. Attachment I, Draft PWS, is posted in this notice for your reference. Responses should be emailed to Brittany Simmons at brittany.s.simmons3.civ@us.navy.mil, Kendall Mulherin at kendall.l.mulherin.civ@us.navy.mil and Elizabeth Phelps at elizabeth.a.phelps14.civ@us.navy.mil by 5:00pm EST on 7th June 2022. Again, this is not a request for a quote. Respondent will be not be notified of the results. Please note the information within this sources sought will be updated and/or changed prior to an official synopsis/solicitation, if any are issued. NOTE: Proprietary information should be clearly marked. The requested information is for planning and market research purposes only and will not be publically released. Again, this is not a request for quote. Respondents will not be notified of the results. Please note the information with this pre-solicitation synopsis will be updated and/or may change prior to an official synopsis/solicitation, if any."

column1: Consulting: Education, Training, Testing, Leadership Bids,VA,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): SAPRO Training Shows,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 16, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/a1e968878e0e4d72a1073988c6a77563/view,"N0018922QZ125
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,michael.j.stoutenger.civ@us.navy.mil,,"This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented by FAR 13, with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotes are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. Solicitation number N0018922QZ125 is being issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ). The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are provided as an attachment to this synopsis. This requirement is being competed as a 100% small business set-aside. The NAICS code is 611430 - Professional and Management Development Training. The small business size standard is $12M.? The Philadelphia Division, Contracting Department of NAVSUP Fleet Logistics Center Norfolk intends to solicit and award a Single Firm Fixed Price, Indefinite Delivery, Indefinite Quantity (FFP IDIQ) contract to the responsible vendor whose quote represents the best value after evaluation in accordance with the factors in the solicitation. ?Task orders issued off of it would be in accordance with the FFP IDIQ pricing. REQUIREMENT: The Department of the Navy Sexual Assault, Sexual Harassment, Suicide Prevention and Response Office (DON SAPRO) requires contractor support to provide training shows on sexual assault and sexual harassment prevention. Shows should be 60 to 90 minutes in length, consist of scripted as well as improvisational scenes that are interactive and engage the audience in candid and informed discussions about these serious topics.? The shows should focus on prevention to reduce and stop self-directed harm and prohibit abusive or harmful acts. The contractor shall provide a maximum of 135 working days of training shows to Sailors and Marines located at CONUS and OCONUS military installations. See the attached Performance Based Work Statement for the details of this requirement. Services will be inspected and accepted at Destination by the Government. The Ordering Period for this contract will be 3 years from the award date. The anticipated award date is 08 July 2022. This requirement does include options conditional to the availability of funds. ?? SUBMISSION OF QUOTES: Initial quotes and any amendments thereto are due on or before 16 June 2022 at 10:00 AM. Written Quotes shall be sent to: Michael.j.stoutenger.civ@us.navy.mil. DVD submissions of pre-recorded performance further explained in in this solicitation shall mail Two (2) copies to: NAVSUP Fleet Logistics Center Norfolk, Philadelphia Office Attn: Michael Stoutenger, RFQ N0018922QZ125 700 Robbins Avenue Building 2B Philadelphia, PA 19111 All questions about this RFQ shall be submitted by 02 June 2022 to Michael Stoutenger at Michael.j.stoutenger.civ@us.navy.mil See Attachment I titled Additional Instructions for instructions on submission of quotes. column5: ",,,,usaltrainingandeducation@opm.gov,,"AMENDMENT 2:? Updated Proposal Due Date to June 21, 2022 ?????? Updated Attachment 1 Requirements Description ?????? Updated Attachment 2 Instructions ? Evaluations ?????? Updated Attachment 5 OPM Clauses Full Text ?????? Updated Attachment 8 Proposal Checklist Template ?????? Added Questions and Answers Document Amendment 1 - Extended Response Due Date From Friday May 20, 2022 to Monday June 20, 2022.? No Other Changes. COMBINED SYNOPSIS/SOLICITATION? This Request for Proposal (RFP) is being executed as a combined synopsis/solicitation for USALearning? (USAL) Training and Education Support Products and Services in accordance with the format in Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Part 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement is a request for proposals and constitutes the only solicitation. The Office of Personnel Management (OPM) intends to maximize the use of a Hybrid Contract Line-Item Number (CLIN) structure.? The Government anticipates contracts will utilize a mix of firm fixed price (FFP), time and materials (T and M), Labor Hour (LH), and not to exceed (NTE) for travel CLINs. The North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code is 611430 and the small business size standard is $12.0 million. This procurement will be a total small business set-aside. SOLICITATION CLOSING DATE:? All proposals must be received by 10:00 A.M. Eastern Standard Time (EST), Tuesday June 21, 2022.? Delivery method for submission of your proposal is via Microsoft Teams. ?All proposal documents must be uploaded into the seven (7) separate folders identified by Volume Number.? No paper or email versions of your proposal will be accepted.? Any paper or email proposals received will not be evaluated and considered for award.?? Proposals must include all required items listed in the Proposal Instructions and Evaluation for Award (Attachment 2). MICROSOFT TEAMS REQUEST CLOSING DATE: In order to access and submit a timely proposal to the USAL Training and Education Teams workspace, the Offeror shall submit an email request to join the workspace no later than 3:00 P.M. EST Wednesday May 4, 2022, to USALTrainingandEducation@opm.gov.?? The request shall include: Names and emails of one Point of Contact (POC) and/or no more than two backup POCs to join the team?s workspace. The Offerors POCs should be designated individuals responsible for uploading proposal documents in the team?s workspace.? Only POCs identified in the request will have access to the workspace. (Refer to the Proposal Instructions and Evaluation for Award for complete details (Attachment 2)). QUESTIONS CLOSING DATE:? All questions and inquiries concerning any aspect of this announcement must be submitted in writing to email box: USALTrainingandEducation@opm.gov no later than 3:00 P.M. EST Wednesday, May 4, 2022 for clarification sufficiently in advance of the deadline of receipt of the proposal to get an answer in time to meet that deadline. ?Questions must be provided utilizing the excel spreadsheet: RFP Question Response Form (separately attached). Telephone requests will not be honored.? The Government?s response to inquiries will be made in writing.? Any resulting additions, deletions or changes to the RFP will be made by issuances of a formal amendment.? Offerors are instructed specifically to contact only the issuing contract office in connection with any aspect of this requirement prior to contract award.? IMPORTANT REMINDER:? Prior to submission of the proposal, please verify your registration is current and active via the System for Award Management (SAM): https://sam.gov/content/home in accordance with FAR 52.204-7.? Offerors, including any Offeror organized as a joint venture, must have an Active SAM registration at the time of proposal submission and throughout the procurement process.? Any Offeror whose registration is not active in SAM at the time of proposal submission will be excluded from the process and the proposal will not be evaluated.? OBJECTIVE: The contractor shall provide proposed solutions and all aspects of analysis, design, development, implementation and evaluation for all Training and Education Support Products and Services.? The functional areas are as follows: 1) Formal and Informal Learning ISD and Support Services 2) Simulator, Live and Virtual 3) Organizational Training and Planning (Refer to the Requirement Description for complete details (Attachment 1)). Place of Performance: Support will be required at Government facilities (onsite) and at non-Government facilities (offsite).? Specific site locations will be defined at the Task Order level.? The Government anticipates that most of the work will occur in the contiguous United States (CONUS), but outside contiguous United States (OCONUS) support by the Contractor may be performed if the Government provides approval in advance at the Task Order level. Period of Performance: The IDIQ(s) will be for one (1) five-year base ordering period, with one (1) five-year optional ordering period, and one (1) six-month optional ordering period in accordance with 52.217-8. GENERAL PROPOSAL INSTRUCTIONS:? Offerors are instructed to read the entire solicitation document, including all attachments (16 Total) prior to submitting either questions or preparing its proposal. Omission of any information from the proposal submission requirements may result in rejection of the Offeror?s proposal. (Refer to the Proposal Instructions and Evaluation for Award for complete details (Attachment 2)). BASIS OF AWARD:? The Government expects to award contracts resulting from this announcement to the Offerors whose proposals represent the Highest Technically Offeror with Fair and Reasonable Price (HTRO-RP) to the Government. (Refer to the Proposal Instructions and Evaluation for Award for complete details (Attachment 2)). PROVISIONS AND CLAUSES:? This solicitation document incorporates all mandatory commercial item provisions and clauses that are in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) 2022-04 dated January 30, 2022.? The Government intends to include the following clauses and provisions, either by reference or in full text in the resulting award. All applicable clauses shall flow down to each individual task order.? NOTE: The FAR clauses may be accessed in full at https://www.acquisition.gov/browse/index/far.?
