column1: Equipment: Tools, Hand, Power Bids,VA,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): 24--Grasshopper 900D (Diesel) with 72? Deck (Foldable ROPS),Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jul 7, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/0dd4f07a53694f68b1bb4b03c70bfd0c/view,"LEEORDNANCECB002
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com,,"This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The solicitation number is LEEORDNANCECB002 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ), unless otherwise indicated herein. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 444210 with a small business size standard of $7.50M. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified sellers may submit bids. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2022-07-07 16:00:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be Prince George, VA 23875 The MICC End User requires the following items, Brand Name or Equal, to the following: LI 001: Grasshopper 900D (Diesel) with 72? Deck (Foldable ROPS), 2, EA; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested Offerers must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, MICC End User intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. MICC End User is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerers that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerers that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerers that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerers may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should Offerers require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. This is currently an unfunded requirement with a high expectation that funds will be available. When and if funds become available a contract will be awarded at that time. The offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions: FAR 52.252-1, Solicitation. Provisions Incorporated by Reference; FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors; 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications; FAR 52.211-6, Brand name or Equal. The following clauses apply to this solicitation: FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions ? Commercial Items. The following FAR clauses in paragraph (b) of FAR clause 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, apply: 52.204-10, Reporting Executive Compensation and First Tier Subcontract Awards; 52.219-6, Notice of Total Small Business Set-Aside; 52.219-28, Post Award Small Business Program Rerepresentation; 52.222-3, Convict Labor; 52.222-19, Child Labor-Cooperation with Authorities and Remedies; 52.222-21, Prohibition of Segregated Facilities; 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity; 52.222-36, Affirmative Action for Workers with Disabilities; 52.225-13, Restrictions on Certain Foreign Purchases; 52.232-33, Payment by Electronic Funds Transfer--System for Award Management. 52.233-4, Applicable Law for Breach of Contract Claim; The following DFARS clauses apply: DFARS 252.04-7004, Alternate A System for Award Management; 252.211-7003, Item Identification and Valuation; 252.225-7002, Qualifying Country Sources as Subcontractors; 252.232-7010, Levies on Contract Payments; 252.203-7000, Requirements Relating to Compensation of Former DoD Officials; 252.225-7001, Buy American Act and Balance Of Payments Program; 252.225-7036, Buy American Act -- Free Trade Agreements -- Balance of Payments Program; 252.232-7003, Electronic Submission of Payment Requests; 252.247-7023, Primary and ALT III, Transportation of Supplies by Sea. IAW 52.204-7 System for Award Management (SAM) Registration (July 2013), the offeror must be registered in SAM and fully input their Representations and Certifications for a complete record. Information can be found at http://www.sam.gov or by calling 866-606-8220, or 334-206-7828 for international calls. 52.204-13 - System for Award Management Maintenance Shipping is FOB Destination CONUS (CONtinental U.S.). New Equipment ONLY. NO USED OR REMANUFACTURED PRODUCTS WILL BE ACCEPTED. Submitted Quotes will be valid for 45 days after the auction closing. This solicitation is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ), not an invitation for bid (IFB).). IAW FAR 52.252-2 Clauses Incorporated by Reference, for the extended description here is the website: https://www.acquisition.gov/ The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement can be found. The small business size standard for that NAICS code can be found at https://www.sba.gov/sites/default/files/files/Size_Standards_Table.pdf 5152.233-4000 AMC-LEVEL PROTEST PROGRAM (Feb 2014) (LOCAL CLAUSE) Prior to submitting an agency protest, it is preferable that you first attempt to resolve your concerns with the responsible contracting officer (Phone: (315)772-7272 or Email: usarmy.drum.acc-micc.mbx.micc@mail.mil). However, you may also file a protest to the Headquarters (HQ), Army Materiel Command (AMC). The HQ AMC-Level Protest Program is intended to encourage interested parties to seek resolution of their concerns within AMC as an Alternative Dispute Resolution forum, rather than filing a protest with the Government Accountability Office (GAO) or other external forum. Contract award or performance is suspended during the protest to the same extent, and within the same time periods, as if filed at the GAO. The AMC protest decision goal is to resolve protests within 35 calendar days from filing. To be timely, protests must be filed within the periods specified in FAR 33.103. If you want to file a protest under the HQ AMC-Level Protest Program, the protest must request resolution under that program and be sent to the address below. Headquarters U.S. Army Materiel Command Office of Command Counsel-Deputy Command Counsel 4400 Martin Road Rm: A6SE040.001 Redstone Arsenal, AL 35898-5000 Fax: (256) 450-8840 or email usarmy.redstone.usamc.mbx.protests@mail.mil The AMC-Level Protest procedures are found at: https://www.amc.army.mil/Connect/Legal-Resources/. If internet access is not available, contact the contracting officer or HQ, AMC to obtain the HQ AMC-Level Protest Procedures. Infrastructure: Sidewalks, Pathways, Trails, Parking Lot Bids,PA,Sidewalk Revitalization Project,State/Local,,"Blakely Borough, Pennsylvania","Jun 20, 2022","Blakely Borough, Pennsylvania",https://blakelyborough.com/,"Bids
column3: ",Purchasing,,570-383-3344,,,"INVITATION TO BID LEGAL NOTICE Sealed proposals for the Blakely Borough Main Street Sidewalk Revitalization Project, Gino Merli Drive to Academy Street and Depot Street, Blakely Borough, Lackawanna County, Pennsylvania, will be received by the Blakely Borough Council until 4:00 p.m. on Monday, June 20, 2022 at the Borough Business Office in the Blakely Borough Municipal Building, 1439 Main Street, Peckville, PA 18452. All properly submitted proposals will be publicly opened and read at the scheduled Blakely Borough Council Meeting at 6:00 p.m. on the same date. Scope of Work: The work on this project will include but is not limited to the demolition of existing sidewalks and curbs and construction of approximate 917 sy of new concrete sidewalk and curbing. Also included will be new handicap ramps, driveway aprons and pavement and grass restoration. Project drawings and specifications may be obtained for a non-refundable fee of $50.00 per set. Make checks payable to and send requests to: KBA Engineering, p.c. 25 South Washington Avenue Jermyn, PA 18433 Phone: 570-876-5744 Fax: 570-876-4299 Bidders' proposals must be accompanied by a certified check, certified bank treasurer's check, bank cashier's check or bid bond in the form provided in the Contract Documents. A satisfactory corporation surety shall provide security in an amount equal to 10% of the base bid. The surety shall name as payee or obligee the Blakely Borough. A Non-Collusion Affidavit of Contractor will be required to be signed and notarized prior to the award of any contract. A no-lien agreement will be required to be signed and filed by the contractor before any work begins on the project. Notice is hereby given that the project for which construction proposals are being solicited hereby is a project constituting public works and is subject to applicable provisions of the Pennsylvania Human Relations Act of October 27, 1955, P.L. 744, and the Pennsylvania Prevailing Wage Act 442 of August 15, 1961, as amended on August 9, 1963. All proposals shall be irrevocable for sixty (60) days after bid opening date, unless delayed due to required approvals of another governmental agency, and shall be accompanied by 10% bid guaranty, payable to the Owner. The Owner reserves the right to reject any or all bids and to waive any or all irregularities, mistakes, omission informalities relative thereto. A Pre-bid Conference will be held at the Blakely Borough Municipal Offices, 1439 Main Street, Peckville, PA 18452 on Tuesday, June 14, 2022 at 10:00 a.m. for the purpose of reviewing the project. Christopher R. Paone Blakely Borough Manager"

Infrastructure: Sidewalks, Pathways, Trails, Parking Lot Bids,PA,Sidewalk Project,State/Local,,"Yardley Borough, Pennsylvania","Jun 14, 2022","Yardley Borough, Pennsylvania",https://www.yardleyboro.org/,"Bids
column3: ",Purchasing,,215-493-6832,,,"Notice To Bidders North Main Street Sidewalk Project Phase II Borough of Yardley The Borough of Yardley will utilize electronic bidding to receive sealed bids for the North Main Street Sidewalk Project Phase II. Sealed bids must be submitted online through the PennBid electronic procurement program prior to 6/14/2022 at 10:00 AM EST, at which time they will be opened and read aloud at the office of the Borough Engineer, Remington & Vernick Engineers, 1010 Stony Hill Road, Suite 175, Yardley, PA 19067. All documents and solicitation details are available at no cost through PennBid (www.PennBid.net). This project is funded in part by Pennsylvania Department of Transportation (PennDOT) MTF Program. All material must meet current PennDOT Specifications and contractors must be PennDOT prequalified. This project is funded in part by multiple grants from the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Commonwealth Financing Authority. All contractors must adhere to the Nondiscrimination/ Sexual Harrasment Clause. Bidders are required to provide Bid Security in an amount equal to 10% of the total amount bid. Bid Security may be provided in the form of a certified check or a bid bond issued by a Surety Company licensed to transact such business in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania. Upon award of a contract, the Successful Bidder shall provide a Performance Bond and a Labor and Materials Payment Bond, each in the amount of 100% of the awarded contract value. Upon completion of the contract, the Successful Bidder shall provide a 2-year Maintenance Bond in the amount of 100% of the final contract value. Bidders are required to comply with the Pennsylvania Prevailing Wage Act of 1961, P.L. 987, No. 442, where the project cost is $25,000 or above for public work. Only the Successful Bidder for a contract will be responsible for payment of a fee to PennBid and for bearing the cost thereof. The amount of the fee due to PennBid is either 1/3% (0.0033) of the initial contract award amount for fixed fee contracts or 1/6% (0.00166) of the expected contract value for term contracts and will be invoiced by PennBid to the successful bidder upon award of a contract by the Local Contracting Unit. The minimum fee is set at $100.00 and the maximum fee is capped at $5,000.00."

column3: ",Purchasing,,610-734-7716,,,"NOTICE OF ADVERTISEMENT FOR BIDS 1. CDBG Project #47-21-70, Garret Road Social Sidewalk Social Distancing Public notice is given that sealed bids/proposals will be received online via the PennBid Program by the Township of Upper Darby by June 6, 2022 until 4:00 PM prevailing time. Bidders are required to submit a surety in the form of a bond or equivalent meeting 10% of the overall bid price in compliance with the contract documents. Bid bonds will be returned to the non-awarded bidders upon the execution of the contract. The successful Bidder shall also be required to provide a Performance Bond in an amount of one hundred percent (100%) of the Contract amount within ten (10) calendar days of receipt of written notice of acceptance of the Bid. There is no physical public bid opening for this project, bids will be revealed via the PennBid website. A uniform fee of 0.333% (1/3 of 1 percent) of the bid amount (up to $5,000) is applied only to bidders who are awarded contracts. No fees apply to bidders who submit without being awarded the contract. All interested parties must submit questions via the web based system, by the posted deadline for questions. Bidders are not permitted to contact the Township Engineer or staff directly. The Bidderâ€™s attention is called to the fact that this project is assisted with federal funds, and various federal requirements apply as noted in the bid documents, including but not limited to equal opportunity provisions and Davis-Bacon and Related Acts. The Contract Documents contain all pertinent regulations. The Township reserves the right to reject any or all bids or to accept any portion of any bid, and to award Contracts as is deemed best for the Township. Barbarann Keffer, Mayor Upper Darby Township"

column1: Infrastructure: Sidewalks, Pathways, Trails, Parking Lot Bids,TX,Walking Trails & CCC Loop Repairs ,State/Local,,State of Texas 2,"Jun 27, 2022",State of Texas 2,https://www.txsmartbuy.com/esbddetails/view/808-22-221494,"808-22-221494
column3: ",,,,Christi.Duve@thc.texas.gov,,"IFB 808-22-221494 Walking Trails & CCC Loop Repairs at Fort Griffin State Historic Site

column1: The Texas Historical Commission (THC) issues this Invitation for Bid (IFB) to solicit bids from qualified contractors that are able to provide services and equipment related to road and trail repair, and all necessary trades to install and make operational onsite. Bidder may visit the site to assess the project conditions prior to submitting a bid. Refer to paragraph 3.3 for details. The project ultimately requires preparing surfaces and adding 4 inches of crushed limestone to CCC loop area road, wetting and roller compacting.  Adding 3 inches of chat to fort walking trails, wetting and roller compacting. Bid must include all equipment necessary, and all labor to deliver and complete this project.

Contractor shall provide all necessary services and equipment related to preparing surfaces and adding 4 inches of crushed limestone to CCC loop area road, wetting and roller compacting.  Total length of the CCC loop is 1,400ft and will be 18ft wide.  Contractor shall provide all necessary services and equipment related to preparing surfaces and adding 3 inches of chat to fort walking trails, wetting and roller compacting. Total length of the Fort trails is 4,650ft and will be 12ft wide.  The trails must have a smooth finish surface to allow small wheel access.
The site is a sensitive historically protected area and all caution must be used to not disturb the areas around the designated work areas.

Bidder are encouraged to visit the site to become thoroughly familiar with the existing conditions and requirements before submitting a bid, but it is not mandatory. The site location is 1701 Hwy 283 North, Albany, TX 76430. You may contact the site manager, Mitch Baird at 325-762-3592. Site visit is not mandatory.

All inquiries must be submitted in writing by the date listed as the deadline for submission of questions as specified in Section 3.1. Verbal inquiries and responses will not be valid or binding. For questions contact:  Christi Duve, THC, at christi.duve@thc.texas.gov.
All inquiries will result in written responses as an addendum posted on the Electronic State Business Daily ESBD, available at http://www.txsmartbuy.com/sp.
Late responses will not be accepted."

Infrastructure: Sidewalks, Pathways, Trails, Parking Lot Bids,VT,"Trailhead Parking Expansion
Buildings & General Svs, Office of Purchasing & Contracting

INVITATION TO BID DEPARTMENT OF BUILDINGS AND GENERAL SERVICES STATE OF VERMONT Contractors are invited to bid on the Monroe Trailhead Parking Expansion Project for the Agency of Natural Resources, Department of Forest, Parks, and Recreation at 3508 Camel’s Hump Road in Duxbury, Vermont. This project consists of, but is not limited to: An expansion of an existing gravel parking lot at Monroe Trailhead in Duxbury, VT. This expansion will include tree clearing, grubbing, grading, cut/fill, hauling, ditching, culvert installation, placing and compacting base and surface course materials, sediment and erosion control measures and turf establishment. Sealed Bids accompanied by proper Bid Security will be received by the Department of Buildings and General Services, at 133 State Street, Montpelier, Vermont 05633-8000, June 15, 2022, at 4:30 PM. Documents may be obtained from Blueprints Etc, 20 Farrell Street, South Burlington VT 05403, by phone at 802-865-4503, by fax at 802-865-0027 or email to: orders@blueprintsetc.com. Project Manuals and Plans are available for preview at: http://www.blueprintsetc.com in the Public Plan Room. Any and all notifications, releases and addendums associated with this project will be posted at http://www.blueprintsetc.com. There is a non-refundable fee for each set of documents purchased.

column2: James Meyers, State Senior Purchasing Agent

Virginia Community College System - System Office -Virginia Western Community College, Roanoke, Virginia

Sealed bids are invited for the construction of Improvements to Parking Lots, Pavement, and Lighting at Virginia Western Community College, Project Code # 260-B0260-037-B, located in Roanoke, Virginia. The project is generally described as the milling, replacement, and sealing of existing parking lots, signage, and lot striping within Lots 2, 4, 8, 11, 15, and the Webber Hall service yard, and replacing existing lighting poles, fixtures, and bases where indicated on drawings (Sheets C102, C104A, C109, C110, C111, and C202). Sealed bids will be received at Virginia Community College System, Attention: Ms. Sibyl Roberts, 300 Arboretum Place, Suite 200, Richmond, Virginia 23236, Telephone (804) 819-4918. PLEASE NOTE: For shipping/mailing, use Suite 390; for hand delivery, use Suite 200. The deadline for submitting bids is 2:00 P.M. sharp, as determined by the Bid Officer, June 9, 2022. The bids will be opened publicly and read aloud beginning at 2:00 P.M., on June 10, 2022, at the same location. A Standard Commonwealth Bid Bond is required (form CO-10.2 and Contract Security) is required for any bid regardless of bid amount. The bidder or offeror shall be a registered vendor in eVA."

column2: State Parks is seeking proposals from firms to provide trail grooming services for approximately 120 miles of snowmobile trails located in the Cle Elum River Valley north of Roslyn WA, in Kittitas County, within the Okanogan-Wenatchee National Forest USFS, and extending east to the Teanaway Community Forest DNR/WDFW. Two Sno-Parks and two Staging Areas service this trail system. The nearest towns are Roslyn (5 miles) and Cle Elum (9 miles) away. See expanded details herein."

Improvement of Renton Avenue South by clearing and grubbing, roadway excavation, removing asphalt pavement, gravel surface, curb and gutter, guardrails, pavement markings, catch basin; plugging culvert pipe; grading; installing drainage improvements; constructing structural earth wall and gravity block wall,  cement concrete curb, gutter, sidewalk, driveway entrances, handrails, ADA ramps, and bus shelter pad; hot mix asphalt pre-leveling and overlay; erosion control; installing painted and plastic pavement markings, temporary traffic control, landscaping, and other work.

Infrastructure: Sidewalks, Pathways, Trails, Parking Lot Bids,WA,ADA Parking Lot Improvements,State/Local,,"Richland, Washington","Jun 23, 2022","Richland, Washington",https://www.ci.richland.wa.us/departments/administrative-services/purchasing/current-bid-opportunities,"ITB #22-0048

Public notice is hereby given that bids will be received for the City of Richland’s UPTOWN ADA PARKING LOT IMPROVEMENTS Project by the City of Richland Purchasing Division staff until the date and time specified above, at which time bids will be opened and read publicly. This project includes, but is not limited to, the demolition including the removal of concrete flatwork, concrete curb, asphalt, signage, site furniture, and the construction and installation of concrete flatwork, ADA ramps, concrete curb, asphalt signage, grading, landscape repair, asphalt sealcoating, parking lot striping, as per specifications. This project is estimated at $375,000 to $565,000. The City of Richland in accordance with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, 78 Stat. 252, 42 U.S.C. 200d to 2000d-4 and Title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, Department of Transportation, subtitle A, Office of the Secretary, Part 21, nondiscrimination in federally assisted programs of the Department of Transportation issued pursuant to such Act, hereby notifies all bidders that it will affirmatively insure that in any contract entered into pursuant to this advertisement, disadvantaged business enterprises as defined at 49 CFR Part 26 will be afforded full opportunity to submit bids in response to this invitation and will not be discriminated against on the grounds of race, color, national origin, or sex in consideration for an award. Small, Minority and Women-owned firms are encouraged to submit bid."
Infrastructure: Sidewalks, Pathways, Trails, Parking Lot Bids,WA,Sidewalk Installation,State/Local,,"Spokane, Washington","Jun 10, 2022","Spokane, Washington",https://my.spokanecity.org/,"Bids
column3: ",Purchasing,,509-625-6400,,,"ADVERTISEMENT FOR BIDS CITY OF SPOKANE VALLEY COMMUNITY AND PUBLIC WORKS WILBUR SIDEWALK BOONE TO MISSION Notice is hereby given that the City of Spokane Valley, Spokane County, Washington will accept sealed bids for the Wilbur Sidewalk Boone to Mission. The project consists of storm structure installation, new ADA ramps, curb and gutter, and sidewalk installation, and replacement of the full width of the roadway within the project limits. Copies of the bid packet including specifications and plans may be obtained in PDF format at cityofspokanevalleyplanroom.com. To be added to the Planholder""""'s list, bidders shall download project files or purchase hard copy documents. Any addenda to this project will be sent only to those listed on the cityofspokanevalleyplanroom.com Planholder""""'s List. The Planholder""""'s List is also available at this website. For further information contact Candice Powers-Henderson, Spokane Valley Community and Public Works, at cphenderson@spokanevalley.org or call 509-720-5003 Monday through Friday from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. All bids must be accompanied by a bid deposit in the form of a surety bond, postal money order, cash, cashier""""'s check, or certified check in an amount equal to five percent (5%) of the amount of the bid proposed. Failure to furnish a bid bond in compliance with the City""""'s bid deposit surety bond form shall make the bid non-responsive and cause the bid to be rejected. Bids must be submitted in sealed envelopes addressed to the City Clerk of the City of Spokane Valley, 10210 E. Sprague Avenue, Spokane Valley, Washington, 99206 and received not later than 10:00 a.m. PDT, Friday, June 10, 2022. Bid openings will be held immediately thereafter and read aloud in the City Council Chambers. The City of Spokane Valley reserves the right to waive any irregularities or informalities and to reject any or all bids. No bidder may withdraw his bid after the time announced for the bid opening, or before the award and execution of the contract, unless the award is delayed for a period exceeding sixty (60) days. The City of Spokane Valley, in accordance with the provisions of Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 (78 Stat. 252, 42 U.S.C. 2000d to 2000d-4) and the Regulations, hereby notifies all bidders that it will affirmatively ensure that in any contract entered into pursuant to this advertisement, disadvantaged business enterprises will be afforded full and fair opportunity to submit bids in response to this invitation and will not be discriminated against on the grounds of race, color, or national origin in consideration for an award. The City of Spokane Valley in accordance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (Section 504) and the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), commits to nondiscrimination on the basis of disability, in all of its programs and activities. This material can be made available in an alternate format by emailing John Whitehead at jwhitehead@spokanevalley.org or by calling (509) 720-5111. Christine Bainbridge, MMC Spokane Valley City Clerk"

Infrastructure: Materials (Aggregate, Asphalt, Concrete, Rocks, Salt, Sand) Bids,NC,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): PURCHASE CARRIAGE TRAIL GRAVEL,Federal,,Department of the Interior,"Jun 6, 2022",Department of the Interior,https://sam.gov/opp/bf06ad1c50ad4e06be48d7075150d72f/view,"140P5322Q0026
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,202-208-3100,ashley_warcewicz@nps.gov,,"The National Park Service, Blue Ridge Parkway, is issuing a combined synopsis/solicitation for a vendor to provide all the necessary personnel, material and equipment to furnish, haul, and deliver 700 tons of Carriage Trail Gravel mix 700 Tons of Carriage Trail Gravel Mix shall consist of even (1/3 ea) parts: Size 67 Washed Granite (Medium to Dark Gray Color) Size 78M Washed Granite (Medium to Dark Gray Color Screenings/Granite Dust Washed (Medium to Dark Gray Color) Mix shall be mixed prior to delivery to site Delivery address is: 5580 Shulls Mill Road Blowing Rock, NC 28605 The Government intends to award a firm-fixed price commercial contract based on the quote that represents the best value to the Government in accordance with FAR Part 12, Acquisition of Commercial Items, and FAR Part 19, Small Business Programs. 100% Total Small Business Set-Aside The NAICS code is 212321 Construction Sand and Gravel Mining The contracting office will not provide hardcopies or email copies of the solicitation, please review the attachments posted. The contractor shall provide all labor, tools, equipment, materials and supervision required to complete this project. SYSTEM FOR AWARD MANAGEMENT (SAM): Federal Acquisition Regulations require that federal contractors register in the System for Award Management (SAM) database at https://www.sam.gov and enter all mandatory information into the system. Award cannot be made until the contractor has registered. Interested offerors are encouraged to ensure that they are registered in SAM prior to submitting their quote. THESE REGISTRATIONS WILL BE COMPLETED BEFORE TIME OF AWARD. Any questions regarding this announcement should be sent to Ashley Warcewicz@nps.gov no later than close of business on 6/1/2022 5 pm EST Request for Quote closes: 6/6/2022 5 pm EST Phone calls will not be accepted. See all attachments and factors for further details."

column1: Infrastructure: Materials (Aggregate, Asphalt, Concrete, Rocks, Salt, Sand) Bids,NC,Concrete and Pavers,State/Local,,"Raleigh, North Carolina","Jun 16, 2022","Raleigh, North Carolina",https://www.ips.state.nc.us/IPS/AGENCY/PDF/14846100.pdf,"274-RCC11-22
column3: ",Purchasing Manager,,919-890-3240,,,"The City of Raleigh is seeking proposals from General Contractors to perform several small projects at the Red Hat Amphitheater. Most of the work is associated with the amphitheater’s concrete surface; pouring concrete to replace pavers, cutting out and re-sealing the joints, cutting along the centerline to create an expansion joint and re-purposing the pavers to form another patio. We will also be erecting four small walls. One will be a privacy wall and the other three will be used to mount 55” video monitors. The final project will be to install siding on the restroom trailers."

column1: Infrastructure: Materials (Aggregate, Asphalt, Concrete, Rocks, Salt, Sand) Bids,OR,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): BPA setup - Hotmix Asphalt and Tack Coat,Federal,,Department of the Interior,"Jun 24, 2022",Department of the Interior,https://sam.gov/opp/57cb76456da24241815b2ea6d6342e53/view,"DOILFBO220026
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,202-208-3100,amacauley@blm.gov,,"This sources sought notice is prepared in accordance with the requirements at FAR 5.207, Preparation and transmittal of synopses. The Bureau of Land Management (BLM) ? Oregon State Office seeks qualified capable vendors to establish Blanket Purchase Agreements (BPAs) described herein, under FAR Part 13 procedures. FAR 12 commercial item clauses and provisions will apply to any BPA issued. The BLM will award BPAs with any qualified, responsible vendor who can supply the required products specified herein. Vendors are responsible for demonstrating, via its submission, its qualification to supply one or more products listed in Attachment 1 ? Product Offerings Worksheet and for demonstrating acceptable past performance. The BLM - Oregon State Office anticipates establishment of single and /or multiple award Blanket Purchase Agreements (BPAs) for firm fixed price commercial items supplies for Hotmix Asphalt Concrete (Hotmix) and Catonic Emulsified Tack Coat for pick up by government within the state of Oregon in accordance with FAR Part 12 terms and conditions. Award of a Blanket Purchase Agreement does not guarantee an order will be made. If selected for a BPA, the vendor shall furnish either Hotmix Asphalt Concrete or Catonic Emulsified Asphalt Concrete (Tack Coat), or both. The applicable product service code is 5610 ? Mineral Construction Materials, Bulk under NAICS 324121, Asphalt Paving Mixture and Block Manufacturing, size standard 500 employees. It is not necessary that your firm offer both products, but it is required that you specify which of the products from that your firm offers. One or more of the items under this acquisition is subject to the World Trade Organization Government Procurement Agreement and Free Trade Agreements. This opportunity is 100% set aside for small business under NAICS 324121, Asphalt Paving Mixture and Block Manufacturing, size standard 500 employees. BPAs awarded will serve the BLM's four western BLM districts within the State of Oregon: Medford, Roseburg, Coos Bay, and Northwest Districts, as well as BLM Klamath Falls Resource Area and BLM Lakeview District. The anticipated performance period for each BPA is from July 2022 through July 2027. The required delivery date for orders under this BPA is not known at this time; the BLM will place orders under BPAs as the need arises. There are no guaranteed orders; receipt of a BPA does not guarantee an order will be placed. Delivery is not required; government shall pick up all supplies in government vehicles at the BPA holders batch plant, quarry, pit location or designated facility and government staff will haul to the required government destination. Anticipated BPA line items of BPAs are as follows: CLIN 0001 Hot Mix Asphalt Concrete, ODOT Class C, ?"" Dense, Level 3, unit of issue, tons; CLIN 0002, Catonic Emulsified Asphalt (Asphalt Tack Coat), unit of issue, tons. Estimated Value of BPA: The potential total aggregate amount of all purchases under this BPA is not expected to exceed $2 million per BPA over 5 years. The frequency of purchases may be up to a maximum limit of $2 million per year per BPA; it is not known how many BPAs will be established and there is no guarantee an order will be placed. The Government is obligated only to the extent of authorized purchases actually made under the BPA. Purchase Limitation: BPA calls shall be no less than $10,000.00 with a maximum limit per purchase of $250,000.00. Individual BPAs will have a maximum limit of $10 million over 5 years. Below is a list of Government facility locations where the Hot Mix Asphalt Concrete and Catonic Emulsified Tack Coat are needed. Government will pick up at contractor's plant and haul to destination. The below list of Government facility locations is not exhaustive; additional Government facility locations may be added by future modification to this BPA. Coos Bay ? Bridge Mtce. Shop, 19042 Highway 42, Myrtle Point, OR 97458. Roseburg District Office, 777 N.W. Garden Valley Blvd., Roseburg, OR 97471. Tenmile Mtce Shop, 2560 Reston Rd., Tenmile, OR 97470. Coos Bay District Office, 1300 Airport Ln, North Bend, OR 97459. Dean Creek Elk Ranch House, 47088 Highway 38, Reedsport, OR 97467. Lane County Public Works Road Maintenance Section, 3040 N Delta Hwy Eugene, Oregon 97408. Molalla Maintenance Shop 32691 S Mathias Rd Molalla, OR 97038. Willamina Maintenance Shop 520 NE Main Street Willamina, OR 97396 Oregon Department of Forestry Yard 22965 Riverwood Dr SE Lyons, OR 97358 Oregon Department of Forestry 24533 Alsea Hwy, Philomath, OR 97370 Mt. Hood National Forest Headquarters 16400 Champion Way, Sandy, OR 97055 Sweet Home Ranger Station 4431 US-20, Sweet Home, OR 97386 Oregon Department of Forestry 23100 NW Haskins Creek Rd, Carlton, OR 97111 Medford District, 3040 Biddle Road, Medford, OR 97504 Brookings City Hall, 898 Elk Dr., Brookings, OR 97415 Qualifications requirement: The basis of award will be respondents who demonstrate their capability to successfully provide one or more products in Attachment 1 ? Product Offerings Worksheet with acceptable past performance. To be determined technically acceptable for a Hot Mix BPA, your firm must supply evidence your Hot Mix Asphalt Concrete products meet the specification set by Oregon Department of Transportation (ODOT) Class C, ?? Dense, Level 3 (or equivalent). To be determined technically acceptable for a Catonic Emulsified Ashphalt (Tack Coat) BPA, your firm must supply evidence your Catonic Emulsified Asphalt (Tack Coat) meets the requirement of Oregon Department of Transportations (ODOT) Standard Specifications for Construction 2021 Edition, Section 00705.11 ? Emulsified Asphalt Prime Coat, and Section 00730.11 Materials ? Emulsified Asphalt. Past performance will be rated acceptable/not acceptable. Authorized users of the anticipated BPA shall be any warranted Contracting Officer within BLM. All responsible sources may submit a bid, proposal, or quotation which shall be considered by the agency. It is strongly recommended you check your firm's registration status at www.sam.gov. Firms without an active SAM registration will not be considered for BPA award. To be considered for a BPA: Capabilities submissions shall be in two (2) sections. Section I is Technical (You must fully fill out Attachment 1 ? Product Offerings Worksheet). Section II is Past Performance. Offerors shall provide information on up to three (3) previous jobs whose effort was relevant to the supplies herein; the contracts provided where performed within the last three (3) years. The information shall include contract numbers (if the work was performed for a federal entity), point of contact with telephone numbers and email addresses of contacts who can speak to your company?s performance. The Government may review any past performance information submitted and from any source available. These sources include, but are not limited to, the Past Performance Information Retrieval System (PPIRS), points of contact from previous projects, or other databases, interviews with Program Managers, and interviews with Contracting Officers. Technical and Past Performance will be evaluated as either acceptable or unacceptable. The above information must be submitted to: amacauley@blm.gov with a cc to blm_or_so_952_mail@blm.gov no later than June 24, 2022 at 11 am PDT. All responsible sources may respond to this notice and all responses will be considered by the agency, with first preference given to Small Businesses. If there are not at least 2 qualified small businesses to serve a stated BLM facility location, BLM reserves the right to amend this notice to make it available to Other than Small Business. Responses to this notice may result in a BPA. If you have questions about this notice, use subject line DOILFBO220026 and email your question to: amacauley@blm.gov with a cc to blm_or_so_952_mail@blm.gov at the BLM Branch of Procurement, Oregon State Office."

column3: ",Purchasing,,570-247-7373,,,"LEGAL NOTICE Rome Township, Bradford County, is seeking bids on the following stone: - 1,000 tons +/- state certified DSA @ 5-7 % moisture Price delivered to Shoemaker RD & price picked up at quarry. Must have at least 4 trucks that can tailgate 6-inch lifts. - 1,000 tons +/- non-certified DSA @ 5-7% moisture. Price delivered to Shoemaker RD & price picked up at quarry. Must have at least 4 trucks that can tailgate 6-inch lifts. - 1,000 tons +/- crushed clean 3's, 1.5""- 3"". Price delivered to Shoemaker RD & price picked up at quarry. - 150 tons +/- R6 Price delivered to Bliss RD and Joyce RD intersection. Price picked up at quarry. - 200 tons +/- DSA at 5-7% moisture. Price delivered to the township building stock pile & price picked up at quarry. - 500 +/- tons DSA @ 5-7% moisture. Price delivered to West Parks RD & price picked up at quarry. Must have at least 4 trucks that can tailgate 6-inch lifts. ROME TOWNSHIP SUPERVISORS RESERVE THE RIGHT TO REJECT ANY AND ALL BIDS. Sealed Bids must be on a PennDOT approved bid form. To obtain approved bid forms contact Nicki at 570-247-7373 or email request at rometwp@cableracer. com. For any other questions contact Jerry at 570-247-7373. Sealed bids should be clearly marked ""For Aggregate Bid Opening June 14,2022."" Mailing address 28083 Route 187 Wysox, Pa 18854. Sealed Bids will be opened at Rome Township Monthly Meeting at approximately 7:15 on June 14, 2022. Nicki Johnson for Rome Township Supervisors"

column1: Infrastructure: Materials (Aggregate, Asphalt, Concrete, Rocks, Salt, Sand) Bids,PA,Type 4 Cinders,State/Local,,"Ridgebury Township, Pennsylvania","Jun 7, 2022","Ridgebury Township, Pennsylvania",https://ridgeburytownship.com/,"Bids
column3: ",Purchasing Department,,,,,"OFFICIAL BID NOTICE RIDGEBURY TOWNSHIP Sealed and separate bids will be received by the Township Supervisors on or before Tuesday, June 7th, 2022 at 7pm, and opened shortly thereafter at the meeting being held at the Ridgebury Township Municipal Building, 13278 Berwick Turnpike, Gillett, PA. Bids are being received for the following: The delivery of 1,000 ton more or less or equivalent measurement in yards of Penn DOT approved Type 4 cinders to be stockpiled at the Ridgebury Township Garage. Weight of the cinders not to be over 2,000 lbs/yard. Computerized weight tickets must be completed at the point of loading and signed by a certified weigh master if unit of measurement is tons. Every truck must have a weight or yard measurement ticket at the time of delivery and meet the above criteria or the load will be rejected. The delivery of 500 ton more or less or equivalent measurement in yards of black cinders to be stockpiled at the Ridgebury Township Garage. Computerized weight tickets must be completed at the point of loading and signed by a certified weigh master if unit of measurement is tons. Every truck must have a weight or yard measurement ticket at the time of delivery and meet the above criteria or the load will be rejected. All bids must be on a Ridgebury Township Bid Form, sealed and addressed to Ridgebury Township, 13278 Berwick Turnpike, Gillett, PA 16925 and must indicate on the outside of the envelope the type of bid being submitted. A sample of the cinders is required. The successful bidder shall be required to furnish a bond guaranteeing performance of the contract with sufficient surety in the amount of ten (10%) of the amount of contract no more than twenty (20) days after the contract has been awarded. Specifications, bidding forms, and all necessary information may be secured at the Ridgebury Township Office, 570-596-2731 or email at rburytwp@gmail.com The Board of Supervisors of Ridgebury Township reserves the right to reject any or all bids. All bids must be received by June 7th, 2022, 7pm. Tammi Talada, Ridgebury Township Secretary"

column1: Infrastructure: Materials (Aggregate, Asphalt, Concrete, Rocks, Salt, Sand) Bids,PA,Asphalt and Concrete Paving Services ? WOCC,State/Local,,State of Pennsylvania,"Jun 8, 2022",State of Pennsylvania,http://www.emarketplace.state.pa.us/Solicitations.aspx?SID=MU-22-01,"MU-22-01
column3: ",Purchasing,,717-787-5733,,,"MU-22-01:  Asphalt and Concrete Paving Services ? WOCC  Mansfield University of the PA State System of Higher Education invites Asphalt/Concrete Paving Contractors to download bid documents for this project.    Work included under this project consists of Asphalt and Concret Paving Services ? WOCC.  Unit-priced Work Order Contract for Construction (WOCC), against which Individual Work Orders (IWO) will be issued.    Scope of Work shall include, but is not necessarily limited to new asphalt, pot hole repair, or replacement of existing asphalt concrete paving such as roadways, parking lots, walkways, and the application of asphalt seal coat, and line painting, and minor site restorations.  All work is based on a unit prices outlined in Section 012200.    The contract will be awarded as an open ended Work Order Contract for Construction (WOCC) for a one year period, and contain options to renew for four additional one year periods. Individual Work Orders (IWO) will be issued against the open ended WOCC.   Any escalation of annual costs for the renewal years will be handled as described below:
column4: The unit prices on the Contractor's Bid Form shall be the Contractual unit prices for the first year of the Contract.  For subsequent years of the Contract, Contractual unit prices will be subject to escalation. The basis for any escalation (increase or decrease) shall be The Consumer Price Index For All Urban Consumers (CPI-U), US City Average, as published by United States Department of Labor, Bureau of Labor Statistics.  Contractual unit prices will be subject to escalation only at each Contract Renewal. The base CPI-U for this Contract is that for March 2022, 287.504, It will be compared with the most recently-available CPI-U when any Contract Renewal is prepared.    The Bid package is available at http://seller.ariba.com  In order to submit a proposal, interested bidders need to register http://seller.ariba.com     Registration is a free process that takes only a few minutes. Once registered, bidders may obtain all solicitation documents, receive notification of solicitation updates, and submit and update their confidential bids online. Ariba Discovery ? Source Point Bid Event provides bid privacy, security and supplier confidentiality, while streamlining the overall procurement process. Although all solicitations are available for public viewing, interested suppliers need to register to be able to submit a bid.  Directions: visit www.mansfield.edu for general driving directions"

column1: Supplies: Ammunition, Guns, Weapons, Flares Bids,VA,PM AAA ACV Training Device,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 15, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/2099c75471954e3dae6e642154131263/view,"M6785422R0059
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,janice.weiland@usmc.mil,,"Program Manager, Advanced Amphibious Assault (PM AAA) is planning for the design, development and delivery of a suite of Training Systems incorporating advanced technological solutions to support the Amphibious Combat Vehicle (ACV). This training device suite includes maintenance trainers, operator trainers, and digital classrooms. This effort will include developing engineering drawings, manufacturing, and providing test support for the ACV Training Systems. This is not a request for instructors. The ACV platform is currently being produced by BAE Systems (BAE) under competitively awarded contract M67854-16-C-0006. The Government does not currently own the required rights to the ACV Technical Data Package (TDP); however, the Government will be taking delivery of TDP within the next 12 months and that TDP which is available with Government purpose rights will be provided to the successful Contractor, should a contract be awarded for this effort. The Government will provide an ACV (that is, a vehicle) as Government Furnished Equipment to the successful Contractor, should a contract be awarded for this effort. PM AAA desires the resultant Training Systems to maintain commonality with the ACV Family of Vehicles (FOV)."

column1: Supplies: Ammunition, Guns, Weapons, Flares Bids,VA,80GSFC22R0041 - GeoCarb Access to Space (GCATS) Request for Proposals,Federal,,National Aeronautics and Space Administration,"Jun 13, 2022",National Aeronautics and Space Administration,https://sam.gov/opp/afffb51fb8d549cbadce754a621b62d7/view,"80GSFC22R0041
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-358-2088,michelle.l.crawford@nasa.gov,,"This is a Request for Proposals (RFP) for GeoCarb Access to Space (GCATS) Mission. The overall needs for GCATS are envisioned to include: spacecraft; observatory integration and test; command uplink from the industry-provided Mission Operations Center (MOC); downlink of GeoCarb engineering and science telemetry to the industry-allocated Ground Station(s); delivery of error-checked GeoCarb data to various mission partners; and all related tasks and support needed during the planned GeoCarb Mission (i.e., launch support, in-orbit check-out, and three years of mission operations) and three one-year options for continued mission operations. Notice is hereby provided that access to the drawings and specifications will be limited to offerors certified by Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) Joint Certification Program (JCP). Specifications and Drawings have an Export Determination of EAR 99 and are considered controlled documents. Therefore, download of documents will not be permitted until requesters have been cleared through DLA JCP. All contractors interested in receiving drawings and specifications for this project will have to ensure they have been screened by the DLA JCP by completing a DD Form 2345. To complete the DD Form 2345, go to the website at: https://www.dla.mil/HQ/LogisticsOperations/Services/JCP/SpecificDD2345Instructions.asp If a contractor has been previously screened by DLA, they can verify if their status is still active by utilizing their CAGE code at: https://public.logisticsinformationservice.dla.mil/jcp/search.aspx Requesting copies of export controlled documents for accessing the full solicitation shall be handled through SAM.gov.? Please submit your CAGE code and confirmation of processed DD Form 2345 with your request for access to the controlled documents. It is the offeror's responsibility to monitor this website for the release of updates and amendments to the solicitation. Potential offerors will be responsible for downloading their own copy of the solicitation and amendments (if any). Please refer to the 80GSFC22R0041 Cover Letter below for additional information. 23 May 2022 - Amendment 0001 posted along with an additional reference document (GPR8730.5A) and 20 RFP Questions and Responses."

column1: Supplies: Ammunition, Guns, Weapons, Flares Bids,VA,Development of Medium Tactical Vehicle System Replacement (MTVR) and Logistics Vehicle System Replacement (LVSR) Stability Control System,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jul 7, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/f856a27407fc4332bc38312438906bfe/view,"M67854-22-I-5408
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,francesca.deza@usmc.mil,,"MARCORSYSCOM is seeking interested sources capable of performing the following tasks: - Provide technical capability in developing and MTVR and LVSR Stability control system using technology that may be commercially available. - Provide technical capability in outlining the feasibility approach in developing MTVR and LVSR stability control system. - Provide technical capability in Testing & Optimization of the MTVR and LVSR stability control system prototype. - Provide technical capability in technical data and interfaces of the MTVR and LVSR stability control system prototype. - Provide technical capability in current USMC maintenance capabilities and resources for implementation of stability control system. - Provide technical capability in sustainment documentation to include but not limited to: provisioning, installation, fault diagnostics, and maintenance of the MTVR and LVSR stability control system. The vendor shall have the ability to transition the prototype system into production for the retrofit of the stability control into MTVR and LVSR."

column1: Supplies: Ammunition, Guns, Weapons, Flares Bids,VA,FY22-FY26 Strategic Trends Division Broad Agency Announcement (BAA),Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 10, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/f058c5b5fa3c4fe89f70c7ba4468ad19/view,"HDTRA1-22-S-0004
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,roberto.saenz2.ctr@mail.mil,,"The Defense Threat Reduction Agency (DTRA) enables the U.S. Department of?Defense (DoD), the U.S. Government (USG), and International Partners to?counter and deter Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD) and emerging threats.??DTRA's Strategic? integration Directorate (SI), Strategic Trends and Effects?Department (ST), Strategic Trends Division (SI-STT) seeks white papers and?proposals from outstanding public and private research institutions to?deliver research products that generate operationally- relevant, timely,?credible, actionable insights and recommendations into emerging threats?within DTRA?s mission space in order to enable and guide warfighter?understanding of the range of military operations in the next five (5) to?ten (10) years.?? The research, executed under the Strategic Trends?Research Initiative (STRI), shall contribute to SI-STT's efforts to?characterize the future? battlespace to inform future DTRA and DoD?operations, activities, and investments, particularly in areas most?relevant to DTRA?s mission space. STRI delivers analytic research products that not only provide insight into?the future battlespace in mission-relevant areas but also identify?operationally-relevant recommendations for how (in priority order) DTRA,?DoD, and more broadly the USG can address the identified challenges,?threats, and issues, including in cooperation with partners and allies.??While analytic research can take many forms, DTRA SI-STT prioritizes the?development of analytic research reports resulting from strategic?dialogues, studies, and tabletop exercises (TTXs).? DTRA SI-STT will?provide guidance and direction throughout the life of awarded projects to?ensure they meet DTRA?s needs. The awarded research efforts under this Broad Area Announcement (BAA)?constitute applied research and development rather than assistance and?advisory services. DTRA SI-STT is soliciting independently-produced?deliverables that are designed to identify and answer specific research?questions using a specific research methodology that the applicant?proposes.? These methodologies (or approaches) can involve the conduct of a?strategic dialogue or TTX as a mechanism to answer the specified research?question.? The dialogue or TTX itself is not the expected output from the?research project.? Rather, it is the analysis of the findings from those?events to inform a broader analytic research effort.? The rigorous analysis?will result in research products, which will inform DTRA and DoD?s?thinking and advance applied scientific and technical knowledge in the?specified topic area."

column1: Supplies: Ammunition, Guns, Weapons, Flares Bids,VA,NSF Regional Innovation Engines,Federal,,National Science Foundation,"Sep 29, 2022",National Science Foundation,https://sam.gov/opp/c563d8cbc6f84b4c984b7a969a5ec357/view,"NSFBAA-ENGINES-2022-
column5: ",,,,kboyea@nsf.gov,,"NSF Engines BAA Description This Broad Agency Announcement (BAA) is the first funding opportunity for the NSF Regional Innovation Engines (NSF Engines) program, a bold new initiative of the National Science Foundation that will create regional-scale innovation ecosystems throughout the United States. Providing up to $160 million of funding over up to 10 years to establish each Engine, with up to an additional two years of development funding even before the official launch of an Engine, the program offers a unique opportunity to usher in a transformational revolution of economic growth by harnessing the Nation?s rich science and technology research enterprise and regional-level resources to address societal challenges and promote national competitiveness. This BAA provides an overview of the NSF Engines program and two current funding opportunities, Type-1 and Type-2 awards, open to coalitions led by U.S.-based for-profit businesses, non-profit organizations, and U.S. accredited institutions of higher education with a campus located in the U.S. Additionally, federally funded research and development centers, national laboratories, and state, local, and Native American Tribal governments (limited to agencies, offices, or divisions specifically dedicated to innovation, economic and/or workforce development) can receive NSF funds through subawards. KEY DEADLINES (by 5 p.m., submitter?s local time on the dates specified below). Failure to meet the established deadline date will result in the proposal not being reviewed. Type-1 and Type-2 Concept Outlines:? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ?Due June 30, 2022 Type-1 Letters of Intent:? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ?Due August 31, 2022 Type-1 Full Proposals:? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ?Due September 29, 2022 NSF anticipates accepting full proposals for Type-2 awards in FY23, on a date to be announced soon. Information for organizations who have not previously applied for federal grants: If your organization has not previously applied for a federal grant, your organization must obtain a Unique Entity Identifier (UEI), which is a 12-character alpha numeric value, and must also register in the System for Award management (SAM). Go to SAM.gov and complete the process through the ?Register Your Entity or Get a Unique Entity ID? box. Scroll down on the site for FAQs. Note that registering with SAM.gov can take time so start the process very early in the application window! The NSF Engines program will be providing further guidance on the submission process in the coming weeks."

column1: Supplies: Ammunition, Guns, Weapons, Flares Bids,VA,80GSFC22R0041 - GeoCarb Access to Space (GCATS) Request for Proposals,Federal,,National Aeronautics and Space Administration,"Jun 13, 2022",National Aeronautics and Space Administration,https://sam.gov/opp/89071da5d4ae45a4be4a89b48aebc6ac/view,"80GSFC22R0041
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-358-2088,michelle.l.crawford@nasa.gov,,"This is a Request for Proposals (RFP) for GeoCarb Access to Space (GCATS) Mission. The overall needs for GCATS are envisioned to include: spacecraft; observatory integration and test; command uplink from the industry-provided Mission Operations Center (MOC); downlink of GeoCarb engineering and science telemetry to the industry-allocated Ground Station(s); delivery of error-checked GeoCarb data to various mission partners; and all related tasks and support needed during the planned GeoCarb Mission (i.e., launch support, in-orbit check-out, and three years of mission operations) and three one-year options for continued mission operations. Notice is hereby provided that access to the drawings and specifications will be limited to offerors certified by Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) Joint Certification Program (JCP). Specifications and Drawings have an Export Determination of EAR 99 and are considered controlled documents. Therefore, download of documents will not be permitted until requesters have been cleared through DLA JCP. All contractors interested in receiving drawings and specifications for this project will have to ensure they have been screened by the DLA JCP by completing a DD Form 2345. To complete the DD Form 2345, go to the website at: https://www.dla.mil/HQ/LogisticsOperations/Services/JCP/SpecificDD2345Instructions.asp If a contractor has been previously screened by DLA, they can verify if their status is still active by utilizing their CAGE code at: https://public.logisticsinformationservice.dla.mil/jcp/search.aspx Requesting copies of export controlled documents for accessing the full solicitation shall be handled through SAM.gov.? Please submit your CAGE code and confirmation of processed DD Form 2345 with your request for access to the controlled documents. It is the offeror's responsibility to monitor this website for the release of updates and amendments to the solicitation. Potential offerors will be responsible for downloading their own copy of the solicitation and amendments (if any). Please refer to the 80GSFC22R0041 Cover Letter below for additional information."

All contractors interested in receiving drawings and specifications for this project will have to ensure they have been screened by the DLA JCP by completing a DD Form 2345. To complete the DD Form 2345, go to the website at: https://www.dla.mil/HQ/LogisticsOperations/Services/JCP/SpecificDD2345Instructions.asp If a contractor has been previously screened by DLA, they can verify if their status is still active by utilizing their CAGE code at: https://public.logisticsinformationservice.dla.mil/jcp/search.aspx Requesting copies of export controlled documents for accessing the full solicitation shall be handled through SAM.gov.? Please submit your CAGE code and confirmation of processed DD Form 2345 with your request for access to the controlled documents. It is the offeror's responsibility to monitor this website for the release of updates and amendments to the solicitation. Potential offerors will be responsible for downloading their own copy of the solicitation and amendments (if any). Please refer to the 80GSFC22R0041 Cover Letter below for additional information."

column1: Supplies: Ammunition, Guns, Weapons, Flares Bids,DC,Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) Set-Aside (FAR 19.14): Exapandable/Collapsible Batons and Holsters,Federal,,Department of Justice,Today ,Department of Justice,https://sam.gov/opp/928c64a991f84fb9aa90ab3f42ec9ca2/view,"15BNAS22Q00000019
column5: ",Purchasing,,888-REG-FAIR,k2redman@bop.gov,,"The BOP is a large agency with approximately 37,000 employees located at over 130 duty stations across the United States and Puerto Rico. The Federal Bureau of Prisons (Bureau) has a requirement for the procurement of expandable/collapsible batons and holsters. The BOP intends to award a single award BPA for one year base performance period and four additional one year performance periods.? The estimated requirements for the batons and holsters includes: Base Year:?Estimated maximum quantity of 4000 batons, 4000 holsters.? Option Year 1:?Estimated maximum quantity of 1000 batons, 1000 holsters.? Option Year 2:?Estimated maximum quantity of 1000 batons, 1000 holsters.? Option Year 3:?Estimated maximum quantity of 1000 batons, 1000 holsters.? Option Year 4:?Estimated maximum quantity of 1000 batons, 1000 holsters.? The product and services specifications offered shall be in accordance with the Statement of Work. This solicitation?will be distributed solely through the General Services Administration?s beta.sam.gov.? Hard copies of the quotation will not be available.? The site provides downloading instructions. All future information about this acquisition, including quotation amendments, will be distributed solely through this site. Interested parties are responsible for monitoring this site to ensure that they have the most up-to-date information about this acquisition. The estimated closing date will be on or about?June 3, 2022,?at?2:00 pm ET.? The BOP anticipates awarding a single award BPA.? All responsible business concerns may submit a quote which will be considered by this agency. Questions concerning this Pre-Solicitation Notice should be directed to Kasie Redman, Contract Specialist, by email at k2redman@bop.gov. Contract Pricing Products and services are required to be provided in accordance with specifications set forth in the Statement of Work in this solicitation. Products and Services are required to be provided by the contractor in accordance with specifications set forth in this solicitation. This acquisition will be procured in accordance with FAR?Part 12 ? Acquisition of Commercial Items and Part 13 ? Simplified Acquisition Procedures. The Government intends to make a single award BPA to a quoter, pursuant to an affirmative determination of responsibility, whose quotation, conforming to the solicitation, is determined to be the best value to the Government considering price and past performance history.?? Price: Price shall be evaluated utilizing the total aggregate pricing offered by the quoter (base year plus all option years).?? Past Performance: The Past Performance Information Retrieval System (PPIRS) at www.ppirs.gov will be utilized to evaluate past performance history."

column1: Supplies: Ammunition, Guns, Weapons, Flares Bids,DC,Long Range Aerial Delivered Maritime Mine (LRADMM),Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jul 8, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/7734f27aa4ea416ab537d519613e684b/view,"N00024-22-R-6408
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,matthew.c.hedrick.civ@us.navy.mil,,"This Request for Information/Sources Sought notice is for market research purposes only and does NOT constitute an invitation for bid, request for quotation, request for proposal, or any obligation on the part of the Government to acquire any products or services. This notice shall not be construed as a contract, a promise to contract, or as a commitment of any kind by the Government. The Government is NOT seeking or accepting unsolicited proposals. This notice is a market research tool being used to determine overall market developments, capabilities, and adequacy of the industrial base capable of providing the supplies/services described herein prior to determining requirements and the method of acquisition. Any information submitted by respondents to this technical description is strictly voluntary. This notice is issued by the Department of the Navy, Naval Sea Systems Command (NAVSEA), on behalf of the Program Executive Office (PEO) Undermanned and Small Combatants (USC), Mine Warfare Program Office (PMS 495). The Navy is conducting market research in accordance with FAR Part 10 to determine whether industry possesses the requisite capabilities to successfully design, manufacture, assemble, test and deliver a long-range air delivered maritime mine. In addition, this notice requests industry comment on how the Government can best satisfy its needs, alternative approaches, technology availability and risk, the identification of cost drivers, and suggestions on ways to enhance or sustain competition. Combatant Commanders require the capability to precisely and accurately emplace maritime mines in contested environments from an extended standoff range.? Existing mine laying aircraft must fly directly over each planned minefield at low altitude and speed to deliver mines, leaving the aircraft vulnerable to adversary air defense systems. The objective of this notice is to help the Government determine the existing capabilities to deliver an LRADMM system in the shortest practical timeline. ? The LRADMM system shall consist of in-production air vehicle that can be modified to precisely and accurately deliver a maritime mine. The LRADMM system shall be capable of powered flight for a minimum distance of [Refer to Classified Appendix] or greater after release from the launch platform. The LRADMM system shall deliver an explosive payload of at least 1000lb. The LRADMM system shall deliver the payload with that an accuracy no greater than [Refer to Classified Appendix] 2 Distance Root Mean Squared (DRMS) without GPS input (GPS-denied). The LRADMM system shall at a minimum be capable of launching from U.S. Air Force and Navy aircraft external munition stores stations with internal munitions stores stations as an option. Interested and capable parties will need to demonstrate the requisite level of technical expertise, as well as the ability to fulfill the capabilities described in this notice. Respondents are requested to submit a white paper including capability statements pertinent and specific in the technical and programmatic approach as follows: Potential solutions describing range estimation, accuracy, and payload size. Dimensions, weight, and power available for a mine payload with a general description of interfaces available for power, data, and mechanical connections, and any payload throughput requirements. An understanding of the major engineering challenges, risks and tradeoffs to achieving the desired capability. A top level schedule for achieving an initial capability of a minimum of XX systems (see classified annex) in the shortest practical timeline after contract award. A presentation of your organization's relevant knowledge, skills, and abilities particularly in regards to weapons and explosives and integration onto air vehicles. Current Technology Readiness Levels (TRLs) and maturity of potential solutions. Interested parties shall list past customers (maximum of 3) for whom the contractor has done projects of a similar technology, domain, and/or scope within the last five (5) years.? Request For Information/Sources Sought Document Access: Respondents are required to have Defense Security Service (DSS) issued SECRET facility clearance, SECRET personnel clearances, and SECRET safeguarding capability to gain access to the classified attributes. Companies must fill out and return the Terms of Use (TOU) agreement (Attachment A) via electronic mail to: TO: Mr. Matt Hedrick, matthew.c.hedrick.civ@us.navy.mil CC: Mr. Adam Alverson, adam.d.alverson.civ@us.navy.mil; Mr. Eric Gonzalez, eric.m.gonzalez3.civ@us.navy.mil SUBJECT LINE: Long Range Aerial Delivered Maritime Mine (insert company name) N00024-22-R-6408 TOU Upon receipt and approval of the TOU agreement by the contracting officer, the classified attributes will be made available in a secure manner to the respondents so long as the respondent has met the security requirements detailed. Responses: Interested parties must demonstrate their capability of providing the above-mentioned services and meet SECRET clearance requirements are invited to indicate their interest by providing: Company name Company address Overnight delivery address (if different from mailing address), CAGE code Point of Contact, to include E-mail address, Telephone number Facility clearance Business Size Status (i.e. Large, SB, VOSB, SDVOSB, WOSB, etc.) Number of Employees Interested parties are requested to respond to this notice in PDF or Microsoft Word Office 2010-compatible format. ?Please limit responses to 25 pages or less (including cover, administrative pages, and descriptive literature); 1-inch margins; and 12 point font (or larger). Response Deadline and Submissions: Responses are requested no later than 8 July 2022 at 5:00 PM EST.? Responses shall be submitted via e-mail only to the PCO, Mr. Matt Hedrick at matthew.c.hedrick.civ@us.navy.mil in PDF or Microsoft Word Format, with a CC to adam.d.alverson.civ@us.navy.mil , eric.m.gonzalez3@navy.mil. ? Proprietary information, if any, must be clearly marked. ?The subject line of the email should read ""Long Range Aerial Delivered Maritime Mine Sources Sought.""? To aid the Government in its review and evaluation, please segregate proprietary information. Please be advised that all submissions become Government property and will not be returned. ?It should be noted that telephone replies will not be accepted. DISCLAIMER AND IMPORTANT NOTES: This notice is not a request for proposals and is not to be construed as a commitment by the Government to issue a solicitation. This notice does not obligate the Government to award a contract or otherwise pay for the information provided in response. Sources choosing to respond to this notice are wholly responsible for any costs/expenses associated with submitting a response. Therefore any cost associated with the market survey submission is solely at the interested vendor's expense. ?The Government reserves the right to use information provided by respondents for any purpose deemed necessary and legally appropriate. ?Any organization responding to this notice should ensure that its response is complete and sufficiently detailed to allow the Government to determine the organization's qualifications to perform the work. ?Respondents are advised that the Government is under no obligation to acknowledge receipt of the information received or provide feedback to respondents with respect to any information submitted. ?Respondents will not be notified of the results of this notice. ?The information obtained from submitted responses may be used in development of an acquisition strategy and a future solicitation. ?Submissions will not be returned."

column1: Supplies: Ammunition, Guns, Weapons, Flares Bids,DC,NASA Announcement of Opportunity for Third Stand Alone Missions of Opportunity Notice (SALMON-3),Federal,,National Aeronautics and Space Administration,"Sep 1, 2022",National Aeronautics and Space Administration,https://sam.gov/opp/b5a74d9fdd5e4212bd2dbf4495f19f96/view,"NNH17ZDA004O
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-358-2088,michael.h.new@nasa.gov,,"This April 2022 SAM.gov amendment to the Third Stand Alone Missions of Opportunity Notice (SALMON-3) announces that the NASA Solicitation and Proposal Integrated Review and Evaluation System (NSPIRES) has been updated to show May 1, 2023, as the new closing date for SALMON-3.? NASA also has shortened the title of the SAM.gov title that was published first by the FBO in 2017. On March 22, 2017, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) released the Third Stand Alone Missions of Opportunity Notice (SALMON-3) Announcement of Opportunity, and the full text of the solicitation became available on the NASA Solicitation and Proposal Integrated Review and Evaluation System (NSPIRES) at http://nspires.nasaprs.com/. SALMON-3 is an omnibus NASA Announcement of Opportunity (AO). ?? The SALMON-3 AO provides a solicitation and procurement base (the common AO body) for modest investigations, also referred to as Missions of Opportunity (MO), requiring space flight that advance the high priority science, exploration, and technology objectives of NASA's Science Mission Directorate, Human Exploration and Operations Mission Directorate, and the Space Technology Mission Directorate. The SALMON-3 AO describes the common requirements for all MO proposal opportunities, as outlined in the AO body and common Appendices A through H. Subsequent appendices called Program Element Appendices, or PEAs, document specific requirements for each proposal opportunity.? At the time of this AO's release, Appendix I, the MMX Neutron Gamma-Ray Spectrometer Investigation, was the only proposal opportunity. Subsequently, additional proposal opportunities, PEAs J through O, have been added.? A PEA-specific FBO notice highlights an opportunity to propose when NASA amends SALMON-3 to add a new or to revise an existing PEA. This FBO notice announces that NSPIRES will post an amendment to SALMON-3's common AO body on or after October 22, 2019.? Prior to the issuance of this amendment, NASA released PEAs I through O as amendments to the SALMON-3 AO; therefore, this amendment does not change PEAs I through O.? PEAs released after the date of this amendment are subject to these changes unless specified otherwise in the PEA. This FBO notice is not a complete or verbatim summary of the changes included in Amendment 17 to the common body of SALMON-3; therefore, it is necessary to visit NSPIRES and download the full version of the common AO body. NASA is modifying SALMON-3 to make several changes to better align the common AO body to version 5.0 of the Standard Principal Investigator (PI)-led Mission AO Template found at https://soma.larc.nasa.gov/standardao/sao_templates.html.? The amendment's changes range from simple updates, e.g., a new point of contact for SALMON-3's common AO body, to complex matters related to requirements, sections, and common appendices that the PEAs share.? For example, for future PEAs that use the Two-Step evaluation process, several requirements are deferred to Step Two.? For PEAs with a Single or One-Step evaluation process, deferrals are not possible. Other changes include: 1. Some NASA documents referenced in SALMON-3 have newer versions and the newer document references replace the older versions. 2. Appendix H adds a note acknowledging that in December 2020 the Duns and Bradstreet Universal Numbering System will no longer be the official identifier (ID) for doing business with the U.S. Government and references the source-for-more information URL: gsa.gov/entityid. Participation in SALMON-3 opportunities is, in general, open to all categories of organizations (U.S. and non-U.S.), including educational institutions, industry, not-for-profit organizations, Federally Funded Research and Development Centers, NASA Centers, the Jet Propulsion Laboratory, and other Government agencies.? ?It is necessary to visit NSPIRES and download the full text of the common AO body for the details of the types of limitations that NASA may place on a specific, contracted evaluation, assessment, or support organization.? This FBO notice summarizes two types of limitation as: 1. Full Limitation: NASA precludes a support organization from participating in any capacity in support of a respondent under this AO. 2. Partial Limitation: Under appropriate circumstances and conditions that are specified in the SALMON-3 AO common body, or in a specific PEA, NASA permits respondents to contract with a NASA support organization for certain services. The SALMON-3 common AO body lists the names of two NASA-contracted evaluation-support organizations, Cornell Technical Services (CTS) and Arctic Slope Regional Corporation (ASRC) and its subsidiaries and affiliates.? Participation by these two organizations is subject to full limitation in proposed investigations as described in detail in the common AO body. SALMON-3 also lists an independent program assessment organization, Aerospace Corporation (Aerospace).? Aerospace's participation may or may not be subject to a full or a partial limitation. Sometimes individual PEAs place other restrictions or limitations on categories of organizations, such as limiting non-U.S. organizations to collaborating only with a U.S. Lead. The SALMON-3 solicitation is open from March 22, 2017, through March 18, 2022. Lapses in Government funding may impact some dates specified in the SALMON-3 AO, including some PEAs.? In the event of future lapses to the NASA operations, proposers should visit NSPIRES, the official NASA source for the full SALMON-3, including all of its PEAs.? NASA reserves the right not to make any additional awards or cancel this AO at any time.? Address questions or comments concerning the SALMON-3 common AO body via E-mail to Dr. Michael H. New, Deputy Associate Administrator for Research, Science Mission Directorate, NASA HQ, Washington, DC 20546; E-mail: Michael.H.New@nasa.gov.? In the subject line of such emails, please type ""SALMON-3 Common AO Body."" Responses to inquiries will be given by E-mail and when appropriate posted to the SALMON-3 AO Questions and Answers, (QAs) located at https://soma.larc.nasa.gov/salmon-3/S3QAs.html.? Anonymity of persons/institutions who submit questions will be preserved."
