column1: Supplies: Ammunition, Guns, Weapons, Flares Bids,DC,RESEARCH OPPORTUNITIES IN SPACE AND EARTH SCIENCES (ROSES) 2022,Federal,,National Aeronautics and Space Administration,"May 12, 2023",National Aeronautics and Space Administration,https://sam.gov/opp/0be0a12886c34d98acd9ddf4203c5007/view,"NNH22ZDA001N
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-358-2088,sara@nasa.gov,,"The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Science Mission Directorate (SMD) announces that its annual NASA Research Announcement (NRA), Research Opportunities in Space and Earth Sciences (ROSES) ? 2022 will be released on or about February 14, 2022.??http://solicitation.nasaprs.com/ROSES2022. ROSES is an omnibus solicitation with many individual program elements, each with its own due dates and topics. Table 2 and Table 3 of this NRA, which will be posted at http://solicitation.nasaprs.com/ROSES2022table2 and http://solicitation.nasaprs.com/ROSES2022table3, respectively, provide proposal due dates and hypertext links to descriptions of the solicited program elements in the Appendices of this NRA. Together, these program elements cover the wide range of basic and applied supporting research and technology in space and Earth sciences supported by SMD. The ROSES NRA is written to allow any individual program element to issue any type of award but, at the time of release, all elements are written so that extramural awards will be grants or cooperative agreements. In general, contracts would not be appropriate for the nature of the work solicited. Organizations of every type, domestic and foreign, Government and private, for profit and not-for-profit, may submit proposals without restriction on teaming arrangements. Note that it is NASA policy that all research involving non-U.S. organizations will be conducted on the basis of no exchange of funds. Awards range from under $100K per year for focused, limited efforts (e.g., data analysis) to more than $1M per year for extensive activities (e.g., development of hardware for science experiments and/or flight). Periods of performance are typically three years, but some programs may allow up to five years and others specify shorter periods. The funds available and the anticipated number of awards are given in each program element and range from less than one to several million dollars, which allows for selection from a few to as many as several dozen proposals. Electronic submission of proposals is required by the respective due dates for each program element and must be submitted by an authorized official of the proposing organization. Electronic proposals may be submitted via the NASA proposal data system NSPIRES or via Grants.gov. Every organization that intends to submit a proposal in response to ROSES-2022 must be registered with NSPIRES; organizations that intend to submit proposals via Grants.gov must be registered with Grants.gov in addition to being registered with NSPIRES. Such registration must identify the authorized organizational representative(s) (AOR) who will submit the electronic proposal. All proposal team members must be registered in NSPIRES regardless of the submission system so we may perform automatic organizational conflict of interest checking of reviewers. Potential proposers and proposing organizations are urged to access the system(s) well in advance of the proposal due date(s) of interest to familiarize themselves with its structure and to enter the requested information. Notices of intent to propose and Step-1 Proposals will be due starting in April 2022 and Full (Step-2) Proposals will be due no earlier than May 16, 2022, through no later than May 12, 2023, by which time it is expected that the first full (Step-2) proposal due dates for next ROSES solicitation will occur. Potential proposers are strongly encouraged to read Section I(d) of the ROSES Summary of Solicitation that lists Significant Changes from Recent ROSES. To learn of the addition of new program elements and all amendments to this NRA, proposers may: (1) Subscribe to the SMD mailing lists (by logging in at http://nspires.nasaprs.com/ and checking the appropriate boxes under ""Account Management"" and ""Email Subscriptions""). (2) Get automatic updates of due dates using the ROSES-2022 due date Google calendar. Instructions will be available shortly after release at https://science.nasa.gov/researchers/sara/library-and-useful-links (link from the words due date calendar). (3) Check the ROSES-2022 Blog at https://science.nasa.gov/researchers/sara/grant-solicitations/roses-2022/. Frequently asked questions about ROSES-2022 will be posted at http://science.nasa.gov/researchers/sara/faqs/ shortly after release. Questions concerning the individual program elements in ROSES should be directed to the point(s) of contact in the Summary Table of Key Information at the end of the program element and at http://science.nasa.gov/researchers/sara/program-officers-list/. Subject matter experts are encouraged to sign up to be a volunteer reviewer at https://science.nasa.gov/researchers/volunteer-review-panels."

Services: Cleaning and Custodial Building Bids,OK,"Janitorial Services Various Locations, Ok Women-Owned Small Business (WOSB) Program Set-Aside (FAR 19.15) Solicitation",Federal,,Department of Defense,"Dec 9, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/0f517f8ef5954ca4a2c59d6feeb00485/view,"W912BV22Q0021
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,leroy.r.lemarr@usace.army.mil,,"Solicitation Notice ? Janitorial Services for Recruiting Stations Janitorial Various Locations, OK ? W912BV22Q0021 ? U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Southwestern Division (SWD), Tulsa District (SWT) intends to issue a commercial solicitation, W912BV22Q0021for Janitorial Services for Recruiting Stations Janitorial Services, Oklahoma City and Midwest City, OK. The solicitation will be issued as a 100% Women-Owned Small Business set aside. The North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) Code is 561720 and the applicable Small Business Size Standard, as established by the U.S. Small Business Administration, is $19.5M. The resulting contract(s) will be issued on a Firm Fixed Price basis for one (1) base period and four (4) option periods to be exercised at the Government?s discretion, to the responsible offeror whose offer is conforming to the requirements of the solicitation and will be most advantageous to the Government considering price, past performance, and conformance with Sub-Contractor Data. The anticipated award date is on or about December 31, 2021. The solicitation will be issued via Internet only on SAM.gov website at https://sam.gov/. It is the contractor?s responsibility to monitor the above-listed internet address for any posted changes. Any and all amendments posted shall be signed and submitted with the offer. Solicitation issue date is on or about November 19, 2021. Quotes are anticipated to be due on or about December 09, 2021. Contractors must be registered and current with System for Award Management (SAM) in order to receive a Government contract award. To register, the SAM.gov Internet address is: https://sam.gov/. ? The Previous Contract Number is:? W912BV-17-P-0028 The total value of the previous contract (base and options) was:? $54,000.00 The Incumbent Contractor is:? BURDINE, MARSHA K.? Any questions and inquiries related to this solicitation shall be submitted through Bidder?s Inquiry only. The Solicitation Number is:? ?????????? W912BV22Q0021 The Bidder Inquiry Key is:??? ?????????? 942RSC-2HIX4A The Bidder Inquiry System will be unavailable for new inquiries after December 06, 2021 in order to ensure adequate time is allotted to form an appropriate response and amend the solicitation, if necessary.? Clauses and provisions for Sustainability included in this solicitation: FAR 52.223-2 ? Affirmative Procurement of Biobased Products Under Service and Construction Contracts FAR 52.223-3 ? Hazardous Material Identification and Material Safety Data FAR 52.223-5 ? Pollution Prevention and Right-to-Know Information FAR 52.223-10 ? Waste Reduction Program FAR 52.223-17 ? Affirmative Procurement of EPA-Designated Items in Service and Construction Contracts FAR 52.223-18 ? Encouring Contractor Policies to Ban Test Messaging While Driving FAR 52.223-22 ? Public Disclosure of Greenhouse Gas Emissions and Reduction Goals-Representation"

column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,christina.m.elardo.civ@army.mil,,"This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. (ii)? Solicitation Number: W15QKN-22-R-5030, issued as a Request for Proposal. (iii)? The Solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2020-01, Effective 10 October 2019. (iv)? Other than full and open competition, 100% Small Business set-aside, NAICS code 561720, Size Standard: $19.5M (v)? See Attachment ?W15QKN-22-R-5030 (RELEASED)? for a list of line contract line item numbers. (vi)? Level 2+ and Level 3 Custodial Services in Johnstown, PA in support of the 99th Readiness Division. (vii)? See Attachment ?W15QKN-22-R-5030 (RELEASED)? for period of performance information and delivery terms. (viii)? Provision 52.212-1 (Dev), Instructions to Offerors-Commercial (DEVIATION 2018-O0018), applies to this acquisition. See Attachment ?W15QKN-22-R-5030 (RELEASED)? for addenda information. (ix) Provision 52.212-2, Evaluation-Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition. See Attachment ?W15QKN-22-R-5030 (RELEASED)? for addenda information. (x)? Offerors should include a completed copy of the provision at 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications?Commercial Items--Alternate I, with its offer. (xi)? Clause 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions-Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition See Attachment ?W15QKN-22-R-5030 (RELEASED)? for addenda information. (xii)? Clause at 52.212-5 (Dev), Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items (DEVIATION 2018-O0021), applies to this acquisition. See Attachment ?W15QKN-22-R-5030 (RELEASED)? for additional FAR clauses applicable to the acquisition. (xiii)? Additional contract requirements are identified in Attachment ?W15QKN-22-R-5030 (RELEASED)?. (xiv)? Defense Priorities and Allocations System (DPAS) and assigned rating. Not Applicable. (xv)? See Attachment ?W15QKN-22-R-5030 (RELEASED)? for proposal due date/time and method of submission. (xvi)? Contact Information Regarding the Solicitation: Contracting Officer, Katie J. Lyons, e-mail: katie.j.lyons.civ@army.mil , Phone: (609) 562-3535 and Contract Specialist, Christina M. Elardo, e-mail: Christina.m.elardo.civ@army.mil , Phone: (609) 562-2719"

column1: Services: Cleaning and Custodial Building Bids,TN,S299--621-22-2-5175-0049 BASE PLUS 2 CONTRACT. WINDOW CLEANING SERVICES,Federal,,Department of Veterans Affairs,"Sep 23, 2022",Department of Veterans Affairs,https://sam.gov/opp/26164c3a249e467f97c23b6eb45962bd/view,"36C24922Q0231
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-461-4300,ayslin.kennett@va.gov,,"Request for Information-Sources Sought Notice 36C24922Q0231 On behalf of the James H. Quillen VA Medical Center, Network Contracting Office (NCO) 9 is issuing this Sources Sought Notice as a means of conducting market research to identify parties having an interest in and the resources to support this requirement for a firm-fixed priced contract for window washing. The result of this market research will contribute to determining the method of procurement. The applicable North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code assigned to this procurement is 561720. THERE IS NO SOLICITATION AT THIS TIME. This request for capability information does not constitute a request for proposals or quotes; submission of any information in response to this market survey is purely voluntary; and the government assumes no financial responsibility for any costs incurred. If your organization has the potential capacity to perform these services, please provide the following information: Organization name, address, point of contact, email address, Web site address, and telephone number. Business size: small, small disadvantaged, woman-owned, Hub Zone, serviced-disabled veteran-owned small business, large business, etc. Business type under North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) 561720, CAGE Code and DUNS Number. Under which NAICS code does your company usually provide the requirements described in the Statement of Work - Please provide rationale for your answer if different from NAICS 561720. Tailored capability statements addressing the particulars of this effort, with appropriate documentation supporting claims of organizational, and staff capability. Response to this Sources Sought shall not exceed 10 pages and should include all of the foremost mentioned information. In addition, all submissions should be provided electronically in a Microsoft Word or Adobe PDF format. The government will evaluate market information to ascertain potential market capacity to: Provide services consistent in scope and scale with those described in this notice and otherwise anticipated. Secure and apply the full range of corporate financial, human capital, and technical resources required to successfully perform similar requirements. Implement a successful plan that includes: compliance with program schedules; cost containment; meeting and tracking performance. Provide services under a firm-fixed price contract. NOTE: Respondent claiming SDVOSB and VOSB status shall be registered and Center for Veterans Enterprise (CVE) verified in VetBiz Registry www.vetbiz.gov. BASED ON THE RESPONSES TO THIS SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE/MARKET RESEARCH, THIS REQUIREMENT MAY BE SET-ASIDE FOR SDVOSB, VOSB, SMALL BUSINESSES OR PROCURED THROUGH FULL AND OPEN COMPETITION. Submission Instructions: Interested parties who consider themselves qualified to perform the services are invited to submit a response to this Sources Sought Notice by 8:00 am CT, March 23, 2022. All responses under this Sources Sought Notice must be emailed to Ayslin.kennett@va.gov. Telephone inquiries will not be accepted or acknowledged, and no feedback or evaluations will be provided to companies regarding their submissions. SAM: Interested parties shall be register in the System for Award Management (SAM) as prescribed in FAR Clause 52.232-33. SAM information can be obtained by accessing the internet at www.sam.gov or by calling 1-866-606-8220. Disclaimer and Important Notes. This notice does not obligate the government to award a contract or otherwise pay for the information provided in response. The government reserves the right to use information provided by respondents for any purpose deemed necessary and legally appropriate. Any organization responding to this notice should ensure that its response is complete and sufficiently detailed to allow the government to determine the organization s qualifications to perform the work. Respondents are advised that the government is under no obligation to acknowledge receipt of the information received or provide feedback to respondents with respect to any information submitted. After a review of the responses received, a pre-solicitation synopsis and solicitation may be published in Contract Opportunities. However, responses to this notice shall not be considered adequate responses to a solicitation. Confidentiality. No proprietary, classified, confidential, or sensitive information should be included in your response. The government reserves the right to use any non-proprietary technical information in any resultant solicitation(s)."

The Upper Trinity Regional Water District (UTRWD) is a political subdivision of the State of Texas and provides regional water, wastewater and other services to the Greater Denton County Area.  UTRWD is currently seeking Requests for Bids for Janitorial Services as detailed in the attached scope of work.

Upon approval, a one (1) year contract with four (1) consecutive one (1) year options to renew may be awarded to the most successful bidder.  Contract beginning and ending dates will be contingent upon approval and notification of award to successful bidder.  Tentatively, the beginning date of this contract will be August 20, 2022."

column1: Services: Cleaning and Custodial Building Bids,TX,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Healthcare Environmental Cleaning Communication,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Dec 31, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/53fa384ae9894c318ee94c2649366821/view,"HT001521HECDHA
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,deinor.a.bolanos.civ@mail.mil,,"Over the last 12 months, the HEC Program Office has been developing the Defense Health Agency (DHA) Healthcare Environmental Cleaning (HEC) enterprise-wide solution with three (3) main goals:? 1) standardized requirements across DoD medical facilities, 2) alignment with industry standards and improved compliance with all regulatory mandates, and 3) develop consistent, measurable quality performance objectives.? There have been four (4) previous industry surveys and special notices conducted during earlier Market Research efforts.? Related Sam.gov Postings: Special Notice: Healthcare Environmental Cleaning (HEC) Program https://sam.gov/opp/31fa0299ad5b469ea02e1907d65b6404/review Original Published Date: Sep 15, 2021 09:59 am CDT Sources Sought: Healthcare Environmental Cleaning (HEC) ? Request for Info/Survey #2 https://sam.gov/opp/da3cc98dec9e42b2a544ef66b5d37607/review Original Published Date: Apr 27, 2021 09:40 am CDT Sources Sought: Healthcare Environmental Services (HEC) Sources Sought https://sam.gov/opp/ddaa247e52254978880a1f9f2e1fdd57/review Original Published Date: Nov 27, 2020 01:58 pm CST Special Notice: Healthcare Environmental Cleaning (DHA IPN) https://sam.gov/opp/e54950bafe8c4d76976a932d47a55c64/view Original Published Date: Jul 14, 2020 10:27 am CDT The HEC Program Office developed this communication venue to provide information or draft documents to our industry partners as we continue to refine the requirement and determine the best strategy to meet all stakeholder interests.? This posting and future updates will serve as a comprehensive communication tool to keep interested companies informed, as well as provide a venue for industry partners to give the Government feedback.? The purpose of this informational posting is to provide the following draft documents:? 1) Performance Work Statement; 2) potential performance locations and 3) Quality Assurance Surveillance Plan. The two Word documents contain Line Numbers on the left-hand margin to ease company reference for comments to the Government.? If your company responds to this posting, include your company name as well as reference the document, page number, paragraph number, and the line number associated with the section regarding your questions or recommendations on the HEC_QandA_Workbook (Refer to Attachment 1).? The U.S. Government anticipates an Industry Day Forum in the near future, as such, responses to the questions received will be provided at the Industry Day.? Please note, any information regarding the Industry Day Forum will be publically posted/synopsized using this communication medium/Government point of entry.? Additionally, companies may want to dedicate some attention to applicable publications (Part 7 of the PWS) to ensure understanding of the latest regulatory mandates as appropriate and the below listed informational links:? ?? New Executive Order on Non-Displacement of Qualified Personnel ? https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/presidential-actions/2021/11/18/executive-order-on-nondisplacement-of-qualified-workers-under-service-contracts/ Service Contract Labor Standards - https://sam.gov/content/wage-determinations Collective Bargaining Agreements - https://www.dol.gov/agencies/olms/cba DHA Procedure Manuals - https://health.mil/Reference-Center/Policies ?DHA-PM 6430.04 -? Medical Logistics Healthcare Environmental Cleaning Services Management DHA-PM ?6430.02 - Linen Management This posting is issued solely for information and planning purposes ? it does not constitute a Request for Quote (RFQ)/Invitation for Bid (IFB)/Request for Proposal (RFP) or a promise to issue an RFQ, IFB or RFP in the future.? This notice does not commit the U.S. Government to contract for any supply or service.? Further, the U.S. Government is not seeking quotes, bids or proposals at this time and will not accept unsolicited proposals in response to this informational posting.? The U.S. Government will not pay for any information or administrative costs incurred in response to this posting. Submittals will not be returned to the responder.? Questions and/or comments may be submitted to Ms. Stephani Preusser at stephani.n.preusser.civ@mail.mil and Mr. Deinor Bolanos at deinor.a.bolanos.civ@mail.mil on or before 4:00 p.m. (local San Antonio, TX time) 13 January 2022 on the HEC_QandA_Workbook (Refer to Attachment 1). The Government appreciates and values your time and assistance!"

column5: ",Purchasing,,202-461-4300,Paul.Speedling@va.gov,,"This is a SOURCES SOUGHT ANNOUNCEMENT ONLY.  It is neither a solicitation announcement nor a request for proposals or quotes and does not obligate the Government to award a contract. Requests for a solicitation will not receive a response. Responses to this Sources Sought must be in writing. The purpose of this Sources Sought Announcement is for market research to make appropriate acquisition decisions and to gain knowledge of potential qualified businesses interested and capable of providing the requested commodities. The NAICS Code is 333923; size standard is 1,250 employees. 100% small business set-aside. Responses to this notice shall include the following: (a) company name  b) address (c) socio-economic status, (d) point of contact (e) phone, fax, and email (f) DUNS number (g) Cage Code  (h) Tax ID Number (i) and must  provide a capability statement that addresses the organizations qualifications and ability to perform as a contractor and provide the commodities described below.    Objective: VA New York Harbor Healthcare System, St. Albans Community Living Center is seeking sources for 2 Aerial Platform Scissor Lifts Required specifications: Platform Height: 31 9 Working Height: 37 9 Platform Weight Capacity: 700/1000 lbs. Power Source: Battery Wheel Load: 87 psi Cat Class: 405-1210 Dimensions: 99 x 46 x 93 Place of Delivery: St. Albans Community Living Center VA New York Harbor Healthcare System 179-00 Linden Blvd Queens, NY 11425 Attn: George Jordan The Government is not obligated to, nor will it pay for or reimburse any costs associated with responding to this sources sought request. This notice shall not be construed as a commitment by the Government to issue a solicitation or ultimately award a contract, nor does it restrict the Government to a particular acquisition approach. The Government will in no way be bound to this information if any solicitation is issued.  Notice to Potential Offerors: All Offerors who provide goods or services to the United States Federal Government must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM located on the web at www.sam.gov). It is desirable that any Offeror to have completed their business Online Representations and Certifications Application (ORCA). Additionally, all Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Businesses or Veteran Owned Small Businesses who respond to a solicitation on this project must be registered with the Department of Veterans Affairs Center for Veterans Enterprise VetBiz Registry located at http://vip.vetbiz.gov. Requests for information and resultant responses shall be submitted directly to the contracting officer, Paul Speedling at Paul.Speedling@va.gov. NO TELEPHONE CALLS WILL BE ACCEPTED. Response due no later than 15:00 Eastern Standard Time on June 8, 2022."

column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com,,"This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. The solicitation number is DRUMDPTMSKM0022 and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ), unless otherwise indicated herein. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 333111 with a small business size standard of 1,250.00 employees. This requirement is a Small Business Set-Aside and only qualified sellers may submit bids. The solicitation pricing on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com will start on the date this solicitation is posted, and, unless otherwise displayed at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com, will end on: 2022-06-07 14:30:00.0 Eastern Time. This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be FORT BRAGG, NC 28310 The MICC End User requires the following items, Brand Name or Equal, to the following: LI 001: TRACTOR, DIESEL, NEW, WITH FRONT LOADER/BUCKET, DIESEL ENGINE, SEE ATTACHED TRACTOR SPECIFICATION SHEET FOR FURTHER SPECIFICATIONS., 1, EA; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested Offerers must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, MICC End User intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. MICC End User is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerers that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerers that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerers that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerers may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. Should Offerers require additional clarification, notify the point of contact or Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com.Use of Unison Marketplace: Buyers and Sellers agree to conduct this transaction through Unison Marketplace in compliance with the Unison Marketplace Terms of Use. Failure to comply with the below terms and conditions may result in offer being determined as non-responsive. This is currently an unfunded requirement with a high expectation that funds will be available. When and if funds become available a contract will be awarded at that time. The offeror must comply with the following commercial item terms and conditions: FAR 52.252-1, Solicitation. Provisions Incorporated by Reference; FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors; 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications; FAR 52.211-6, Brand name or Equal. The following clauses apply to this solicitation: FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions ? Commercial Items. The following FAR clauses in paragraph (b) of FAR clause 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required To Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, apply: 52.204-10, Reporting Executive Compensation and First Tier Subcontract Awards; 52.219-6, Notice of Total Small Business Set-Aside; 52.219-28, Post Award Small Business Program Rerepresentation; 52.222-3, Convict Labor; 52.222-19, Child Labor-Cooperation with Authorities and Remedies; 52.222-21, Prohibition of Segregated Facilities; 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity; 52.222-36, Affirmative Action for Workers with Disabilities; 52.225-13, Restrictions on Certain Foreign Purchases; 52.232-33, Payment by Electronic Funds Transfer--System for Award Management. 52.233-4, Applicable Law for Breach of Contract Claim; The following DFARS clauses apply: DFARS 252.04-7004, Alternate A System for Award Management; 252.211-7003, Item Identification and Valuation; 252.225-7002, Qualifying Country Sources as Subcontractors; 252.232-7010, Levies on Contract Payments; 252.203-7000, Requirements Relating to Compensation of Former DoD Officials; 252.225-7001, Buy American Act and Balance Of Payments Program; 252.225-7036, Buy American Act -- Free Trade Agreements -- Balance of Payments Program; 252.232-7003, Electronic Submission of Payment Requests; 252.247-7023, Primary and ALT III, Transportation of Supplies by Sea. IAW 52.204-7 System for Award Management (SAM) Registration (July 2013), the offeror must be registered in SAM and fully input their Representations and Certifications for a complete record. Information can be found at http://www.sam.gov or by calling 866-606-8220, or 334-206-7828 for international calls. 52.204-13 - System for Award Management Maintenance Shipping is FOB Destination CONUS (CONtinental U.S.). New Equipment ONLY. NO USED OR REMANUFACTURED PRODUCTS WILL BE ACCEPTED. Submitted Quotes will be valid for 45 days after the auction closing. This solicitation is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ), not an invitation for bid (IFB).). IAW FAR 52.252-2 Clauses Incorporated by Reference, for the extended description here is the website: https://www.acquisition.gov/ The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement can be found. The small business size standard for that NAICS code can be found at https://www.sba.gov/sites/default/files/files/Size_Standards_Table.pdf 5152.233-4000 AMC-LEVEL PROTEST PROGRAM (Feb 2014) (LOCAL CLAUSE) Prior to submitting an agency protest, it is preferable that you first attempt to resolve your concerns with the responsible contracting officer (Phone: (315)772-7272 or Email: usarmy.drum.acc-micc.mbx.micc@mail.mil). However, you may also file a protest to the Headquarters (HQ), Army Materiel Command (AMC). The HQ AMC-Level Protest Program is intended to encourage interested parties to seek resolution of their concerns within AMC as an Alternative Dispute Resolution forum, rather than filing a protest with the Government Accountability Office (GAO) or other external forum. Contract award or performance is suspended during the protest to the same extent, and within the same time periods, as if filed at the GAO. The AMC protest decision goal is to resolve protests within 35 calendar days from filing. To be timely, protests must be filed within the periods specified in FAR 33.103. If you want to file a protest under the HQ AMC-Level Protest Program, the protest must request resolution under that program and be sent to the address below. Headquarters U.S. Army Materiel Command Office of Command Counsel-Deputy Command Counsel 4400 Martin Road Rm: A6SE040.001 Redstone Arsenal, AL 35898-5000 Fax: (256) 450-8840 or email usarmy.redstone.usamc.mbx.protests@mail.mil The AMC-Level Protest procedures are found at: https://www.amc.army.mil/Connect/Legal-Resources/. If internet access is not available, contact the contracting officer or HQ, AMC to obtain the HQ AMC-Level Protest Procedures. ""52.204-9, Personal Identity Verification of Contractor Personnel; 52.204-10, Reporting Executive Compensation and First-Tier Subcontract Awards; 52.222-41, Service Contract Act; 52.237-2, Protection of Government Buildings, Equipment and Vegetation; 252.201-7000, COR Clause; 252.223-7006, Prohibition On Storage And Disposal Of Toxic And Hazardous Materials; 252.243-7001, Pricing of Contract Modifications; 252.246-7000, Material inspection and receiving report"" Representation by Corporations Regarding an Unpaid Tax Liability or a Felony Conviction under any Federal Law. Wide Area WorkFlow Payment Instructions 252.204-7012 Safeguarding of Unclassified Controlled Technical Information All deliveries shall be palletized when the material exceeds 250 lbs. (excluding the pallet), or exceeds 20 cubic feet, to comply with the requirements of Department of the Army Pamphlet 700-32 and MIL-STD-147E. IAW FAR 52.212-2; Evaluation - Commercial Items, the following factor shall be used to evaluate offers: technical capability of the item offered to meet the Government requirement and price. Technical capability is a pass fail requirement. Evaluation is based on a lowest price technically acceptable. No multiple awards will be made. Quotes received through Unison Marketplace will be evaluated and awarded on an ?all-or-nothing? basis. Wide Area WorkFlow Payment Instructions Please address your questions through the Unison Marketplace buy. If your questions are not being answered in a timely manner, please send your question to the S2P2 Contracting Officer - usarmy.drum.acc-micc.mbx.micc@army.mil or call 315-772-5582. In accordance with DFAR provision 252.225-7000 Buy American Act--Balance of Payments Program Certificate, I certify that each end product, except those listed in paragraphs (c)(2) or (3) of the attached provision, is a domestic end product. ****YOU MUST FILL OUT THE ATTACHED IF OTHER THAN DOMESTIC END PRODUCT IF YOU DO NOT FILL IT OUT AND YOU DELIVER OTHER THAN A DOMESTIC END PRODUCT YOUR DELIVERY WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED********** ****READ DFARs Clause 252.225-7001 to ensure your product comes from a QUALIFYING COUNTRY******* ****IF YOU QUOTE A PRODUCT OTHER THAN DOMESTIC FROM A NON-QUALIFYING COUNTRY YOUR QUOTE WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED***** Representation and Representation Disclosures The form(s) included in the buy must be returned with your quote. Failure to return the form(s) with your quote will result in your quote not being considered for award. Reporting During Contract Performance Equal Opportunity"

column1: Equipment: Heavy, Dump Truck, Snow Plows, Tractor, Trailer, Lift Bids,OH,"Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): INDU, Mussel Propagation Trailer",Federal,,Department of the Interior,"Jun 16, 2022",Department of the Interior,https://sam.gov/opp/9162357cb7e34240a7cb6b4c5a24159d/view,"140P6422Q0044
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,202-208-3100,colette_riegelmayer@nps.gov,,"THIS IS A NOTICE OF INTENT FOR REQUEST FOR QUOTE. This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for a commercial item being procured in accordance with the format in Subpart 12.6, and supplemented with additional information as included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotes are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. The National Park Service intends to solicit quotes for supplies for a Mussel Propagation Trailer for Indiana Dunes National Park in Indiana. This is solicitation number 140P6422Q0044 and is issued as a request for quote (RFQ). This requirement is a 100% total small business set-aside. The associated NAICS code is 336212. The small business size standard is 1500 employees. Anticipated Award Date: Within 5 days of receiving offers. To be considered for award your company must obtain a Unique Entity Identifier (UEI). Your company must also be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) and be considered a small business for the size standard associated with the NAICS code found in block 10 on page one (1) of this solicitation, and this registration must be 'active' in SAM at the time of quote/proposal close date/time. Website: https://www.sam.gov If you have any registration questions, please call 866-606-8220. If you need assistance with registration or updating SAM please contact the Procurement Technical Assistance Center nearest you at (615) 268-6644 or website: http://www.aptac-us.org/new/Govt_Contracting/find.php. GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF STATEMENT OF WORK: Independently, and not as an agent of the Government, the Contractor shall furnish all labor, materials, and equipment necessary to provide a Mussel Propagation Trailer for Indiana Dunes National Park in Indiana. Quotes are due at 12:00 PM ET, June 16, 2022. Offers may be submitted by email. Email to: ***Please cite solicitation 140P6422Q0044 on your submission package*** Email to colette_riegelmayer@nps.gov. Questions regarding this solicitation will only be accepted until 12:00 PM ET, June 8, 2022."

This time supersedes the Offers Due Time listed above. FOB Destination shall be Fort Sill, OK 73503 The MICC End User requires the following items, Brand Name or Equal, to the following: LI 001: One 36-40ft trailer that meets all specifications in the attached Large Trailer SoW.pdf., 1, EA; Solicitation and Buy Attachments ***Question Submission: Interested Offerers must submit any questions concerning the solicitation at the earliest time possible to enable the Buyer to respond. Questions must be submitted by using the 'Submit a Question' feature at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Questions not received within a reasonable time prior to close of the solicitation may not be considered.*** For this solicitation, MICC End User intends to conduct an online competitive reverse auction to be facilitated by the third-party reverse auction provider, Unison Marketplace. Unison Marketplace has developed an online, anonymous, browser based application to conduct the reverse auction. An Offeror may submit a series of pricing bids, which descend in price during the specified period of time for the aforementioned reverse auction. MICC End User is taking this action in an effort to improve both vendor access and awareness of requests and the agency's ability to gather multiple, competed, real-time bids. All responsible Offerers that respond to this solicitation MUST submit the pricing portion of their bid using the online exchange located at https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. There is no cost to register, review procurement data or make a bid on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com. Offerers that are not currently registered to use https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com should proceed to https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com to complete their free registration. Offerers that require special considerations or assistance may contact Marketplace Support at 1.877.933.3243 or via email at marketplacesupport@unisonglobal.com. Offerers may not artificially manipulate the price of a transaction on https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com by any means. It is unacceptable to place bad faith bids, to use decoys in the https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process or to collude with the intent or effect of hampering the competitive https://marketplace.unisonglobal.com process. column1: Equipment: Heavy, Dump Truck, Snow Plows, Tractor, Trailer, Lift Bids,OK,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): USACE TULSA BPA RENTAL EQUIPMENT,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 10, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/373b4663db60421fb22f7b742cd620e0/view,"PANSWD-22-P-0000-002
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,jereme.a.kemp@usace.army.mil,,"This is a SOURCES SOUGHT?announcement; a market survey for information only, to be used for preliminary planning purposes.??THIS IS NOT A SOLICITATION FOR PROPOSALS AND NO CONTRACT WILL BE AWARDED FROM THIS SYNOPSIS.??No reimbursement will be made for any costs associated with providing information in response to this synopsis or any follow up information requests.? Respondents will be notified of the results of the evaluation upon request; however, only limited information may be made publicly available. CONTRACT INFORMATION:??The Tulsa District, U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, (USACE ? Tulsa) requires commercial sources for the procurement of equipment rentals to accomplish district wide operational support including emergency response. The primary geographic boundary for work executed under this contract is the Southwestern Division Tulsa Districts covering southern Kansas, Oklahoma, and northern Texas. https://www.swt.usace.army.mil/Portals/41/docs/about/!DISTRICT2012_ALL.pdf Please see attached Statement of Work & Equipment Rental List Questionnaire for Response Nature of Work:? The Army Corps of Engineers Tulsa District (Corps) is requesting Equipment rentals, leasing with or without operators for various locations operating under the control of the Tulsa District in the form of a Blanket Purchase Agreements (BPA). The Corps needs various equipment and services to perform a variety of projects throughout the following states: Kansas, Oklahoma, and Texas. These BPAs shall cover various Lease/Rental equipment needs including but not limited to Heavy Construction Equipment and services associated with heavy equipment functions. These BPAs will be utilized in non-Emergency and emergency needs if available. The Corps may choose to perform any of the work identified in these specifications. A more accurate description of the work to be performed will be given in the specifications of each call. Place of Performance:??Southwestern Division-Tulsa District covering southern Kansas, Oklahoma, and northern Texas. Please See Statement of Work for Applicable Product Service Codes (PSCs) & North American Industry Classification Systems (NAICS) The official announcement citing the solicitation number will be issued on SAM at www.sam.gov. Potential Offerors? responses to this announcement shall be?limited to 5 pages?and shall include the following information: Company name, address, point of contact, telephone number and email address Equipment List Response Provide item list Availability Fees included for deliveries and surcharge Maintenance and fueling options Provide delivery times for Emergency and non-emergency Identify Small Business category under NAICS Small Business (SB) Section 8(a) ?Historically Underutilized Business Zone (HUBZone) Service-Disabled Veteran Owned (SDVOSB) Woman-Owned Small Business (WOSB) Economically Disadvantaged Women-Owned Small Business (EDWOSB) Or state whether your firm is not one of the above Capabilities statement Interested Firms shall respond to this Sources Sought no later than 4:00pm CST on June 10, 2022.? All interested firms must be registered in SAM to be eligible for award of Government contracts.? Email your response to Jereme.a.Kemp@usace.army.mil.? ALL QUESTIONS MUST BE SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL. NO PHONE CALLS WILL BE ACCEPTED."

column5: ",Purchasing,,202-461-4300,tinie.kelly@va.gov,,"GENERAL: This is a pre-solicitation notice only and does not constitute a solicitation; accordingly, no response is due at this time, nor will any questions of a technical or contractual nature be answered. Those questions will only be answered via an amendment to the solicitation once it is issued. The Department of Veterans Affairs (DVA), Veterans Benefits Administration (VBA) anticipates issuing a solicitation for the following services: PROJECT TITLE: Lease and maintenance of two color copiers. PROJECT SCOPE: The Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) has a requirement for a service contract for lease and maintenance of two color copiers to include accessories, attachments, copy control devices and systems, all consumables (except copy paper and transparency films) and full maintenance to include repair parts. The purpose of this project is to award a firm fixed contract for a base period plus four option years. PLACE OF PERFORMANCE: The primary place of performance is the Portland VA Regional Office, 100 SW Main Street, Portland, OR 97204. The solicitation number is 36C10E22Q0097. Specific instructions on submitting proposals will be contained in the solicitation documents. It is anticipated that the solicitation will be issued on or about June 1, 2022, with offers due at least 10 days later or no later than June 14, 2022. The entire solicitation package, including all attachments, will be available electronically at www.sam.gov . Paper copies of this solicitation will not be made available. PROCUREMENT TYPE: The Government anticipates awarding a Firm Fixed Price (FFP) contract to the lowest offeror. The Government will determine the best value to the Government based on the lowest priced offeror meeting or exceeding the requirement of the solicitation. This requirement is being procured in accordance with FAR Part 12. Part 13 and in conjunction with FAR Part 16.. SET-ASIDE: This solicitation is a 100% Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business, (SDVOSB). NORTH AMERICAN INDUSTRIAL CLASSIFICATION SYSTEM (NAICS) CODE AND SMALL BUSINESS SIZE STANDARD: The NAICS code for this project is 532420 and the small business size standard is $35 Million. PROJECT COMPLETION DATE: The period of performance is one (1) 12 month-Base Period, with four (4) 12-month Option Periods. Exercising any Option period is at the sole discretion of the Government. The period of performance for the base period is 12 months from July 1, 2022. SYSTEM FOR AWARD MANAGEMENT: Offerors shall be required to have a UEI number and an active registration in SAM, System for Award Management (www.sam.gov), in order to conduct business with the Federal Government. Offerors will be required to complete Online Representations and Certifications at the SAM website. Offerors shall have an active SAM registration at time of proposal submission. Failure to have an active SAM registration at time of proposal submission shall render contractor s quote non-responsive and ineligible for award. Offerors shall also be certified and active in VETBIZ.gov. POINT OF CONTACT: Kris Kelly Contracting Officer, Kris Kelly at tinie.kelly@va.gov or 918-486-8649. Information contained in this announcement is subject to change"

Services: Grounds, Landscaping and Irrigation Bids,NJ,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5) Grounds Maintenance JBMDL,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 13, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/44f8956c568c4c779cc26e11b68ffd4c/view,"GMXJBMDL
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,lisa.goodwin.2@us.af.mil,,"This sources sought notice is for information and planning purposes only and shall not be construed as a solicitation as defined in FAR Part 15.201. Responses to this notice are not offers and cannot be accepted by the Government to form a binding contract. Offerors are advised that only Contracting Officers are authorized to commit the government to the obligation of funds. Joint Base, McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst Contracting Office is performing market research to identify small businesses capable of providing potential services for Grounds Maintenance Services at Joint Base McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst NJ. The contractor shall provide non-personal services, to include all personnel, equipment, tools, supervision, and other items and services necessary to ensure that grounds maintenance is performed at Joint Base McGuire-Dix- Lakehurst (JB MDL) in a manner that will promote the growth of healthy grass, trees, shrubs, and plants and present a clean, neat, and professional appearance. All work performed by the Contractor shall be performed in accordance with the Performance Work Statement, all applicable laws, regulations, Headquarters Air Force (HAF) standards, instructions, and commercial practices. The contractor is required to maintain 373 acres of improved grounds,133 acres of semi approved grounds, 883 acres of semi approved airfield grounds, 156 acres of unimproved grounds for McGuire and Expeditionary Center, 22 acres of improved grounds for 108ANG, 12 acres of improved grounds for 87th Medical Group, 201 acres of improved grounds 276 acres of semi approved grounds, 547 acres of semi improved airfield grounds, and 374 acres of unimproved grounds for Lakehurst, 151 acres of improved grounds, 58 acres of semi improved grounds, 331 acres of semi improved airfield grounds for NAVAIR, The work performed by the contractor shall include but not limited to mowing grass, edging and trimming grass, removing grass trimmings from paved areas, irrigating, aerating lawn areas, applying fertilizer and / or lime, pest control, applying pesticides to lawn and landscape areas, maintaining plants, shrubs, flowers and trees performing seasonal planting of plants and flowers, removing leaves, applying mulch, pruning trees, removing grass from cracks in sidewalks and pavements and litter control. This sources sought notice may be followed by a request for proposal. All possible offerors are encouraged to submit information supporting this notice. If you are interested and capable of performing a service of this size, please forward your information along with a capability statement not later than? ? ? ? 13 Jun 2022 to Lisa Goodwin at lisa.goodwin.2@us.af.mil."

Services: Grounds, Landscaping and Irrigation Bids,NM,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Lincoln National Forest-Tree Shelters,Federal,,Department of Agriculture,"Jun 15, 2022",Department of Agriculture,https://sam.gov/opp/0b73678668d446be9281c3ce29cc9b2a/view,"127EAV22Q0026
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,504-426-0217,mariadelaluz.pino@usda.gov,,"Tree shelters to be purchased to protect seedlings for the reforestation planting projects occurring on two districts of the Lincoln National Forest. Location: D1- Lincoln NF, Smokey Bear RD, Ruidoso NM 88345 D2- Lincoln NF, Sacramento RD, Cloudcroft NM 88317 Requirements: Pre-assembled with three wire staking legs attached to the base which allow 8? of soil penetration for stability. The shelter will be manufactured of solid polymer material with no mesh, and sufficiently rigid to allow the shelter to be pushed into workable soil without the use of driving tools. The tree shelter shall be made of High-UV polymer material to withstand the southwest climate. The shelter shall be conical in shape, approximately 18 inches in height, with the base being approximately 7 inches in diameter and tapering to approximately 4 inches at the open top."

Services: Grounds, Landscaping and Irrigation Bids,NY,Sitewide Tree Trimming and Removal Services,Federal,,Department of Energy,"Jun 7, 2022",Department of Energy,https://sam.gov/opp/d12fd871cb844c99945af69a53b93475/view,"VC411122
column5: ",Contracting Officer,,202-586-4403,vcostanzo@bnl.gov,,"Seeking interested and qualified contractors to perform site-wide tree felling, pruning, chipping, stump grinding and related services on an as needed basis at Brookhaven National Laboratory, Upton, New York.? All work shall be in accordance the the following BSA Statement of Work: SCOPE: This scope of work includes tree trimming, pruning and felling, of various trees throughout the Brookhaven National Laboratory, Upton, NY (BNL) site including clean-up of the work location(s). If disposal is required, it shall be paid under the appropriate items for log loader equipment and operator. Trees to be removed shall be cut flush to the ground. Stump grinding may be required as directed by the General Supervisor of the BNL Production Division or designee. All removals, trimming, clean-up, and disposals shall be performed to the satisfaction of BSA, The Production Division Manager, General Supervisor, or their appointed designee. Disposal of all tree debris shall be off of the BNL site unless an agreement is made for on-site disposal and/or clean-up by BSA with the General Supervisor or appointed designee. CONTRACTOR REQUIREMENTS: Contractor must be fully licensed and insured and furnish BSA with a valid Certificate of Insurance during the performance of work at the BNL Site. Contractor must be familiar with BNL Site and perform ?walk down? with an authorized BSA representative familiar with the work to be performed. The Contractor shall prepare and submit to BSA for approval a written Job Hazard Analysis (JHA) prior to starting any work. No work shall commence before approval of the JHA by BSA. The Contractor shall provide a dedicated Qualified Safety Professional who shall meet the following qualifications: OSHA 10 hour certification Oversight and authority to implement safety protocols Authority to STOP work without question Candidates for Safety Representative shall possess the verifiable experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities that are necessary to discharge their responsibilities. Specialized training courses of instruction for that particular type of work to be done on the project.?? Proof of prior Competent Person or Qualified Person status for similar work attained by the proposed Safety Representative (Chainsaw Operation, Aerial Lift Operation, Fall Protection, Felling of Trees, Tree Trimming, Rigging, Noise and Hearing Conservation, Traffic Control Personal, Protective Equipment, and First Aid/CPR)- Required to lead specific toolbox talks for work being conducted on the specified day. Preparation of task specific Job Hazard Analysis ensure understanding, training and compliance by all trades persons on job. Shall ensure that the person has a clear understanding of the corrective action to take and the possible consequences if those measures are not followed (Contractor?s Disciplinary Policy). The Contractor shall be responsible for maintenance and protection of traffic / populous and the closure of portions of roadways to accommodate the operations of trimming and felling trees. All proposed road closures shall be reviewed and approved by BSA prior to starting the work. Inspection of Equipment All equipment must be in compliance with all applicable Federal, State, and Local rules and regulations. All hydraulic equipment that has the potential for creating a spill, must be inspected and approved in writing by BSA prior to use. The Contractor shall provide documentable evidence, satisfactory to BSA, that all employees assigned to the work described herein are trained in the following: First Aid / CPR Tree Felling and Chain Saw Safety Traffic Control Fall Protection Equipment-specific Training Aerial Lift Training Noise and Hearing Conservation Electrical Hazard Personal Protective Equipment Required OSHA Medical Surveillance OSHA 10-Hour General Industry ************************************* A Request For Quotation (RFQ) will be posted as a solicitation for the above requirement with full and open compentition.? It is anticipated a one-year base contract will be awarded which will include four (4) one-year renewal options.?"

Services: Grounds, Landscaping and Irrigation Bids,NC,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Vegetative Clearing at Snow Cuts,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 28, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/90ba1d93b9b74d5182ecb922e62c57f9/view,"W912PM22Q0026
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,jenifer.m.garland@usace.army.mil,,"This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This is a combined synopsis/solicitation.? THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONSTITUTES THE ONLY SOLICITATION; QUOTES ARE BEING REQUESTED AND A WRITTEN SOLICITATION WILL NOT BE ISSUED.? This will be a 100% set-aside for Small Business procurement. The solicitation number is W912PM22Q0026 and the solicitation is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ). The NAICS code is 561730 with a small business size standard of $8M.? This solicitation document incorporates provisions and clauses in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2021-04. Description of Requirement: The Contractor shall furnish all labor, materials, and services to provide the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Wilmington District with services to Mow, cut, and clear all vegetation from the following area located east of the U.S. Highway 421 bridge of an area known as Snows Cut, Wilmington, North Carolina. Evaluation and Award: The Government will award a contract resulting from this solicitation to the responsible offeror whose offer conforming to the solicitation will be most advantageous to the Government, price and other factors considered. Award shall be made to the lowest priced technically acceptable offer. ?See solicitation provision 52.212-2. Each offeror must submit both a Price Quote and a Technical Proposal via EMAIL to jenifer.m.garland@usace.army.mil and troy.d.small@usace.army.mil.? No hard paper copies will be accepted or evaluated. Both the Price Quote and the Technical Proposal must be received by the closing date and time set for receipt of quotes. In an effort to reduce paperwork and reduce cost, all quotes shall be submitted electronically. All submissions shall be in Adobe PDF format and shall be on 8 ? x 11 size pages in no less than a 10 pitch or 10 font. Offerors may use compressions utility software such as WinZip or PKZip to reduce file size and facilitate transmission. Title the file(s) in the following format: W912PM22Q0026_ COMPANY NAME_PRICING W912PM22Q0026_COMPANY NAME_TECHNICAL Offerors shall submit the quotes electronically via EMAIL to jenifer.m.garland@usace.army.mil and troy.d.small@usace.army.mil.? Quote due Date and Time: Request For Quotes No: W912PM22Q0026 Due Date of Quotes: 28 June 2022 Time by which Quotes are due: 2:00 P.M. (Eastern Time) Title of Project: Vegetation Clearing at Snows Cut Quotes are due as specified on the solicitation document (as amended if applicable). The time & date of Quote receipt will be the delivery time & date recorded within the email submission as received by the individuals listed above. Do not assume that electronic communication is instantaneous. Offerors should time their upload effort with prudence by not waiting until the last few minutes?this will allow for unexpected delays in the transmittal process. If an electronic submission is uploaded minutes before the deadline but the upload or transmission doesn?t complete until after the deadline, the submission will be considered late. Offerors are encouraged to keep a copy of the email ?sent? and ?receipt? verification confirmation for their record. ***Amendment 0001*** A site visit will be held on Wednesday, 25 May 2022 at 10:00 AM EST. ***Amendment 0002*** The proposal due date has been extended until 28 June 2022."

column1: Services: Grounds, Landscaping and Irrigation Bids,NC,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): BEJ Abutment Cutting,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 10, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/882bda82d12d405aae4a768cc32767e6/view,"W912PM22Q0027
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,terri.m.adams@usace.army.mil,,"This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This is a combined synopsis/solicitation.? THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONSTITUTES THE ONLY SOLICITATION; QUOTES ARE BEING REQUESTED AND A WRITTEN SOLICITATION WILL NOT BE ISSUED.? This will be a 100% set-aside for Small Business procurement. The solicitation number is W912PM22Q0027, and the solicitation is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ). The NAICS code is 561730 with a small business size standard of $8.0M.? This solicitation document incorporates provisions and clauses in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-06. Description of Requirement: The work shall consist of furnishing all labor, personnel, supervision, quality control, equipment, supplies, and materials necessary to eradicate the trees and satisfactorily reset an early successional habitat at B. Everett Jordan Dam and Lake, Moncure, NC. The Contractor shall cut and herbicide all woody vegetation on the Jordan Dam Overlook hillside with an incline up to approximately 45?. The work shall be performed to the satisfaction of the contracting officer during normal working hours (Monday through Friday 0700-1630). There are two (2) areas totaling approximately 1.7 acres each to be cut over a one-year period with the second area being an Option. Note to all Interested parties: It is recommended that the Contractor perform an onsite visit to become familiar with the nature and location of the work by inspection of the site; noting the local conditions, security, safety, equipment and facilities required for the work, and all other factors which may affect the work or costs to perform the work. Pre-Bid Site Visit To schedule a site visit please contact John H. Rochevot, see contact information below: Name: John H Rochevot Telephone: (919) 542-4501, ext. 2422 Email: John.H.Rochevot@usace.army.mil Evaluation and Award: The Government will award a contract resulting from this solicitation to the responsible offeror whose offer conforming to the solicitation will be most advantageous to the Government, price and other factors considered. Award shall be made to the lowest priced technically acceptable offer. ?See solicitation provision 5.212-2. Each offeror must submit a Price Quote via email to Terri M. Adams at terri.m.adams@usace.army.mil and Troy D. Small at troy.d.small@usace.army.mil.? No hard paper copies will be accepted or evaluated. The Price Quote must be received by the closing date and time set for receipt of quotes. In an effort to reduce paperwork and reduce cost, all quotes shall be submitted electronically. All submissions shall be in Adobe PDF format and shall be on 8 ? x 11 size pages in no less than a 10 pitch or 10 font. Offerors may use compressions utility software such as WinZip or PKZip to reduce file size and facilitate transmission. Title the file(s) in the following format: W912PM22Q0027_ COMPANY NAME_PRICING W912PM22Q0027_ COMPANY NAME_TECHNICAL Request For Quotes No: W912PM22Q0027 Due Date of Quotes: 10 June 2022 Time by which Quotes are due: 2:00 P.M. (Eastern Time) Title of Project: BEJ Abutment Cutting Quotes are due as specified on the solicitation document (as amended if applicable). The time & date of Quote receipt will be the timestamp the emailed quotes are received by the Government. Do not assume that electronic communication is instantaneous. Offerors should time their upload effort with prudence by not waiting until the last few minutes?this will allow for unexpected delays in the transmittal process. If an electronic submission is uploaded minutes before the deadline but the upload doesn?t complete until after the deadline, the submission will be considered late. Offerors are encouraged to keep a copy of the upload confirmation for their record."

column1: Services: Grounds, Landscaping and Irrigation Bids,OH,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Dorm Landscaping,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 27, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/f86ce07947d247eba6b218764ba98136/view,"FA860122R0035
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,michael.dekker@us.af.mil,,"COMBINED SYNOPSIS/SOLICITATION This is a combined synopsis/solicitation (?synopsitation? hereafter), which is expected to result in award of a Firm Fixed Price contract for commercial items, i.e. dorm landscaping in accordance with the statement of work (attachment 1). The synopsitation is prepared in accordance with the format in the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. An award, if any, will be made to the responsible offeror who submits a proposal that (1) conforms to the requirements of the synopsitation; and (2) that submits the proposal with the lowest total evaluated price (TEP), provided that the TEP is not unbalanced and is fair and reasonable. The Government reserves the right to award without discussions or make no award at all depending upon (1) the quality of proposals received and (2) the price fair and reasonableness of proposals received. Synopsitation Number: FA8601-22-R-0035 NAICS Code: 561730 Small Business Size Standard: $8m-100% Small Business Set Aside Synopsitation Closing Date: Proposals must be received not later than 12:00pm Eastern, 27 June 2022 Submit electronic proposals via e-mail to: michael.dekker@us.af.mil Any correspondence sent via e-mail must contain the subject line ?Synopsitation FA8601-22-R0035.? The entire proposal must be contained in a single e-mail that does not exceed 15 megabytes including attachments, if any. E-mails with compressed files are not permitted. Note that e-mail filters at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base are designed to filter e-mails without subject lines or with suspicious subject lines or contents (i.e., .exe or .zip files). Therefore, if the specified subject line is not included, the e-mail may not get through the e-mail filters. Also be advised that .zip or .exe files are not allowable attachments and may be deleted by the email filters at Wright-Patterson. If sending attachments with email, ensure only .pdf, .doc, .docx, .xls or .xlsx documents are sent. The email filter may delete any other form of attachments. Address questions regarding this synopsitation to Michael Dekker via e-mail at michael.dekker@us.af.mil A detailed description of the requirement including a draft contract with line items, delivery schedule, period of performance, inspection and acceptance information, other terms and conditions, provisions and clauses, representations and certifications, specific instructions for submission of proposals,an explanation of how proposals will be evaluated, performance work statement, and wage determinations, are pvovided in the attached documents. Upon award, any provisions that were in the draft contract (including representations and certifications) will be removed from the award document."

Services: Grounds, Landscaping and Irrigation Bids,PA,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Mowing Services at Cowanesque Lake,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 9, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/0ec40b2be13b4be9bf1cbf6ff0e024e9/view,"W912DR22Q0045
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,nastashia.d.willoughby@usace.army.mil,,"The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), Baltimore District, will procure Mowing Services for Cowanesque Lake?s Project as further detailed in the Performance Work Statement. This solicitation will result in one award based on lowest price technical accepted as best meets the needs of the Government. The proposed contract will have a base year/period, and four (4) option years/periods, which if exercised could extend contract performance through 2027. ?There is no guarantee that any options will be exercised by the Government. The proposed contract is 100% set-aside for small business concerns. ?All responsible, qualified small businesses may submit an offer which will be considered by the Baltimore District Corps of Engineers. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code is 561730 size standards of $8 Million, PSC code S208. Offerors shall be registered at the System for Award Management (www.sam.gov) to be eligible for award.? To register you will need your DUNS/UEI number. https://www.sam.gov/portal/public/SAM. ?Instructions for registering are on the website. The Contractor shall provide all necessary equipment, staff, labor, supervision, materials, equipment, and supplies to complete the Project. Site Visit - Quoter is urged and expected to inspect the site where services are to be performed and to satisfy themselves regarding all general and local conditions that may affect the cost or contract performance, to the extent that the information is reasonably obtainable. In no event shall failure to inspect the site constitute grounds for a claim after contract award. Please bring valid photo identification and a copy of a solicitation for verification purposes to the site visit."

column1: MPA 372 establishes a list of qualified vendors to provide statewide tree trimming and removal work as necessary. Locations may be various state-owned, leased facilities, or roadways. The services will include, but not be limited to, removal of trees, trimming trees, clearing deadwood, removing stumps, stump grinding, trimming shrubs, providing screened loam and grass seed as may be necessary to fill void created by stump removals, hydro seeding, and removal/disposal of debris from site. This is an open enrollment that is reviewed on a quarterly basis. If you were already awarded a contract for MPA 372, please do not bid again.

Services: Grounds, Landscaping and Irrigation Bids,TX,Mansion Grounds Rehabilitation,State/Local,,State of Texas 2,"Jun 24, 2022",State of Texas 2,https://www.txsmartbuy.com/esbddetails/view/809-22-0022,"809-22-0022

The State Preservation Board (SPB) is requesting responses to this Request for Proposal for an experienced general contractor with five (5) years or more of experience relevant to the scope of work described herein to perform services at the Texas Governor's Mansion. The scope of this project includes: replacement of loose pavers and slab levelling along walks across the mansion grounds and nearby Foundation Park; converting stairs to a ramp and replacing fountain plumbing in the Connally Garden; building greenhouse foundation walls and extending flatwork at the kitchen garden; and building new fences and gates at each end of the Colorado Street Pedestrian Plaza.  An allowance will be held for refinishing a second, smaller fountain in the Connally Garden, with details to be developed after contractor is engaged.

Background:  The Mansion and grounds were extensively restored and rehabilitated in 2012.  This project addresses several accessibility, interpretive, safety, and functional issues across the Mansion Grounds and vicinity.
Work shall commence August 1, 2022 and be completed by November 15, 2022."

column1: Trades and Subcontracts: HVAC, Refrigeration, Mechanical Bids,NM,"Indian Economic Enterprise (IEE) Set-Aside (specific to Department of Interior): J--REPLACE HVAC BLDG 105, Haskell Indian Nations Univ",Federal,,Department of the Interior,Today ,Department of the Interior,https://sam.gov/opp/71488bc1cd154bdaa018b735c75d791b/view,"DOIAFBO220070
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,202-208-3100,maryjane.johnson@bie.edu,,"SOURCE SOUGHT ANNOUNCEMENT The Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Indian Education (BIE), Division of Acquisitions is issuing a SOURCE SOUGHT announcement to seek potential Indian Economic Enterprises (IEE) sources who would be interested in HVAC Repairs to Building 105 at Haskell Indian Nations University in Lawrence, Kansas. This notice is to identify IEE that fall into the following available set aside categories. The North American Industry Classification (NAICS) code is 238220 size standard $16.50. No reimbursement will be made for any cost associated with this Source Sought announcement. Any information submitted by respondents to this notice is strictly voluntary. It is requested that only those that meet the definition of these categories submit a response to this notice. Send your capabilities statement to include your business size, description of your specialties, contact information (business name, contact person, phone number and email address), general contracting license number and construction bonding capabilities (per single and aggregate) to maryjane.johnson@bie.edu. The contract scope of work consists of the following, Haskell Indian Nations University is requesting services to renovate interior HVAC system for Minoka Hall, Building 105. The Contractor shall provide all services required including, but not limited to selective demolition, construction, and installation to accomplish the tasks in accordance with this statement of work, contract terms, conditions, specifications, and any special requirements. Provide the demolition / removal replacement, to furnish and install a new chiller and other equipment as specified herein. The following requirements shall be part of this installation. A more detailed statement of work will be provided with the full solicitation package to all eligible contractors. Interest parties are requested to provide their UEI number for verification of inclusion in the System for Award Management (SAM). Any interest and qualified sources are requested to provide a brief capabilities statement to Mary Jane Johnson via email maryjane.johnson@bie.edu. To be considered, please provide the information above no later than 12:00 P.M. on June 03, 2022, Mountain Daylight Time (MD), to be considered."

column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,202-208-3100,maryjane.johnson@bie.edu,,"ISOLATION ROOMS VENTILATION FOR ANETH COMMUNITY SCHOOL SOLICITATION IS SET ASIDE FOR INDIAN SMALL BUSINESS ECONOMIC ENTERPRISES (ISBEE), FOR THE CONSTRUCTION INSTALLATION OF ISOLATION FANS FOR ANETH COMMUNITY SCHOOL. Contractors please see the attached Request for Quote for the Aneth Community School, for the Isolation fans installation at the School. Solicitation Response date is Wednesday, June 08, 2022 at 12:00 p.m. Mountain Standard Time SITE Visit: Thursday, June 02,2022 at 1:00 p.m. Mountain Standard Time at Aneth Community School in Aneth, UT. Elsie Dee, will be at the school on this day to conduct the site visit. All questions to be received by Monday June 06,2022 by COB. All questions, must be emailed to me before this date and time to the Contracting Officer. All proposals are to be emailed ONLY to the Contracting Officer, Mary Jane Johnson, at maryjane.johnson@bie.edu, to be considered for award."
