column1: Trades and Subcontracts: Machinist, Fabrication and Welding Bids,VA,LaserCAMM PMA,Federal,,Department of Justice,"Jun 13, 2022",Department of Justice,https://sam.gov/opp/25d301e7afb54ae783b34d8f663dc531/view,"DJF-22-0100-PR-00033
column5: ",Purchasing,,888-REG-FAIR,albolton@fbi.gov,,"PLEASE READ THIS NOTICE CAREFULLY AS IT CONSTITUTES THE ONLY NOTICE THAT WILL BE PUBLISHED.? The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) intends to negotiate a sole source, firm-fixed-priced preventative maintenance services contract with Laser Basics Inc., located at 25515 Whitesell St., Suite A, Hayword, CA. 94545. The FBI Laboratory Division (LD), Operational Projects Unit (OPU), has a requirement for specialized services for Laser Basics Inc. to maintain their LaserCAMM laser center machines. Laser Basics Inc. is the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) and is the only authorized provider of factory-supported, factory trained, factory authorized and factory certified services for the LaserCAMM equipment. Per the OEM, Laser Basics Inc. is the only provider of services as they are the sole manufacturer based on the overall footprint, purchase, operational cost, and proprietary software. As such, Laser Basics Inc. is the sole and exclusive service provider for LaserCAMM equipment, and service contracts can only be purchased through them as there are no authorized resellers to include third-party services agreement resellers. This notice will be distributed solely through the General Services Administration?s SAM.gov website (www.SAM.gov).? Interested parties are responsible for monitoring the beta.SAM.gov site to ensure they have the most up-to-date information about this acquisition.? The associated North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) code for this procurement is 333517 ? Machine Tool Manufacturing; the size standard is 500 employees. The Government intends to negotiate with only one source under the authority of FAR 6.302-1.? This notice of intent is not a request for competitive quotations; however, interested parties may identify their interests and submit a capabilities statement in response to this requirement by emailing Adelle Bolton at albolton@fbi.gov by 09:00AM EST on June 13, 2021.? Responses sent via other means (i.e. via telephone call, facsimile transmission, etc.) will not be considered.? Information received will be used solely for the purpose of determining whether or not to conduct a competitive procurement.? A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed contract based upon responses to this notice is at the discretion of the Government.? Vendors must be registered in SAM, effective July 29, 2012, to receive government contracts.? The FBI utilizes a financial system that has a direct interface with the SAM.? Please ensure that your company?s SAM information is updated and accurate. ?This includes TIN, EFT, UEI, addresses, and contact information.? The EFT banking information on file in SAM will be what the FBI uses to process payment to your organization."

column1: Trades and Subcontracts: Machinist, Fabrication and Welding Bids,VA,"4730 RESTRICTOR UNIT, FLUID",Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 5, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/dd9b68849c2e4c49afebf1c9d4160c4e/view,"SPE4A522R0218
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,robert.carey@dla.mil,,"The Government is seeking parties having an interest in and the resources to support NSN 4730-00-109-6906, Restrictor Unit, Fluid.? This item is currently manufactured by: Raytheon Technologies Corporation. (CAGE 55820) under Part Number 46783-0. ?Technical Orders and Qualification Requirements are not available.? Potential sources shall be capable of furnishing all labor, materials, facilities and equipment required to accomplish the new manufacture of the item(s).? Generally, this entails the procurement/manufacture of component parts, inspection, testing, preservation/packaging, and shipping.? Additionally, potential sources may be responsible for supply chain management, logistics planning, forecasting production requirements, long-lead time parts procurement, diminishing manufacturing sources and material shortage issues, and shipping serviceable assets.? The quantity is 119 each. The result of this market research will contribute to determining the method of procurement. The applicable North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code assigned to this procurement is 332996. THERE IS NO SOLICITATION AT THIS TIME. This request for capability information does not constitute a request for proposals; submission of any information in response to this market survey is purely voluntary; the government assumes no financial responsibility for any costs incurred.? The sources sought notification is NOT FOR THE CURRENT BUY, the intention is to get vendors interested in getting approved so they can compete on the NEXT buy. The Government will evaluate market information to ascertain potential market capacity to 1) provide services consistent in scope and scale with those described in this notice and otherwise anticipated; 2) secure and apply the full range of corporate financial, human capital, and technical resources required to successfully perform similar requirements; 3) implement a successful project management plan that includes: compliance with tight program schedules; cost containment; meeting and tracking performance; hiring and retention of key personnel and risk mitigation; and 4) provide services under a performance based service acquisition contract. Interested parties who consider themselves qualified to perform the above-listed services are invited to submit a response to this Sources Sought Notice by June 5, 2022, 3:00 pm, Eastern Standard Time.? All responses under this Sources Sought Notice must be emailed to Robert Carey (robert.carey@dla.mil). If you have any questions concerning this opportunity please contact: Robert Carey via email robert.carey@dla.mil."

CLASS CONTROLLABLE PITCH PROPELLERS. PACKAGE IAW MIL-STD-2073-1E OEM:? ROLLS-ROYCE MARINE INC. PN:? ?? C066SM02421B QTY:? 12 EA Delivery shall be F.O.B. Destination to USCG Surface Forces Logistics Center, 2401 Hawkins Point Road, Baltimore MD 21126, Mark for: Receiving Room Bldg. 88 This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for a commercial item prepared in accordance with the format outlined in FAR Subpart 12.6, FAC 2022-06 (May 2022) and as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation. Quotations are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. The NAICS code for this solicitation is 332999 and the business size standard is 750. The resultant purchase order will be awarded using simplified acquisition procedures in accordance with FAR 13.106 apply.? ? Substitute parts are not acceptable.? It is anticipated that a non-competitive sole source purchase order shall be awarded as a result of this synopsis/solicitation.? It is the Government?s belief that only Rolls-Royce Marine Inc. and/or their authorized distributors can provide this unit. Concerns having the expertise and required capabilities to provide this item are invited to submit complete information discussing the same within two (2) calendar days from the day this notice posted.? The data must include sufficient detail to allow the Coast Guard to evaluate the proposal relative to the requirements. The information submitted must include a letter from the OEM verifying the offeror is an authorized distributor, and verifying the OEM will supply genuine OEM parts.?? The U.S. Coast Guard intends to award on an all or none basis to a responsible offeror whose offer conforming to the solicitation will be the most advantageous to the Government.? Award will be lowest price technically acceptable.? The Coast Guard intends to award on a Firm Fixed Price Contract. ? All responsible sources may submit a quotation, which if timely received, shall be considered by the Agency. Companies must have valid DUNS numbers and be registered with SYSTEMS FOR AWARD MANAGEMENT (www.sam.gov) and shall provide the company Tax Information Number (TIN) with their offer. The closing date and time for receipt of quote is June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am Eastern Standard Time OFFERORS MUST SUBMIT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION ON THEIR QUOTE: Disclosure: The offeror under this solicitation represents that [Check one]: __ it is not a foreign incorporated entity that should be treated as an inverted domestic corporation pursuant to the criteria of (HSAR) 48 CFR 3009.104-70 through 3009.104-73; __ it is a foreign incorporated entity that should be treated as an inverted domestic corporation pursuant to the criteria of (HSAR) 48 CFR 3009.104-70 through 3009.104-73, but it has submitted a request for waiver pursuant to 3009.104-74, which has not been denied; or __it is a foreign incorporated entity that should be treated as an inverted domestic corporation pursuant to the criteria of (HSAR) 48 CFR 3009.104-70 through 3009.104-73, but it plans to submit a request for waiver pursuant to 3009.104-74. (g) A copy of the approved waiver, if a waiver has already been granted, or the waiver request, if a waiver has been applied for, shall be attached to the bid or proposal __HSAR 3052.209-70 Prohibition on contracts with corporate expatriates (June 2006) (End of provision) The following FAR Clauses provisions apply to this solicitation. FAR 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors-Commercial Items (Nov 2021); FAR 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications-Commercial Items (Nov 2021) with Alternate I. Offeror(s) must include a completed copy of FAR 52.212-3 with their quote. The following FAR Clauses apply to this solicitation. Offerors may obtain full text versions of these clauses electronically at www.arnet.gov.; FAR 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions-Commercial Items (Nov 2021); FAR 52.212-5, Contract Terms & Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items (Jan 2022). The following clauses listed within FAR ?52.209-10, Prohibition on Contracting with Inverted Domestic Corporations (Nov 2015), 52.233-3, Protest After Award (AUG 1996) (31 U.S.C. 3553), 52.233-4, Applicable Law for Breach of Contract Claim (OCT 2004) (Public Laws 108-77, 108-78 (19 U.S.C. 3805 note) 52.212-5 are applicable: FAR 52.219-28, Post Award Small Business Program representation (Sep 2021)(15 U.S.C. 632(a)(2); FAR 52.222-3, Convict Labor (Jun 2003)(E.O. 11755); FAR 52.222-19 Child Labor-Cooperation with Authorities and Remedies (Jan 2022) (E.O. 13126); FAR 52.222-21, Prohibition of Segregated Facilities (April 2015); FAR 52.222-26, Equal Opportunity (Sep 2016)(E.O. 11246); FAR 52.222-36, Equal Opportunity for workers with disabilities (Jun 2020);FAR 52.222-50, Combat Trafficking in Persons (October 2020)(22 U.S.C. chapter 78 and E.O. 13627); FAR 52.223-18 Contractor Policy to Ban Text Messaging while Driving (Jun 2020) (E.O. 13513); FAR 52.225.1 Buy American Act-Supplies (Jan 2021); FAR 52.225-3, Buy American Act-Free Trade Agreement (Jan 2021)(41 U.S.C. 10a-10d); FAR 52.225-13, Restrictions on Certain Foreign Purchases (Feb 2021); 52.232-33, Payment by Electronic Funds Transfer-System for Award Management (Oct 2018)(31 U.S.C. 3332). The following items are incorporated as addenda to this solicitation: Copies of HSAR clauses may be obtained electronically at www.dhs.gov. Copies of CGAP clauses may be obtained electronically at: www.uscg.mil/acquisition/procurement/pdf/CIM_4200_19H.pdf"

column1: Trades and Subcontracts: Machinist, Fabrication and Welding Bids,VA,UTM Universal Blue Mag,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 9, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/30f427001b4c4a3c9be8497d26e66fc8/view,"H9224022Q2029
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,emily.lonigro@socom.mil,,"This is a COMBINED SYNOPSIS/SOLICITATION for commercial items prepared in accordance with the policies and procedures using FAR subpart 12.6, Streamlined Procedures for Evaluation and Solicitation for Commercial Items, and FAR Part 13, Simplified Acquisition Procedures, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. Naval Special Warfare Group Two (NSWG2) operators utilize the M4/M16 Ultimate Training Munitions Universal Blue Magazine to hold and feed 5.56 caliber UTM ammunition into the chamber of the MK 18 weapon system. The magazine is designed to prevent the loading of an M855 round and provide clear indication that weapon system is in training mode for non-lethal training ammunition exercises. Solicitation H92240-22-Q-2029 is issued as a request for quotation (RFQ). It is the Government's intent to award a Firm Fixed-Price contract for the supplies defined in this RFQ. Vendors are required to complete and provide attachments with quote submission to be considered a compliant offeror. H9224022Q02029 - combined syn solicitation - UTM Attachment 2 Brand Name J&A is provided as Attachment 3."

Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,NY,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): GLS Dewatering Pit Pump Installation & Removal,Federal,,Department of Transportation,"Jun 30, 2022",Department of Transportation,https://sam.gov/opp/5f88f96c94d049aaa333bc04b4c2f5ba/view,"6923G522Q0771
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-366-4000,chora.young@dot.gov,,"The Great Lakes St. Lawrence Seaway Development Corporation (GLS) has a requirement for?the removal of existing dewatering pit pumps and install new dewatering pit pumps at Eisenhower and Snell Lock, one (1) at each location.?The installation of three (3) hatch cover sills at each lock, hatch cover sill concrete work, plumbing/pipefitting, and electrical wiring is also to be included in the scope of work at each location. This procurement is 100% Set-Aside for Small Businesses. NAICS 237990 ""Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction"" with a size standard of $39,500,000.00.? Pursuant to FAR 36.204, the magnitude of construction is between $100,000 and $250,000. This procurement will be awarded in accordance with FAR Part 13, Simplified Acquisition Procedures.? Site Visit: Monday, 13 June 2022, 10:00am EST. RFIs due: Thursday, 16 June 2022, 02:00pm EST. Quote due: Thursday, 30 June 2022, 02:00pm EST. Email only to: chora.young@dot.gov and purchasing@dot.gov Performance (SF25) and Payment (SF25a) bonds are required ten (10) calendar days after award.?"

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,NY,"Maintenance Dredging of Flushing Bay & Creek, New York",Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 14, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/cf24573fbac34c1e928328c303af6597/view,"W912DS22B0012
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,mohenda.r.surage@usace.army.mil,,"The New York District of the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) proposes to perform maintenance dredging of Flushing Bay and Creek, New York, Federal Navigation Project to a depth of -15 feet Mean Lower Low Water (MLLW) plus 2 feet of allowable over-depth. The proposed maintenance dredging would remove approximately 150,000 cubic yards (CY) of critical shoals from the Flushing Bay and Creek with subsequent placement at a suitable, state-permitted upland site(s).? The dredged material from Flushing Bay and Creek consists of 1.0% gravel, 14.0% sand, 61.8% silt, and 23.2% clay.? Due to restrictions in the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation Water Quality Certificate, the proposed work can only be performed utilizing a mechanical dredge with a closed clamshell environmental bucket. Additionally, multiple scows and tugboats will be needed to perform the work during the dredging, and transport operations.? The dredged material would be required to meet all federal, state, and local criteria required by the government agencies having jurisdiction where the dredging and placement sites are located.? The apparent low bidder shall, within 35 calendar days from the date the apparent low bidder is notified of being such, provide copies of all required permits and approvals for transportation, transfer, dewatering, processing, and final placement of dredged material, and shall submit evidence of such permits and approvals to the government.? Bidders should consult the specifications for all submittal requirements. Once the contract is awarded, the contractor will be required to commence work within five (5) calendar days after the date of receipt of the notice to proceed and maintain an integrated production rate of at least 2,250 cubic yards per calendar day for the dredging and placement of material. The presence of dredging equipment in the channel will impact vessel traffic and it is necessary to maintain this production rate while minimizing the duration of this impact. The proposed work is anticipated to take place between September and November 2022.? The work is estimated to cost between than $10,000,000 and $25,000,000.00. This is an unrestricted procurement. NOTE: Please submit request for additional sampling reports. Files are too large to post on SAM.gov.?"

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,NY,"Maintenance Dredging of the Long Island Intracoastal Waterway Federal Navigation Project at Moriches Bay, Suffolk County, New York",Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 24, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/5c1d3b7a44514c0eaa795d07348cc465/view,"W912DS22B0006
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,orlando.nieves@usace.army.mil,,"The New York District of the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) proposes to perform maintenance dredging of the Long Island Intracoastal Waterway (LIIW) Federal Navigation Project at Moriches Bay. ?The proposed maintenance dredging would remove approximately 100,000 cubic yards (CY) of sand with placement along the shoreline of Cupsogue Beach County Park, subject to availability of funds.? The placement area is approximately 1.5 miles from the dredging area.? Dredging would be required to a depth of -6 feet Mean Lower Low Water (MLLW) plus 2 feet allowable overdepth.? The dredged material consists primarily of sand. The purpose of the proposed work is to alleviate the effects of shoaling and maintain the authorized project dimensions, thereby providing safe and economical use of LIIW by the U.S. Coast Guard and navigational boating interests while providing future beneficial use of the dredged material as shoreline stabilization for Cupsogue Beach County Park.? Based on past dredging cycles, it is anticipated that the proposed work will be performed by utilizing a hydraulic cutterhead dredge.? Additionally, multiple barges, tug boats, pipeline and land based equipment such as dozers, will be needed to perform the work during the dredging or placement activities.? The dredging and placement along the shoreline would be required to meet all federal, state, and local criteria required by the government agencies having jurisdiction where the dredging and placement sites are located.? Once the contract is awarded, the contractor will be required to commence work within five (5) calendar days after the date of receipt of the notice to proceed, and maintain an integrated production rate of at least 2,200 cubic yards per calendar day for the dredging and placement of the dredged sand.? The presence of dredging equipment in the channel will impact vessel traffic, and it is necessary to maintain this production rate while minimizing the duration of this impact.??? The work is estimated to cost between $1,000,000 and $5,000,000.? It is the intention of the government to award in end of July 2022 and the proposed work is anticipated to take place between October 2022 and January 2023. Liquidated Damages of $2,686.00 per calendar day of delay will be assessed to the contractor until all work under the contract is accepted as complete. This is an unrestricted Procurement."

column3: ",Purchasing,,516-628-1439,,,"Legal Notice # 21723623 NOTICE TO BIDDERS Incorporated Village of Bayville NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that SEALED PROPOSALS for ""Maintenance Dredging"" will be received by the Village Administrator of the Incorporated Village of Bayville at Village Hall, 34 School Street, Bayville, New York 11709, until 2:00 PM, Prevailing Time, on Thursday, June 16, 2022, at which time and place they will be publicly opened and read. Plans and specifications may be obtained on or after Monday, May 16, 2022, via email by sending a request to: DredgeBayville@gmail.com, or by downloading them from the Village's website at: https://bayvilleny.gov/request-for-proposal/ Each proposal must be accompanied by a certified check or bid bond in the amount of five percent (5%) of the bid amount, made payable to the INCORPORATED VILLAGE OF BAYVILLE, as assurance that the bid is made in good faith. The Board reserves the right to reject any or all bids, waive any informalities in and to accept such bids which, in its opinion, are in the best interests of the Village. Please note the Village office, website, and the project email DredgeBayville@gmail.com are the designated locations and means for distributing and obtaining all bid package information. All bidders are urged to register their interest at DredgeBayville@gmail.com to ensure receipt of all necessary information, including bid addenda. All bid addenda will be transmitted to registered plan holders via email. BY ORDER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES INCORPORATED VILLAGE OF BAYVILLE Maria Alfano Hardy Village Administrator"

NOTE: Please submit request for additional sampling reports. Files are too large to post on SAM.gov.?"

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,NY,"Maintenance Dredging of Flushing Bay & Creek, New York",Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 14, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/6a7bb44959c34ee89a429bb21f846eb7/view,"W912DS22B0012
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,mohenda.r.surage@usace.army.mil,,"The New York District of the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) proposes to perform maintenance dredging of Flushing Bay and Creek, New York, Federal Navigation Project to a depth of -15 feet Mean Lower Low Water (MLLW) plus 2 feet of allowable over-depth. The proposed maintenance dredging would remove approximately 150,000 cubic yards (CY) of critical shoals from the Flushing Bay and Creek with subsequent placement at a suitable, state-permitted upland site(s).? The dredged material from Flushing Bay and Creek consists of 1.0% gravel, 14.0% sand, 61.8% silt, and 23.2% clay.? Due to restrictions in the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation Water Quality Certificate, the proposed work can only be performed utilizing a mechanical dredge with a closed clamshell environmental bucket. Additionally, multiple scows and tugboats will be needed to perform the work during the dredging, and transport operations.? The dredged material would be required to meet all federal, state, and local criteria required by the government agencies having jurisdiction where the dredging and placement sites are located.? The apparent low bidder shall, within 35 calendar days from the date the apparent low bidder is notified of being such, provide copies of all required permits and approvals for transportation, transfer, dewatering, processing, and final placement of dredged material, and shall submit evidence of such permits and approvals to the government.? Bidders should consult the specifications for all submittal requirements. Once the contract is awarded, the contractor will be required to commence work within five (5) calendar days after the date of receipt of the notice to proceed and maintain an integrated production rate of at least 2,250 cubic yards per calendar day for the dredging and placement of material. The presence of dredging equipment in the channel will impact vessel traffic and it is necessary to maintain this production rate while minimizing the duration of this impact. The proposed work is anticipated to take place between September and November 2022.? The work is estimated to cost between than $10,000,000 and $25,000,000.00. This is an unrestricted procurement."

Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,NC,Military Ocean Terminal Sunny Point (MOTSU) Maintenance Dredging,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jul 6, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/62f38a89c2484a6984d736daddbb6949/view,"W912PM22B0017
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,jenifer.m.garland@usace.army.mil,,"The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Wilmington District requires a contract to provide Maintenance Dredging at Military Ocean Terminal Sunny Point (MOTSU), North Carolina, North Carolina, number W912PM22B0017.? Description of Work: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Wilmington District requires a contract to provide maintenance dredging along Military Ocean Terminal, Sunny Point in Brunswick County, North Carolina. The required work for MOTSU shall consist of maintenance dredging of the North, Central, and Southern basins, the South and Central entrance channels, and the security boat dock with an estimated quantity of 1,000,000 cubic yards.? The work will require the removal and disposal of shoaled material that has accumulated since they were last dredged. The dredging shall be performed by a US Coast Guard Ocean Certified hopper dredge, hydraulic cutter suction dredge, and/or mechanical dredge (clamshell, dragline, or dipper).? Dredging depths are 34 feet plus 2 feet of allowable overdepth and 38 feet plus 2 feet of allowable overdepth. Disposal of dredged material shall be in the Ocean Dredged Material Disposal Site (ODMDS). Environmental Window for security boat basin is 1 October to 31 March for hydraulic cutter suction dredges. Environmental Window for dredging the remainder of MOTSU channels and basins: 1 October to 31 June for mechanical and pipeline dredges and 1 December to 15 April for hopper dredges This solicitation is UNRESTRICTED. he contract issued will be Firm Fixed Price. The Magnitude of Construction of this project is between $5,000,000 and $10,000,000.? This solicitation will be issued in electronic format only and will be available on or about June 2, 2022.? The bid opening date will be specified in the solicitation when it is issued. No additional media (CD-ROM, floppy disks, facsimiles, etc) will be provided.?? Paper copies of this solicitation will not be available. Other methods of requesting a package will not be honored.? The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code is 237990 ? Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction and the size standard is $30,000,000.00. ? Bidders must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) in order to be eligible to receive an award from any Government solicitation.? Call 1-866-606-8220 for more information or visit the SAM website at http://sam.gov.? THE GOVERNMENT?S SAM WEBSITE DOES NOT CHARGE A FEE FOR REGISTRATION. IF YOU ARE REQUESTED TO PAY A FEE, YOU ARE NOT ACCESSING THE CORRECT WEBSITE, AND SHOULD LEAVE IT AND GO TO HTTP://SAM.GOV.? In order to locate the solicitation, Contractors can go to the http://sam.gov and search for the solicitation number.? Contractors can register to be put on a plan holders list that others can access.? It is the Bidder?s responsibility to check the Internet address provided as necessary for any posted changes to this solicitation and all amendments.? For additional information or assistance, please contact Ms. Jenifer Garland, Contract Specialist, phone 910-251-4134/email jenifer.m.garland@usace.army.mil or Ms. Rosalind M. Shoemaker at 910-251-4436/email rosalind.m.shoemaker@usace.army.mil."

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,NC,Wrightsville Beach Coastal Storm Risk Management,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 9, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/1c9c33a12f9f482b90c619291ac2e56f/view,"W912PM22B0031
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,terri.m.adams@usace.army.mil,,"The work shall consist of dredging, transporting, placing and shaping beach fill and performing all pre and post construction beach surveys.? The borrow area for Wrightsville Beach is located within 3 miles offshore of Wrightsville Beach, NC. The estimated beach fill quantities for Wrightsville Beach is 740,000 CY to be placed. All beach work will not begin until 16 November and must be completed by 30 April. Dredging with pipeline dredges will be limited to the period of 16 November through 30 April to comply with the beach disposal window."

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,NC,Lot 28A Waterfront Improvements,State/Local,,North Carolina Department of Commerce,"Jun 20, 2022",North Carolina Department of Commerce,https://www.ips.state.nc.us/IPS/AGENCY/PDF/14872300.pdf,"RFP
column3: ",Brenda Allen,,919-715-5615,,,"The Lot 28A waterfront infrastructure is used for offloading seafood products and consists of a timber bulkhead wall (150' in length along the shoreline) and a lower level 450 sq. ft. concrete platform/dock area (8"" thick concrete) supported by timber pilings. Both the timber bulkhead and platform are deteriorating and the structural integrity of both are now in jeopardy. The bulkhead is shifting, causing upland adjacent work areas to sink and depress. A forklift ramp on the platform/dock area is caving in, causing a safety issue and becoming unusable - a sign of major structural deterioration.

column1: Project includes demolition and removal of entire existing bulkhead wall and platform/dock area. Replacement infrastructure will include the installation of a stronger concrete bulkhead wall along the upland shoreline. The concrete platform/dock area will be redesigned. The area will be enclosed with a new steel sheet pile bulkhead and then backfilled - removing the need for structural pilings. A new concrete platform will be installed on the newly enclosed and backfilled platform area. This will ensure structural integrity into the future."

column3: ",Wildlife Resources Commission Headquarters,,919-707-0010,,,"Sealed proposals will be received by the North Carolina Wildlife Resources Commission at 1751 Varsity Drive, Raleigh NC 27606 on or before June 21, 2022 at 2:00pm. The bids will be taken and immediately thereafter opened and read aloud for the furnishing of labor, material, and equipment for the reconstruction of dam remediation and spillway replacement for Gum Swamp Lake. Bids will be received for a single prime contract only. All proposals shall be lump sum.

column1: A non-mandatory pre-bid meeting will be held for all interested bidders onsite at the Gum Swamp Lake Dam located on Gum Swamp Lake Road 11:00 am on Wednesday June 1, 2022, The meeting will address project specific questions, issues, bidding procedures, and bid forms."

Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,ND,"STEP-ONE IFB - Pipestem Dam Spillway Modification Project, Pipestem Creek, Jamestown, ND.",Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 13, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/63cd4e4f121d47b89947f647f52bc1ba/view,"W9128F22B0002
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,wayne.c.weidenhamer@usace.army.mil,,"**23 May 2022 - AM0002 Posted - Spec Revisions/Due Date Extended** **16 May 2022 - Site Visit Notes Posted.? This document is informational only.** **13 May 2022 - DRAFT Bid Schedule Posted.? This document is DRAFT and SUBJECT TO CHANGE, provided for INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.? DO NOT SUBMIT PRICING IN STEP ONE.? BIDS WILL BE REJECTED** **11 May 2022 - Site Visit Sign-In Sheet Posted** **9 May 2022 - AM0001 Posted - Revised Section 00 22 00** The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) Omaha District hereby issues the Step-One IFB of a Full and Open Unrestricted Two-Step Invitation for Bid (IFB) that will result in one (1) Firm Fixed-Price contract for the Pipestem Dam Spillway Modification Project on the Pipestem Creek near Jamestown, ND. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code is 237990 (Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction). Estimated Magnitude of Construction:? Between $100,000,000 and $250,000,000 PROJECT SCOPE:? This DBB construction contract will consist of a stepped roller compacted concrete (RCC) spillway chute structure with an integrated three-stage labyrinth crest control structure, approach walls, and stilling basin. Together, the chute structure and stilling basin will prevent the initiation of spillway erosion at the downstream end of the spillway.? Dikes on the left and right sides of the spillway channel will train the flow into the chute structure and provide flanking protection to prevent erosion from initiating outside of the spillway channel.? The spillway modification also includes lowering of the upstream spillway channel and the approach channel to 6 to 8 feet below existing grade.? TWO-STEP PROCUREMENT: This solicitation and resulting contract are using a Two-Step Sealed Bidding procurement method as described in FAR Part 14.5. The two-step procedure is a combination of competitive procedures designed to obtain the benefits of sealed bidding while ensuring only technically acceptable firms participate in the priced sealed bid.? The process allows for the Step One technical proposal submission and evaluation to be performed concurrent with the development of the final 100% technical specifications and construction drawings. Step One ensures that only technically acceptable firms participate in the Step Two sealed bid process.?? The Step One solicitation, issued as a Request for Technical Proposal, is issued here. The submission requirements of Step One, Request for Technical Proposal, shall not include any prices or pricing information.? Bid bonds / guarantees are not required to be submitted with the Step One technical proposal.? Under this bidding process, Step One consists of the request for submission, evaluation and (if necessary) discussion of a technical proposal. Only one (1) technical proposal may be submitted by each offeror. The proposals will be evaluated for technical acceptability. Again, the technical proposal must not include prices or pricing information. A notice of ?acceptable? or ?unacceptable? will be forwarded to each Step One offeror upon completion of the technical proposal evaluation and final determination.? The names of the offerors that submitted acceptable technical proposals will be listed on the Government?s?https://sam.gov/?website for the benefit of prospective subcontractors. In Step Two, an amendment to the solicitation will be issued along with the final 100% technical specifications and construction drawings to only those offerors whose technical proposals are determined to be acceptable in Step One.? The normal sealed bidding process in FAR Part 14 will be followed in Step Two. Only bids based upon technical proposals determined to be acceptable, either initially or as a result of discussions for Step One, will be considered for award. Each bid in Step Two must be based on the bidder's own technical proposal that was submitted, evaluated and determined to be acceptable in Step One.? Bidders must comply with the 100% technical specifications and construction drawings and the bidder?s acceptable technical proposal. Bid bonds will be required to be submitted with the Step Two bid submission. Payment and Performance Bonds will be required for the full amount (100%) at the time of contract award before the Notice to Proceed (NTP) can be issued. A site visit is tentatively scheduled for 10 May 2022. Individuals interested in attending must register in advance.? See solicitation for details. Interested prime contractors must have an active System for Award Management (SAM) registration. Firms can register via the SAM website at https://sam.gov/.? If an offeror is a Joint Venture (JV), the JV entity must have valid SAM registration in the SAM database representing the JV as one (1) business/firm/entity."

column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,504-426-0217,elrick.lounds@usda.gov,,"The United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) Farm Production and Conservation Acquisition Division intends to issue a Request for Quotes(RFQ) in accordance with FAR Part 13 on behalf of the USDA - Natural Resource Conservation Service (NRCS) Ohio State Office for work to be performed near Harrison, Montgomery County, Ohio.? column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,bradley.a.wahl.civ@army.mil,,"The Camp James A. Garfield Joint Military Training Site (CJAG) is a 21,683 acre training site located in northeast Ohio used by the Ohio Army National Guard (OHARNG) and other military and civil agencies. The purpose of this project is to improve an existing trail along the south perimeter of Group 7 (Training Area 71) to eventually connect to South Service Road. This project is for Phase 5 of that trail. Once fully completed and all phases constructed the improvements will provide better connectivity among training areas. The improvements will also contribute to long term sustainable use of training areas and will help avoid and/or minimize negative impacts to the environment and associated costs. The maneuver trail will have a surface hardened with stone. Some culvert replacement and installation is required as well as other drainage improvements. The trail must be able to accommodate a tractor trailer hauling heavy, tracked military equipment (tanks, bulldozers, etc.) and support the weight and movement of an M1A1 Abrams battle tank at 80 tons. Work to be accomplished includes all labor, material, equipment, and associated construction services for the following tasks:??Improve an existing trail along the southern perimeter of Group 7 (Training Area 71) for use by tanks and Bradley Fighting Vehicles.? The task includes all associated earth work, fence demolition, culvert installation, and site restoration. Antiterrorism Measures are the be included in accordance with the DoD Minimum Antiterrorism for building standards.? Our plan is to have one contractor be responsibile for all work in the scope.? This procurement will be an open bid, awarded to the a responsible construction business. The purpose of this synopsis is to gain knowledge of potential sources for this project included interested Small Business sources and to gage whether there are enough qualified Small Businesses capable of bidding on this project. This notice is for planning purposes only.? All interested parties should respond.? USPFO-OH intends to issue a solicitation and award of a contract to ""ITAM Trail Phase 5 on CJAGMTC"" .?? Project Scope:? Project site is located on Camp James A. Garfield Joint Military Training Site (CJAGMTC), Ravenna Ohio The magnitude of this project is between $500,000 and $1,000,000.? All interested concerns will provide this office, in writing, a notice stating their positive into submit a bid as a prime contractor no later than 3 June 2022.? This notification, which shall not exceed 5 typewritten pages, must include (1) positive statement of intent to bid as a prime contractor, and (2) a completed and signed Sources Sought Information Request Form (Attached) and (3) A listing of projects completed during the past three years, both for government and private industry.? The type of project, dollar value, Contract Number, Location, and Point of Contact are to be included.? Indicate if you were prime or subcontractor, and if subcontractor, provide name and point of contact for the prime contractor.? (4) A brief outline of resources, subcontractors, and key personnel that would be used to accomplish the contract. In the event that adeuate Small Business contractors are not available for adequate competition for this project, it may be advertised as unrestricted.? Information shall be provided via Email to:? Bradley.a.wahl.civ@army.mil. Include the following in the subject line - Sources Sought ITAM Trail Phase 5.? No facsimile responses will be honored."

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,OH,"Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): EWP Debris Removal ? Harrison, Montgomery County Ohio",Federal,,Department of Agriculture,"Jun 6, 2022",Department of Agriculture,https://sam.gov/opp/5cad2d1c216b4548b6ccf952408920d9/view,"12FPC322Q0029
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,504-426-0217,elrick.lounds@usda.gov,,"The United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) Farm Production and Conservation Acquisition Division intends to issue a Request for Quotes(RFQ) in accordance with FAR Part 13 on behalf of the USDA - Natural Resource Conservation Service (NRCS) Ohio State Office for work to be performed near Harrison, Montgomery County, Ohio.? Through the USDA Natural Resources Conservation Service Emergency Watershed Protection Program, the NRCS, and the Sponsor the Harrison Township, propose to contract a stream clearing project along a tributary to the Stillwater River, located along Shoop Mill Rd. between Main St. and Riverside Dr. An organized site visit has been scheduled for 25 May 2022. Participants will meet at Harrison Township, Sinclair Park, 685 Shoup Mill Rd Dayton, Ohio 45415. Magtinude of construction is between $100,000 and $250,000."

Through the USDA Natural Resources Conservation Service Emergency Watershed Protection Program, the NRCS, and the Sponsor the Harrison Township, propose to contract a stream clearing project along a tributary to the Stillwater River, located along Shoop Mill Rd. between Main St. and Riverside Dr. Period of Performance 15 Days. An organized site visit has been scheduled for 25 May 2022 at 1:00PM Local Time. Participants will meet at Harrison Township, Sinclair Park, 685 Shoup Mill Rd Dayton, Ohio 45415. Magtinude of construction is between $25,000 and $100,000."

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,OH,CUVA 224822 Stabilize Cuyahoga Riverbank at High,Federal,,Department of the Interior,"Jun 8, 2022",Department of the Interior,https://sam.gov/opp/11d6c1364d2e4aec8acf48858460b9a7/view,"140P2022R0048
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,202-208-3100,vicki_l_freese-supler@nps.gov,,"This is a Design Build project which will consist of the stabilization of eight sites along the Cuyahoga Valley riverbank along the Ohio & Erie Canal Towpath Trail, along the Valley Railway and along a connector trail in peninsula from the Towpath Trail to the Cuyahoga Valley Scenic Railroad."

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,OK,Fort Supply Lake - Supply Park Road,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 11, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/e4d3f7c296b84fa28b1dc23f4a6e2955/view,"W912BV-22-S-0085
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,Terry.L.Hawkins@usace.army.mil,,"Fort Supply Lake is located approximately 1 mile South of Fort Supply, Woodward County, Oklahoma.? Project location will be within Supply Park Public Use Area.? The scope of this project is to rehabilitate aged and failing roadway within Supply Park utilizing a specified asphalt-coated chip seal process.? Project road (shown as ?B?) is approximately 1500 feet in length and 15 feet in width, providing primary access to campsites 1-21, a boat ramp, and two small parking areas.? A section of current asphalt roadway (located within ?A?) will be cut, removed, and replaced with a concrete low-water crossing.? Areas adjacent to crossing will be graded appropriately to facilitate water drainage.? Speed bumps and pavement striping (if applicable) will be replaced in-kind.? The project scope MAY be expanded to include asphalt paving of an adjacent parking area, approximately 34,000 square feet (shown as ?C?).? Parking area is currently raveled asphalt and gravel and will be covered with fresh pavement surface.? Work plan includes minor site repair to ensure quality of existing subgrade and aggregate base, sweeping loose materials from surface, prime and tack coats installed at the pavement/base interface, and new 3? hot mix asphalt layer.? Pavement striping will be accomplished in accordance with work plan specifications and industry standards.?"

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,OK,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Keystone Stilling Basin Repairs,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 30, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/db5e525feedd48ad8a2a6239ca87c4a3/view,"W912BV22R0020
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,tyler.l.godwin@usace.army.mil,,"The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers ? Tulsa District has been tasked to solicit for and award construction project for repairs to the Keystone Stilling Basin. The Government seeks to repair damages and fill scour holes at the Keystone Lake Stilling Basin. Repairs to concrete will not require the handling of riprap, coarse aggregate, silt, debris, and other foreign material deposited within the stilling basin other than at locations of repairs. Dewatering of the Keystone stilling basins and lowering of the downstream tailwater will not occur during contract performance. All work within the stilling basins will be accomplished under water. The Contractor shall propose the Means and Method to accomplish the work. *Visit 'https://piee.eb.mil/sol/xhtml/unauth/search/oppMgmtLink.xhtml?solNo=W912BV22R0020' to obtain more details.*"

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,OK,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5) R.S. Kerr Dam Tainter Gates Rehabilitation and Repairs,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 13, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/18814922eb194ffe963cd6ffe736425f/view,"W912BV-22-R-0026
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,daniel.k.jernigan@usace.army.mil,,"=======Amendment # A0003====== The purpose of this amendment is to provide a list of contractors who partipcted in the Site Visit on 25 May 2022 for the proposed project.? Please see the attachment 22-R-0026 RS Kerr Tainter Gate Gates - Site Survey Participants All other terms and conditions of the solicitation remain the same.? ======End of Amendment====== =======Amendment # A0002====== The purpose of this amendment is to provide additional instructions for the site visit scheduled on 25 May 2022.? As a pre-caution due to ongoing construction as R.S. Kerr Lock and Dam 15, all perspective offerors interested in attending the scheduled site visit are required to wear the appropriate PPE.? This shall include at minimum:? (1) Hard Hat; (2) Safety Glasses; (3) Reflective Vest; and (4) Appropriate Safety Footwear. All other terms and conditions of the solicitation remain the same.? ======End of Amendment====== =======Amendment # A0001====== The purpose of this amendment is to provide a date, time, and coordinating instructions for a site visit to all interested offerors. A site visit of R.S. Kerr Lock and Dam 15 will be offered to all perspective offerors at 11:00 AM (CST) on 25 May 2022. All perspective offerors are requested to meet in the parking lot of the R.S. Project Lake Office to receive additional instructions for the visit. The address to the R.S. Kerr Project Lake Office is as follows: 460359 E 1137 Road Sallisaw, OK 74955 On day of the scheduled site visit, the following point of contact will be available to assist on directions and/or site location:? Raymond Todd (918) 669-7347 All other terms and conditions of the solicitation remain the same.? ======End of Amendment====== This is a SOLICITATION NOTICE for R.S. Kerr Tainter Gate Repairs The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers ? Tulsa District has been tasked to solicit for and award a firm fixed-price (FFP) construction contract for the R.S. Kerr Lock and Dam 15 Tainter Gate Repairs project, located at RS Kerr Lake, Sallisaw, Oklahoma (Le Flore County).? The proposed project will be?a small business set aside competitive procurement that will result in the award of one (1) Firm-Fixed Price, C-type contract,?procured in accordance with FAR 15, Negotiated Procurement, using the trade-off process.? Project Scope:??The scope of the project includes rehabilitation, repair, partial replacement, and painting of specified tainter gates, and incidental related work. The work required is summarized as follows: (1) Brush-off blast entire gates, inspection of damaged gate members, and provide gate inspection report; (2) Removal and replacement of diagonal members; (3) Removal and replacement of ribs; (4) Partial removal and replacement of skin plate; (5) Surface repair of primary members (girders); (6) Removal and replacement of miscellaneous stiffener plates; (7) Addition / modification of drain holes; (8) Blasting and painting of entire gates; (9) Removal and reattachment of existing wire rope assemblies and associated fittings and proper re-tensioning of wire ropes within specified tolerances; (10) Rehabilitation of hitch blocks with removal and replacement of hardware; (11) Removal and replacement of side seals assemblies and adjustment within specified tolerances; (12) Removal and replacement of trunnion hydraulic lubrication tubing and fittings; and (13) Providence of spare components as specified. Estimated duration of the construction phase of this project is 450 calendar days. TYPE OF SET-ASIDE: This requirement will be solicited as a 100% Small Business Set-Aside. The North American Industry Classification System code for this procurement is 237990, which has a small business size standard of $39.5M.? In accordance with FAR 36.204, Disclosure of the Magnitude of Construction Projects, the estimated magnitude of construction for this project is between $5,000,000 and $10,000,000. Please Note:? This solicitation requires bidders to enter a National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) score in the Supplier Performance Risk System (SPRS).? The NIST score is required before an award can be made. Site Visit/Date Time:? A site visit for this opportunity will be offered to perspective bidders during the open solicitation period.? An amendment to this solicitation will follow to provide a date, time, and coordinating instructions once confirmed. Any questions and inquiries related to this solicitation shall be submitted through Bidder?s Inquiry only. The Solicitation Number is:? W912BV22R0026 The Bidder Inquiry Key is:? D94FJT-68DGCG? ? ? ? ? ? ? The Bidder Inquiry System is anticipated to be unavailable for new inquiries after 2:00 p.m. on June 3, 2022, to ensure adequate time is allotted to form an appropriate response and amend the solicitation, if necessary.? The anticipated solicitation closing date will be at 2:00 PM, CST, on 13 June 2022. Please see the attached files for full details of this opportunity: 1.? RFP 22R0026 RS KERR TAINTER GATE REHAB 2.? RFP ATTACHMENT RS KERR TAINTER GATE REHAB PLANS"

The NIST score is required before an award can be made. Site Visit/Date Time:? A site visit for this opportunity will be offered to perspective bidders during the open solicitation period.? An amendment to this solicitation will follow to provide a date, time, and coordinating instructions once confirmed. Kerr Dam Tainter Gates Rehabilitation and Repairs,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 13, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/de495a8da3ed439c90b62d4983d2a8b1/view,"W912BV-22-R-0026
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,daniel.k.jernigan@usace.army.mil,,"=======Amendment # A0001====== The purpose of this amendment is to provide a date, time, and coordinating instructions for a site visit to all interested offerors. A site visit of R.S. Kerr Lock and Dam 15 will be offered to all perspective offerors at 11:00 AM (CST) on 25 May 2022. All perspective offerors are requested to meet in the parking lot of the R.S. Project Lake Office to receive additional instructions for the visit. The address to the R.S. Kerr Project Lake Office is as follows: 460359 E 1137 Road Sallisaw, OK 74955 On day of the scheduled site visit, the following point of contact will be available to assist on directions and/or site location:? Raymond Todd (918) 669-7347 All other terms and conditions of the solicitation remain the same.? ======End of Amendment====== This is a SOLICITATION NOTICE for R.S. Kerr Tainter Gate Repairs The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers ? Tulsa District has been tasked to solicit for and award a firm fixed-price (FFP) construction contract for the R.S. Kerr Lock and Dam 15 Tainter Gate Repairs project, located at RS Kerr Lake, Sallisaw, Oklahoma (Le Flore County).? The proposed project will be?a small business set aside competitive procurement that will result in the award of one (1) Firm-Fixed Price, C-type contract,?procured in accordance with FAR 15, Negotiated Procurement, using the trade-off process.? Project Scope:??The scope of the project includes rehabilitation, repair, partial replacement, and painting of specified tainter gates, and incidental related work. The work required is summarized as follows: (1) Brush-off blast entire gates, inspection of damaged gate members, and provide gate inspection report; (2) Removal and replacement of diagonal members; (3) Removal and replacement of ribs; (4) Partial removal and replacement of skin plate; (5) Surface repair of primary members (girders); (6) Removal and replacement of miscellaneous stiffener plates; (7) Addition / modification of drain holes; (8) Blasting and painting of entire gates; (9) Removal and reattachment of existing wire rope assemblies and associated fittings and proper re-tensioning of wire ropes within specified tolerances; (10) Rehabilitation of hitch blocks with removal and replacement of hardware; (11) Removal and replacement of side seals assemblies and adjustment within specified tolerances; (12) Removal and replacement of trunnion hydraulic lubrication tubing and fittings; and (13) Providence of spare components as specified. Estimated duration of the construction phase of this project is 450 calendar days. TYPE OF SET-ASIDE: This requirement will be solicited as a 100% Small Business Set-Aside. The North American Industry Classification System code for this procurement is 237990, which has a small business size standard of $39.5M.? In accordance with FAR 36.204, Disclosure of the Magnitude of Construction Projects, the estimated magnitude of construction for this project is between $5,000,000 and $10,000,000. Please Note:? This solicitation requires bidders to enter a National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) score in the Supplier Performance Risk System (SPRS).? The NIST score is required before an award can be made. Site Visit/Date Time:? A site visit for this opportunity will be offered to perspective bidders during the open solicitation period.? An amendment to this solicitation will follow to provide a date, time, and coordinating instructions once confirmed. Any questions and inquiries related to this solicitation shall be submitted through Bidder?s Inquiry only. The Solicitation Number is:? W912BV22R0026 The Bidder Inquiry Key is:? D94FJT-68DGCG? ? ? ? ? ? ? The Bidder Inquiry System is anticipated to be unavailable for new inquiries after 2:00 p.m. on June 3, 2022, to ensure adequate time is allotted to form an appropriate response and amend the solicitation, if necessary.? The anticipated solicitation closing date will be at 2:00 PM, CST, on 13 June 2022. Please see the attached files for full details of this opportunity: 1.? RFP 22R0026 RS KERR TAINTER GATE REHAB 2.? RFP ATTACHMENT RS KERR TAINTER GATE REHAB PLANS"

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,OK,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5) POL Line & ADAL Fuel Yard TAFB,Federal,,Department of Defense,Today ,Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/2b8ef86df16c484aa792983a3df5f2c3/view,"W912BV22S0025
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,ryan.j.kelly@usace.army.mil,,"The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers ? Tulsa has been tasked to solicit for and award a contract to construct KC-46A Petroleum, Oil, Lubricants (POL) Line and ADAL Fuel Yard at Tinker AFB, OK.? ?Proposed project will be a competitive, firm-fixed price, design/bid/build, contract procured in accordance with FAR 15.? The type of set-aside decision to be issued will depend upon the capabilities of the responses to this synopsis. The purpose of this synopsis is to gain knowledge of interest, capabilities and qualifications of various members of industry, to include the Small Business Community: Small Business, Section 8(a), Historically Underutilized Business Zones (HUB-Zone), Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), and Women-Owned Small Business (WOSB).? The Government must ensure there is adequate competition among the potential pool of responsible contractors.? Small business, Section 8(a), HUBZone, SDVOSB, WOSB businesses are highly encouraged to participate.? The Government is seeking qualified, experienced sources capable of performing: Experience with POL Lines The installation of Fuel lines Fueling electrical conduits Emergency fuel shutoff stations, and Manholes The expansion and modification to the existing fuel tank farm equipment to include: A new 2,500 barrel aboveground storage tank Hydrant pump Filter/separator Additional appurtenances In accordance with FAR 36/DFARs 236, the estimated construction price range for this project is: Between $10,000,000 and $25,000,000"

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,OR,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): DARRINGTON RANGER DISTRICT ROAD MAINTENANCE,Federal,,Department of Agriculture,"Jun 10, 2022",Department of Agriculture,https://sam.gov/opp/89d14f352648430b84fe9d9a89828148/view,"1240BD22Q0094
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,504-426-0217,arlene.steffey@usda.gov,,"***************AMENDMENT TO CHANGE THE POP AND EXTEND THE CLOSING DATE**************** Solicitation No. 120BD22Q0094 FSRs ROAD MAINTENANCE SERVICES (i) This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. (ii) This solicitation is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ). (iii) The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2022-04. (iv) This procurement is set aside for Small Businesses. The NAICS code is 238910 ? Site Preparation Contractors and the Small Business Size Standard is $16.5 Million. (v) Schedule of Items/Price Schedule Refer to pages 3-11 Schedule Notes: a) Items labeled as optional are not required to be exercised by the government. If exercised, the contractor will be required to perform the optional work in accordance with the terms and conditions of this contract. b) One award will be made from this solicitation, contractors must submit pricing for all items. USDA Forest Service Northwest Zone CSA #2, and the Mt. Baker-Snoqualmie National Forest is in need of road maintenance services. These are roads providing access to and within National Forests and other federal lands managed by National Forest programs. They generally include Forest Highways, Forest Development Roads and Parkways. The intent of this performancebased standalone contract is to provide for roadside brushing and road maintenance of forest roads. The Contractor shall furnish the necessary personnel, material, equipment, services and facilities (except as otherwise specified), to perform the Statement of Work/Specifications referenced herein. The scope of work includes common road maintenance activities including the following: grading, brushing, ditching, spot rocking, culvert cleanout, slide and obstruction removal, installing signs, asphalt pothole repair and culvert removal."

Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,OR,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): LOOKOUT POINT UNIT 2 BUS,Federal,,Department of Defense,"May 13, 2024",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/9d0adc4b37414c7c9c0ad688b42d44e9/view,"W9127N22B0002
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,charles.m.boswell@usace.army.mil,,"The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Portland District, has a requirement to replace a damaged section of metal-enclosed bus duct at the Lookout Point Dam. Power is delivered from three hydropower generating units to the Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) at 115kV through three Generator Step-Up (GSU) transformers located on the downstream deck of the powerhouse and a 115kV breaker in the BPA switchyard. In January 2020, the GSU transformer T2 experienced a differential trip during a switching operation of the 115kV breaker that then triggered the fire protection deluge system at transformer T2. This water infiltration resulted in a ground fault and damage to the metal-enclosed bus duct between the Unit #2 breaker and the transformer T2."

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,PA,Emsworth Locks and Dams Miter Gate Hydraulic System Upgrade,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 29, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/111e3b8105aa4d9785e6581c90e74a48/view,"W911WN22B8002
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,Aaron.M.Barr@usace.army.mil,,"The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Pittsburgh District, has a project that involves the upgrade of the miter gate hydraulics systems at Emsworth Locks and Dams, Ohio River, PA. The contract generally includes the installation of four (4) dedicated hydraulic power units (HPU) on the main chamber with new variable frequency drive (VFD) motor control centers (MCC), installation of a new central HPU for the auxiliary chamber, demolition of the existing central HPU, and demolition of existing hydraulic pipes and valves associated with the main chamber. The major features of the requirements are identified below: The contract specifically includes: a. Installation of additional shutoff valves on the middle wall oil piping to enable removal of the main chamber miter gate operating machinery from the existing central hydraulic network.b. Testing of existing fiber optic network and production of network map.c. Furnishings and installation of four dedicated HPU, including raised concrete pads, protection, associated electronics and hardware, and hydraulic oil, by each of the miter gate locations on the main chamber.d. Furnishing and delivery of spare dedicated HPU.e. Furnishing and installation of VFD control MCCs on the land and middle walls.f. Furnishing and installation of new auxiliary chamber HPU on middle wall, including all associated electronics and hardware.g. Furnishing and delivery of spare motor and pump for auxiliary HPU.h. Furnish and install new miter gate position feedback sensors.i. Modification of existing control software to allow for automated miter gate operation and HPU monitoringj. Demolition and disposal of existing HPU located in the middle wall operation building. This includes all motors, pumps, reservoir, raised skid, associated piping, and proper disposal of hydraulic oil.k. Demolition and removal of all existing hydraulic oil lines on the land wall, including all lines for pressure, return, drain, and filling, valving, and proper disposal of hydraulic oil.l. Integration of new system with existing fiber optic communication cabling.Removal and proper disposal of hydraulic oil will be required. Removal and proper disposal of electrical equipment will be required. Ferrous and all other construction waste material will be disposed of at commercially permitted facilities licensed to accept waste or recyclable materials as applicable. Construction work will occur in close proximity to waterway traffic and operating lock and dam gates. The existing lock chambers and dams are currently operated and staffed by Government personnel 24 hours a day 365 days of the year. Lock closures for installation and testing of new equipment will be required to be minimal and at the approval of Government. *Visit 'https://piee.eb.mil/sol/xhtml/unauth/search/oppMgmtLink.xhtml?solNo=W911WN22B8002' to obtain more details.*"

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,PA,Invitation for Bids Municipal Stream Restoration Collaboration for MS4,State/Local,,State of Pennsylvania,"Jun 8, 2022",State of Pennsylvania,http://www.emarketplace.state.pa.us/Solicitations.aspx?SID=610055555,"610055555
column3: ",Purchasing,,717-787-5733,,,"PennDOT is procuring sediment removal credit through Best Management Practice (BMP) services that reduce sediment pollution in the Paxton Creek Watershed and Swatara Township in Dauphin County, Pennsylvania.    Pre-Bid Conference  Due to the current COVID pandemic, this conference will take place via Microsoft Teams. The Conference will be held on May 25, 2022 @ 9:30 AM via Microsoft Teams. An RSVP is due via email to James Alwine, jaalwine@pa.gov by May 24, 2022 @ 3:00 PM. The link to the Microsoft Teams call, or call in phone# and code for those without Microsoft Teams access, will be provided after registration.   Bid will be awarded based upon the highest total of annual sediment reduction that can be achieved in five years, or less, for the compensation of $4,500,000.00.  The Department of General Services (DGS) Small Diverse Business (SDB) and Veteran Business Enterprise (VBE) program applies to this procurement. There is an SDB Goal of 7% and an VBE Goal of 3% established for this procurement.  BIDS WILL ONLY BE ACCEPTED ELECTRONICALLY.  All quantities are estimated."

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,PA,Industry Engagement Day - Construction of a New Lock Chamber at Montgomery Locks & Dam,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 7, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/5810fb1b528d46bcaca9ce9d118c68ba/view,"W911WN22ID8002
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,gregory.m.sies@usace.army.mil,,"New Attachment - Construction Industry Day Overview Presentation Slides - added 24 May 2022 Additional Information added 12 May 2022 (through WebEx Information): The industry engagement day will be held on June 7th, 2022 starting at 9:00am Eastern Time and ending at about 12:00pm EST at?Montgomery Locks and Dam, 100 Montgomery Dam Rd, Monaca, PA 15061 Construction Industry Engagement Day Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) Requirements: Montgomery Lock is an active construction site. ?PPE is required: ?steel-toed boots, hard hats, life jackets are required. USACE can provide limited hard hats and life jackets if necessary. Questionnaires: Industry engagement day questions are attached to this posting. ?Written contractor feedback is requested and greatly appreciated.? Please email christopher.t.dening@usace.army.mil with completed questionnaires by June 17th. ?Questionnaires will be considered proprietary and will not be made public. ?Partially completed questionnaires are acceptable. Individual Meetings: Contractors have the opportunity to meet one on one with USACE on June 8th and 9th, 2022 in person or via WebEx. ?Meetings time slots are available at 9:00 am, 11:00 am, 1:00 pm and 3:00 pm EST each day. ?Time slots will be filled on a first come first served basis. ?Meetings will be limited to 90 minutes. ?These meetings will be held at the Pittsburgh Engineer Warehouse and Repair Station (PEWARS) located at 3500 Grand Ave., Pittsburgh, PA 15225 or virtually by request. ?Contractors are limited to 4 personnel for in-person or virtual meetings. Please email christopher.t.dening@usace.army.mil to schedule a meeting if interested. Project Overview Meeting: A virtual presentation will be held May 19th, 2022, at 1:00 pm to 2:00 pm EST to cover a general overview of the Upper Ohio Navigation project and to provide context for the industry day event at Montgomery Lock. ?No security background check is required for this virtual event. WebEx Information: https://usace1.webex.com/meet/christopher.t.dening Join by phone +1-844-800-2712 US Toll Free Access code: 199 032 1583 ? Previous posted information: Industry Engagement Day The Corps of Engineers (USACE), Pittsburgh District intends to advertise a construction contract for the completion of a new 110' x 600' lock chamber to replace the existing auxiliary chamber at Montgomery Locks and Dam near Monaca, PA.? The solicitation for the project is scheduled to be posted in 2024.? The scope will include demolition of the existing auxiliary river wall, guard walls, and ancillary features.? Construction will be a combination of in-the-wet and in-the-dry techniques and will require the placement of tremie concrete, drilled shafts, mass concrete, miter gates, heavy machinery and multiple buildings. In accordance with DFARS 236.204 (v), the magnitude of construction for the project will be over $500M. This is a save the date announcement for a construction contractor industry engagement day to be held at Montgomery Locks and Dam, 100 Montgomery Dam Rd, Monaca, PA 15061.? Preliminary construction plans and specifications will be posted in advance of the industry day.? USACE will be soliciting feedback on the preliminary plans and the overall project to assist with the design and acquisition strategy. The industry engagement day will be held on 7 June 2022 and is open to prime contractors, subcontractors, material suppliers and other vendors who have an interest in this project. Industry day questions will be posted and written contractor feedback is requested. ?Additionally, contractors will have the opportunity to meet one on one with USACE on June 8 and 9, 2022 in person or via WebEx.? Time slots will be filled on a first come first served basis.? Meetings will be limited to 90 minutes.? These meetings will be held at the Pittsburgh Engineer Warehouse and Repair Station (PEWARS) located at 3500 Grand Ave., Pittsburgh, PA 15225.? Contractors are limited to 4 personnel for in-person or virtual individual meetings. Security Requirements: No later than May 25th, 2022, all prime contractors, subcontractors, material suppliers and other vendors who plan to attend the construction contractor industry day will need to provide all information required for criminal history checks to meet facility access requirements to be accomplished by the Pittsburgh District Security Office. ?No one will be admitted to the event without clearance from the Pittsburgh District Security Office.? In order to complete the background check, please fill out the attached LRP Security Information Sheet with the attendees and send to christopher.t.dening@usace.army.mil?"
