column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,PA,"Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Construction of Thatcher Run PA-112 Conneautville Dam Rehabilitation, Crawford County, PA.",Federal,,Department of Agriculture,"Jun 16, 2022",Department of Agriculture,https://sam.gov/opp/7aaea8e01fcc43d298215f9b3bd69f31/view,"12FPC322B0012
column5: ",Purchasing Officer,,504-426-0217,stephen.case@usda.gov,,"The Conneautville Dam is in the Borough of Conneautville, Crawford County, Pennsylvania.? Conneautville Dam is owned and operated by the Borough of Conneautville. The objectives of the project are to implement the established design for rehabilitation to rehabilitate the dam to meet or exceed state and federal dam safety criteria, and to maintain the current level of flood protection provided by Conneautville Dam.? ? The rehabilitation construction requires realignment of auxiliary spillway channel and expansion of the training dike; installation of a sheetpile wall along the left side of the auxiliary spillway; lime treatment of surficial dispersive soils on the embankment, auxiliary spillway, and training dike; reconfiguration of the 8-inch diameter embankment drain pipes in the vicinity of the principal spillway impact basin; construction of a filter diaphragm below the existing principal spillway outlet conduit; and replacement of the existing trash rack installed on the inlet structure."

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,PA,Park Construction of Fish Passage,State/Local,,State of Pennsylvania,"Jun 29, 2022",State of Pennsylvania,http://www.emarketplace.state.pa.us/Solicitations.aspx?SID=DGS C-0148-0001 Phase 1,"DGS C-0148-0001 Phas
column3: ",Purchasing,,717-787-5733,,,"This PROJECT IS A STANDARD LOW BID PROJECT and includes GENERAL CONSTRUCTION.  PROJECT TITLE: Shikellamy State Park - Construction of Fish Passage on the Susquehanna River  ESTIMATED RANGE:  .1 General ? $4,000,000 - $5,000,000              LIQUIDATED DAMAGES = (.1) $1,250.00 per day.  There is no Bid Guaranty required for this Project.  DATE FOR RECEIVING BIDS IS WEDNESDAY, JUNE 29, 2022, AT 2:00 P.M.  The VIRTUAL Pre-Bid Conference will take place on Tuesday, June 7, 2022, at 1:30 P.M.,   Microsoft Teams meeting.  Join on your computer or mobile app https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_ZmM1NTVjNDItZDM2Mi00YTkwLWI0NjItYjNlMjhlZDY5YWNh%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%22418e2841-0128-4dd5-9b6c-47fc5a9a1bde%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%22b1f7d945-7b34-4dd6-80c2-9828241bfcf6%22%7d Or call in (audio only) +1 267-332-8737,,50810269# United States, Philadelphia Phone Conference ID: 508 102 69#  The ON-SITE Pre-Bid Conference will take place on Wednesday, June 8, 2022, at 1:00 P.M., at 466 7th Ave, Shamokin Dam, PA 17876 - BRING HARD HAT.   Client Agency Requirements ----- During the on-site portion of the pre-bid meeting all participants must be wearing a hardhat. The site will be an active construction site.   Projects located at any Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Facilities listed on the Department?s January 24. 2022, and March 25, 2022, Notices must continue to follow the ?Interim Final Rule COVID-19 Vaccination Requirements? and deadlines.  Projects at all Non-CMS Facilities are encouraged to follow COVID-19 vaccination requirements.  Guidelines and site access requirements vary per site, and some agencies may have more stringent requirements which will be noted in their project?s Notice to Bidders.  The Department of General Services Public Works and the Bureau of Diversity, Inclusion and Small Business Opportunities (BDISBO) identified this procurement as eligible for the setting of Small Diverse Business (SDB) and/or Veteran Business Enterprise (VBE) participation goals.  However, BDISBO did not set SDB and/or VBE participation goals for those procurements that are less than the $400,000 threshold required to set either goal.  In addition, there will be no points allocated toward SDB/SB participation for this procurement.  This is a significant programmatic change from the SDB and SB Participation program contained in prior Projects issued by Public Works.  Bidders now must agree to meet the SDB and VBE Participation Goals in full or demonstrate that they have made Good Faith Efforts to meet the Goals. Refer to the Instructions to Bidders section regarding Small Diverse Business and Veteran Business Enterprise Participation for further information.  The Goals for each Prime Contract is as follows: SDB AND VBE GOALS .1 General Construction ? ALL BASE BIDS (#1)     SDB = 5%    VBE = 3%  All proposers must be registered to view/download Plans and Specifications and must have a Current, Active Vendor Number. To register click the following link:   register    All Proposers are required to create a user profile within e-Builder.  Please click on discipline below to create a user profile and view the bid package:    General Construction    BIDS FOR THIS PROJECT WILL ONLY BE ACCEPTED ELECTRONICALLY THROUGH E-BUILDER.  A video tutorial is available on the e-Builder site for first time users to learn how to navigate e-Builder.  Technical support is also available via email at support@e-builder.net or by phone at 1-888-288-5717.    Due to technical limitations, public bid openings must be viewed using a Windows PC.  At this time, mobile devices are not supported. Interested parties may also watch the live bid opening at Public Works, 1800 Herr Street, Harrisburg, PA  17125. The online public bid opening can be viewed by clicking the following link:  Public Bid Opening To view a list of current potential bidders and bid results go to the link below and scroll down the page and click on ?Current Project Bidding Potential Bidders List?: Bidding Information PUBLIC WORKS EMPLOYMENT VERIFICATION ACT:   THE BIDDER MUST COMPLY WITH THE PUBLIC WORKS EMPLOYMENT VERIFICATION ACT 127 OF 2012 BY SUBMITTING TO THE DEPARTMENT A COMMONWEALTH PUBLIC WORKS VERIFICATION FORM (?FORM?) WITH THEIR BID OR PRIOR TO THE AWARD OF THE CONTRACT.  EXECUTIVE ORDER 202"

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,PA,Emsworth Locks and Dams Miter Gate Hydraulic System Upgrade,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 15, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/c6a93a86695b4b38ab8f76f2c5666778/view,"W911WN22B8002
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,Aaron.M.Barr@usace.army.mil,,"The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Pittsburgh District, has a project that involves the upgrade of the miter gate hydraulics systems at Emsworth Locks and Dams, Ohio River, PA. The contract generally includes the installation of four (4) dedicated hydraulic power units (HPU) on the main chamber with new variable frequency drive (VFD) motor control centers (MCC), installation of a new central HPU for the auxiliary chamber, demolition of the existing central HPU, and demolition of existing hydraulic pipes and valves associated with the main chamber. The major features of the requirements are identified below: The contract specifically includes: a. Installation of additional shutoff valves on the middle wall oil piping to enable removal of the main chamber miter gate operating machinery from the existing central hydraulic network.b. Testing of existing fiber optic network and production of network map.c. Furnishings and installation of four dedicated HPU, including raised concrete pads, protection, associated electronics and hardware, and hydraulic oil, by each of the miter gate locations on the main chamber.d. Furnishing and delivery of spare dedicated HPU.e. Furnishing and installation of VFD control MCCs on the land and middle walls.f. Furnishing and installation of new auxiliary chamber HPU on middle wall, including all associated electronics and hardware.g. Furnishing and delivery of spare motor and pump for auxiliary HPU.h. Furnish and install new miter gate position feedback sensors.i. Modification of existing control software to allow for automated miter gate operation and HPU monitoringj. Demolition and disposal of existing HPU located in the middle wall operation building. This includes all motors, pumps, reservoir, raised skid, associated piping, and proper disposal of hydraulic oil.k. Demolition and removal of all existing hydraulic oil lines on the land wall, including all lines for pressure, return, drain, and filling, valving, and proper disposal of hydraulic oil.l. Integration of new system with existing fiber optic communication cabling.Removal and proper disposal of hydraulic oil will be required. Removal and proper disposal of electrical equipment will be required. Ferrous and all other construction waste material will be disposed of at commercially permitted facilities licensed to accept waste or recyclable materials as applicable. Construction work will occur in close proximity to waterway traffic and operating lock and dam gates. The existing lock chambers and dams are currently operated and staffed by Government personnel 24 hours a day 365 days of the year. Lock closures for installation and testing of new equipment will be required to be minimal and at the approval of Government. *Visit 'https://piee.eb.mil/sol/xhtml/unauth/search/oppMgmtLink.xhtml?solNo=W911WN22B8002' to obtain more details.*"

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,PA,Industry Engagement Day - Construction of a New Lock Chamber at Montgomery Locks & Dam,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 7, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/e29df0e1ebbe464781fa1bb647e6c3d3/view,"W911WN22ID8002
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,gregory.m.sies@usace.army.mil,,"Additional Information added 12 May 2022 (through WebEx Information): Construction Industry Engagement Day Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) Requirements: Montgomery Lock is an active construction site. ?PPE is required: ?steel-toed boots, hard hats, life jackets are required. USACE can provide limited hard hats and life jackets if necessary. Questionnaires: Industry engagement day questions are attached to this posting. ?Written contractor feedback is requested and greatly appreciated.? Please email christopher.t.dening@usace.army.mil with completed questionnaires by June 17th. ?Questionnaires will be considered proprietary and will not be made public. ?Partially completed questionnaires are acceptable. Individual Meetings: Contractors have the opportunity to meet one on one with USACE on June 8th and 9th, 2022 in person or via WebEx. ?Meetings time slots are available at 9:00 am, 11:00 am, 1:00 pm and 3:00 pm EST each day. ?Time slots will be filled on a first come first served basis. ?Meetings will be limited to 90 minutes. ?These meetings will be held at the Pittsburgh Engineer Warehouse and Repair Station (PEWARS) located at 3500 Grand Ave., Pittsburgh, PA 15225 or virtually by request. ?Contractors are limited to 4 personnel for in-person or virtual meetings. Please email christopher.t.dening@usace.army.mil to schedule a meeting if interested. Project Overview Meeting: A virtual presentation will be held May 19th, 2022, at 1:00 pm to 2:00 pm EST to cover a general overview of the Upper Ohio Navigation project and to provide context for the industry day event at Montgomery Lock. ?No security background check is required for this virtual event. WebEx Information: https://usace1.webex.com/meet/christopher.t.dening Join by phone +1-844-800-2712 US Toll Free Access code: 199 032 1583 ? Previous posted information: Industry Engagement Day The Corps of Engineers (USACE), Pittsburgh District intends to advertise a construction contract for the completion of a new 110' x 600' lock chamber to replace the existing auxiliary chamber at Montgomery Locks and Dam near Monaca, PA.? The solicitation for the project is scheduled to be posted in 2024.? The scope will include demolition of the existing auxiliary river wall, guard walls, and ancillary features.? Construction will be a combination of in-the-wet and in-the-dry techniques and will require the placement of tremie concrete, drilled shafts, mass concrete, miter gates, heavy machinery and multiple buildings. In accordance with DFARS 236.204 (v), the magnitude of construction for the project will be over $500M. This is a save the date announcement for a construction contractor industry engagement day to be held at Montgomery Locks and Dam, 100 Montgomery Dam Rd, Monaca, PA 15061.? Preliminary construction plans and specifications will be posted in advance of the industry day.? USACE will be soliciting feedback on the preliminary plans and the overall project to assist with the design and acquisition strategy. The industry engagement day will be held on 7 June 2022 and is open to prime contractors, subcontractors, material suppliers and other vendors who have an interest in this project. Industry day questions will be posted and written contractor feedback is requested. ?Additionally, contractors will have the opportunity to meet one on one with USACE on June 8 and 9, 2022 in person or via WebEx.? Time slots will be filled on a first come first served basis.? Meetings will be limited to 90 minutes.? These meetings will be held at the Pittsburgh Engineer Warehouse and Repair Station (PEWARS) located at 3500 Grand Ave., Pittsburgh, PA 15225.? Contractors are limited to 4 personnel for in-person or virtual individual meetings. Security Requirements: No later than May 25th, 2022, all prime contractors, subcontractors, material suppliers and other vendors who plan to attend the construction contractor industry day will need to provide all information required for criminal history checks to meet facility access requirements to be accomplished by the Pittsburgh District Security Office. ?No one will be admitted to the event without clearance from the Pittsburgh District Security Office.? In order to complete the background check, please fill out the attached LRP Security Information Sheet with the attendees and send to christopher.t.dening@usace.army.mil?"

column4: ",Purchasing,,803-734-6062,,,"The South Carolina Ports Authority is accepting bids for Construction of the East & West Container Yard Expansion project at our Inland Port Greer. column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,SC,Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5) Repair Waterfront Circuit Breaker Project No. 1093496,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jun 6, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/69dc17b3937c4fbbb1b466eea6e0fd59/view,"FA441822R0014
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,ryan.smith@us.af.mil,,"A. The purpose of this amendment is to provide Government responses to interested offeror questions and incorporate a revised specification (revision 1) to supersede the previous specification, attachment J.1 of the solicitation. B. Specification sections 01 11 00 Summary of Work, 01 45 00.00 20 Construction Quality Control, 26 11 14.00 10 Main Electric Supply Station and Substation, have been revised as revision 1, are hereby incorporated, and supersede all previous versions. C. Government responses to interested offeror questions are hereby incorporated into section J of the solicitation as attachment J.6. The purpose of this amendment is to provide a list of attendees for the site visit held on 12 May 2022 at 9:30 P.M. EST and establish a date for the submission of all questions No Later Than 16 May 22 at 12:00 P.M. The Contracting Officer is the only point of contract for receiving questions. Submit questions in writing to Eric Gonzalez, Contracting Officer, eric.gonzalez.17@us.af.mil. THIS SOLICITATION IS ISSUED AS A 100% ?Small Business SET-ASIDE USING SUBJECTIVE TRADE-OFF PROCEDURES AND THE PROVISIONS OF SECTIONS L AND M. This requirement is for a single award Firm-Fixed Price contract. The contractor shall provide personnel, equipment, tools, materials, and supervision necessary to complete project DKGV 1093496/Repair Waterfront Circuit Breakers, Joint ?Base Charleston, South Carolina, with an anticipated performance time of 180 calendar days. The work includes retaining the services of a licensed Electrical Engineer to perform the required shop drawing and studies to accomplish the work described herein. There is a total of (9) nine medium voltage circuit breakers that will be replaced. (8) eight breakers will be rated at 600 amperes and will serve as feeder breakers. The remaining (1) one breaker shall be rated at 1200 amperes and will serve as a main breaker. This work also includes the evaluation and repair of the existing medium voltage regulator. All materials removed from service shall become property of the contractor and shall be disposed of off-base. Notice to Offeror(s)/Supplier(s): Funds are not presently available for this effort. No award will be made under this solicitation until funds are available. The Government reserves the right to cancel this solicitation, either before or after the closing date. In the event the Government cancels the solicitation, the Government has no obligation to reimburse an offeror for any costs. Project magnitude: ?Between $500,000 and $1,000,000 The Notice to Proceed will be issued within 45 days of award. NAICS: ?237130 ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ?Size Standard: ?$39,500,000 ? ? ? ? ? ? ? ?DO: ?C20 A site visit will be held on 12 May 2022, at 0930 ?hrs (EST). ?See Section B for details and instructions.? Please forward any questions or concerns to Ryan M. Smith at Ryan.Smith.108@us.af.mil"

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,SC,Penn Branch Stabilization Project ,State/Local,,"Columbia, South Carolina","Jun 29, 2022","Columbia, South Carolina",https://columbiasc.ionwave.net/CurrentSourcingEvents.aspx,"BID030-21-22-CE
column4: ",Purchasing,,803-545-3470,ciera.ellis@columbiasc.gov,,"This Project consists of the repair or replacement of existing masonry walls along Penn Branch, repair of channel scour within the walled section of Penn Branch, and the stabilization of the natural earthen sections of Penn Branch. The project includes repairing undermined areas of wall, replacing failing walls with modular block walls, placing riprap to remedy channel scour, slope grading and stabilization and landscaping."

column1: Infrastructure: Marine, Ports, Dredging, Dams Bids,TN,W912P521R0009 - Pre-Solicitation Notice,Federal,,Department of Defense,"Jul 7, 2022",Department of Defense,https://sam.gov/opp/db715ba4b0f542f58032c220043de398/view,"W912P521R0009
column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,samantha.d.harrison@usace.army.mil,,"PROJECT DESCRIPTION: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), Nashville District (LRN), is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) solicitation for a single firm fixed-price (FFP) Construction Contract for the Center Hill Dam Spillway Gates and Machinery Replacement Project near Lancaster, TN. The scope of this requirement includes the replacement of eight (8) spillway tainter gates and nine (9) gate lifting machinery setups, including, but not limited to, wire rope and drum setup, high and low-speed gear boxes, 10 hp electric motor, bull and pinion gears, and machinery base on each gate pier for the Center Hill Dam located near Lancaster, TN in DeKalb County. The Center Hill Dam Spillway Gates and Machinery Replacement Contract will restore the dam to its full functionality as it was intended, once built.? The major features of this Contract include fabrication and installation of the new gates and lifting machinery equipment that is required to operate the gates. To accomplish these major features, the scope will include the following items:? 1) Fabricate eight (8) new spillway tainter gates; 2) Remove and dispose of the existing spillway tainter gates, existing lifting equipment, and lifting equipment machinery base; 3) Work platform to install the new spillway tainter gates; 4) Install the spillway tainter gates and gate lifting machinery equipment, electrical features, and install new lifting gate machinery base; 5) Modify bridge to access the lifting machinery equipment for replacement; and 6) Work from bridge is limited to one (1) lane closure with a few short term ?hourly? road closures for special lifts DISCLOSURE OF MAGNITUDE OF THE CONSTRUCTION PROJECT: Between $25,000,000 and $100,000,000. NAICS CODE AND SBA SIZE STANDARD: 237990 ? Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction; $39,500,000. TYPE OF SET-ASIDE: None (Full and Open/Unrestricted) *Technical Plans and Specifications are still currently at 95% (they have not changed since they were posted prior to the site visit). The Final Plans and Specs will be published with an amendment once they are ready for publication. * **PRE-PROPOSAL CONFERENCE WILL BE ON 26 MAY 2022 AT 10:00AM CENTRAL TIME. Webex link and call-in information is included in the attached Solicitation.? ?"

column1: Consulting: Dental, Eye, Healthcare, Hearing, Medical, Pharmacy, Therapy Bids,MT,"Buy Indian Set-Aside (specific to Department of Health and Human Services, Indian Health Services): Buy Indian Act - Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetists (CRNAs) at Indian Health Service Facility",Federal,,Department of Health and Human Services,"Jun 6, 2022",Department of Health and Human Services,https://sam.gov/opp/bfd988d505bf460f8c7f8f703b243a57/view,"75H70922MR-002
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-690-7300,PRUDENCE.YELLOWOWL@IHS.GOV,,"This is a Sources Sought notice. This is NOT a solicitation for proposals, proposal abstracts, or quotations. Pursuant to 48 CFR Part 326, Subpart 326.603-3 and IHM 5.5-6, Indian Health Service (IHS) must use the negotiation authority of the Buy Indian Act, 25 U.S.C. 47, to give preference to Indian Economic Enterprises (IEE) whenever the use of that authority is authorized and practicable. The purpose of this Sources Sought Announcement is for market research to gain knowledge of potential qualified IEE sources interested and capable of performing the work. Responses to this announcement will be used by the Government to make appropriate acquisition planning decisions. The Government is seeking to identify Indian Small Business Economic Enterprises (ISBEEs) that are capable of performing the below Indian Health Services (IHS) requirement and interested in submitting potential Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetists (CRNAs) at an Indian Health Service healthcare facility under the North American Classification System (NAICS) Code of 621399, Office of All Other Miscellaneous Health Practitioners. The Small Business Administration's size standard for NAICS 621399 is 9 million dollars.? Any vendor responding to this notice should submit their capability statement as well as the Buy Indian Act Indian Economic Enterprise Representation Form (attached). Instructions for submission are outlined below. INSTRUCTIONS TO INDUSTRY ISBEEs are highly encouraged to respond to this notice. However, firms should understand that generic capability statements are not sufficient for effective evaluation of their capacity and capability to perform the work required. Responses must directly demonstrate the company?s capability, experience, and ability to provide CRNA services as shown below: CRNAs: These positions shall be required to report to work in accordance with IHS facility policies. The contract CRNA shall possess qualifications meeting or exceeding currently recognized national standards as established by the Joint Commission (TJC), the American Association of Nurse Anesthetists Council on Accreditation, and the US Army Graduate Program in Anesthesia Nursing (USAGPAN) affiliate university. The contract CRNA shall perform in accordance with established principles, practices, and ethics of the nursing anesthesia profession and written policies, procedures, protocols, and requirements of the IHS. The standards of performance for all contract CRNAs shall reflect the degree of care, skill, and learning expected of a reasonably prudent CRNA.? Up to date ACLS and PALS certifications are requirements. The majority (greater than 80%) of Anesthesia services shall be performed in the area of emergent and non-emergent surgical anesthesia. A minority of anesthesia service (less than 20%) may be performed on functions that directly support anesthesia patient care. This anesthesia direct support services include but are not limited to preoperative clinic, pain management, sedation analgesia program management, infection control, hospital education, process improvement, nurse anesthesia training, and research. The contractor shall have CRNAs available to provide services 40 hours per week, Monday through Friday, from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM.? On call and callback status applies as required. (i.e., 24 hours per day, seven days per week).? The schedule may include weekdays, federal holidays, training holidays, and weekends. Unplanned or unannounced work schedule changes may be required with the concurrence of the contractor.? Potential ISBEE sources who are interested should reference Sources Sought Number 75H70922MR-002; identify/provide business name, address, UIE number; point of contact; business size and business socio-economic category; and provide a service capability statement in their response. Written responses to this notice shall be emailed in PDF format to kenneth.nicholson@ihs.gov and prudence.yellowowl@ihs.gov no later than 3:00 PM (MST), Monday, June 6, 2022. Telephone responses will not be accepted. This notice is to assist in determining sources only--a solicitation is not currently available."

column5: ",Purchasing,,703-695-7145,gregory.p.kothman.civ@army.mil,,"This is a Firm Fixed Price Request for Quotation (RFQ) being issued by the Nevada Army National Guard (NVARNG) United States Property and Fiscal Office Purchasing and Contracting Division for Occupational Health Examination services.? The anticipated period of performance is 01 July 2022 ? 30 June 2023 at contractor specified facilities/?locations in the greater areas of Reno and Las Vegas, Nevada.? To clarify, offerors must have at least one facility in the greater Reno area and at least one facility in the greater Las Vegas area that are equiped and purposed for conducting Occupational Health Physical Examinations. This solicitation is prepared in accordance with FAR Part 12, the acquisition of commercial items in conjunction with the policies and procedures for solicitation, evaluation, and award as prescribed in FAR 13, Simplified Acquisition Procedures. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) 2022-06 dated 5/01/2022. This solicitation is a TOTAL SMALL BUSINESS SET-ASIDE and the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for this solicitation is 621999 with an industry size standard of $16.5 million and the Product Service Code (PSC) is Q403. A responsible offeror/quoter is one whose offer conforms to the solicitation and will be most advantageous to the Government.? Please refer to?52.212-2 Evaluation - Commercial Products and Commercial Services (page 8 of the attached SF1449). Quoted pricing on the SF1449 must be completed and submitted. The SF1449 provides the contract clauses, terms and conditions for this requirement. Questions concerning this requirement shall be addressed in writing to Greg Kothman at gregory.p.kothman.civ@army.mil ?prior to 11:59pm Pacific Time on Monday, May 23, 2022. This is the only means of submitting questions. All questions will be consolidated and answered in the form of a solicitation amendment and posted to this site. Quoted pricing and any related documentation required for evaluation (SF1449 page 3 for pricing, and other documentation is listed on page 8 under 52.212-2 Evaluation) shall be submitted to Greg Kothman at gregory.p.kothman.civ@army.mil prior to 11:59 PM Pacific Time on Monday, June 13, 2022. This is the only means of submitting quotes in response to this RFQ."

column1: Consulting: Dental, Eye, Healthcare, Hearing, Medical, Pharmacy, Therapy Bids,NV,Pharmacist Staffing Services,Federal,,Department of Veterans Affairs,"Mar 1, 2023",Department of Veterans Affairs,https://sam.gov/opp/681d1bf69775417a9868fa998ab8b6a1/view,"36C26122AP2285
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-461-4300,addlene.williams@va.gov,,"The government requires a broad range of professional assistance related to inpatient (unit dose and intravenous admixtures) and outpatient pharmacy services at the VASNHS. The contractor is to provide two (2) licensed registered pharmacists and two (4) Pharmacy Technician Certification Board (PTCB) certified pharmacy technicians for a broad range of professional assistance related to inpatient (unit dose & intravenous admixtures) and outpatient pharmacy services at the VASNHS. The contract pharmacists and technicians will work in both the outpatient and inpatient pharmacy settings. Each contract pharmacist and technician must have at least 2 yrs of experience in hospital (inpatient) pharmacy.?The contract pharmacists and technicians may be required to work a minimum of 40 hours per?week with each shift being a minimum of 8-hrs (Sunday through Saturday, 24/7 days a week, including holidays). The contractor may be required to provide up to 64 additional hours of pharmacist coverage per week and 64 hours of technician coverage to VASNHS Pharmacy service per week. Shifts are determined by VASNHS Pharmacy leadership."

column1: Consulting: Dental, Eye, Healthcare, Hearing, Medical, Pharmacy, Therapy Bids,NM,NON PERSONAL SERVICE CONTRACT - OPERATING ROOM ASSISTANTS,Federal,,Department of Health and Human Services,"Jun 6, 2022",Department of Health and Human Services,https://sam.gov/opp/26a1d861d920461eb7c5050d1641f014/view,"NNMC062062022
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-690-7300,verni.harrison-yazza@ihs.gov,,"Non-Personal Service Contract for Operating Assistants: ?Medical Supply Technician and Scrub Technicians will provide services on ""AS NEEDED BASIS"" for the Operating Room Department at Northern Navajo Medical Center (NNMC) located in Shiprock, New Mexico. This request is Unrestricted for a Non-Personal Service Contract per FAR 37.401(a) for Operating Room Assistant services to be performed. The tasks to be performed are cited in the attached Performance Work Statements (PWS). The Period of Performance: Base Period: Date of Award for 6 months 1st Option Period: Extend after the first 6 months. REQUIREMENTS: 1. Return the Pricing attached with candidate profile. The Government will consider competitive rates upon negotiation. Hourly Rate shall be an All-Inclusive Hourly Rate, Meaning travel, per diem, lodging/housing, transportation, meals, and applicable taxes (i.e. federal, state and local). The Attach Wage Determination Service Contract Act applies. 2. Past Performance: Provide experience of comparable scope and complexity in providing services within the past three (3) years of operation. 3. Qualifications: Provide complete candidate Profile with valid phone number and email address (updated resume and all relative documents for proposed candidate. Refer to PWS Section 5.0 & 6.0). 4. Availability of candidate(s). 5. Return Pricing Schedule with rate 6. Contractor will not start work until the Purchase Order is issued - signed by the Contracting Officer and receipt of vendor Attached are the Technical Requirement to both positions. Condition of Employment: U.S Citizenship is required NOTE: Incomplete Submission(s) shall not be reviewed nor considered if submitted directly to the hospital unit managers. In addition, any profiles received after the RFQ closing date shall be accepted but shall not be subject for review. The government does not guarantee that the contractor will work the number of hours ordered. The hours ordered are only estimated. The government will pay only the actual hours the contractor works. On occasion, when the workload is insufficient, the contractor will be sent home Housing: No Government Housing Available. The nearby towns are Farmington, NM , 29 miles East of Shiprock, NM and in Cortez, CO, 41 miles North of Shiprock, NM. There are hotels, restaurants, mall, etc. in the two towns Submit qualified candidates profile to verni.harrison-yazza@ihs.gov prior to closing date with required documents"

column5: ",Purchasing,,202-690-7300,cornelius.tsipai@ihs.gov,,"The Indian Health Service, Shiprock Service Unit, located in Shiprock, New Mexico has a requirement for One (1) MRI Technologist for the Radiology Department at Northern Navajo Medical Center. Quotes will be due on or before?April 5, 2022.? In accordance with 52.204-7(b)(1) prospective contractors must have ? and maintain (in accordance with 52.204-13(c) ? an active profile in the System for Award Management at beta.SAM.gov in order to submit a quote. *There is no SF 1449 attached as the total estimated value is under the Simplified Acquisition Threshold."

column1: Consulting: Dental, Eye, Healthcare, Hearing, Medical, Pharmacy, Therapy Bids,NM,Sources Sought: NON PERSONAL SERVICE CONTRACT FOR REGISTER NURSES,Federal,,Department of Health and Human Services,"Jun 7, 2022",Department of Health and Human Services,https://sam.gov/opp/aa34a166de16441d8b225328bd58c033/view,"NNMC052606072022
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-690-7300,verni.harrison-yazza@ihs.gov,,"SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE THIS IS A SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE FOR INFORMATION ONLY: THIS IS NOT A REQUEST FOR QUOTE THERE IS NO SOLICITATION AT THIS TIME. This request for capability information does not constitute a request for quotations or proposals.? Submission of any information in response to this market survey is purely voluntary and will be used only for market research purposes to determine availability of sources, commerciality, and competitive strategy.? The government assumes no financial responsibility for any costs associated with any response to this notice as incurred by prospective contractors. Project: Non-Personal Service Contract: Register Nurse Services The Indian Health Service (IHS), Shiprock Service Unit (SSU), Northern Navajo Medical Center (NNMC) ?is seeking capable,?Native American Owned Small Business or Indian Economic Enterprise Small Business for the following positions: 2 Emergency Room Nurses 1 Wound Care Nurse 1 Ambulatory Care Nurse The anticipated period of performance is for approximately 1 year.? See below for full service performance: Upon award for 6 months Option 1 for an additional 6 months Note: Period of Performance date may be subject to change The applicable North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code assigned to this procurement is?561320. The government will evaluate market information to ascertain potential market capacity to provide supplies with those described in this notice.? In accordance with the Buy Indian Act, 25 U.S.C. 47, the Indian Health Service shall give preference at all times, as far as practicable, to Indian economic enterprises.? If your firm is capable of providing the supplies and/or services described in this notice, complete the attached representation form and submit it along with the rest of the required documents. THE RESPONSES TO THIS SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE/MARKET RESEARCH WILL BE USED TO DETERMINE THE ACQUISITION STRATEGY SUCH AS INDIAN-OWNED ENTERPRISE SET ASIDES, TOTAL SMALL BUSINESS SET ASIDE, ANY OTHER SOCIO-ECONOMIC SET ASIDE, OR UNRESTRICTED. NOTE: If this requirement is set-aside, FAR 52.219-14 (DEVIATION 2019-01) Limitations on Subcontracting will apply; similarly-situated entity description applies. This clause requires that the concern perform at least 50 percent (50%) [LJ(1]?of the cost of the contract, not including the cost of materials, with its own employees. SUBMISSION INSTRUCTIONS: All interested sources must submit a capabilities package to the primary point of contact listed below, no later than (NLT) June 7, 2022, 4:00 PM AT A MINIMUM, THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION MUST BE SUBMITTED TO THE POC LISTED IN THIS NOTICE: Fill out the attached?IHS Buy Indian Act Indian Economic Enterprise Representation Form. If Non-Indian, indicate firm?s size ? small or other-than-small; and other socio-economic program participation such as small-disadvantaged, 8(a)-certified, HUBZone, SDVOSB, and/or WOSB/EDWOSB A positive statement of your intention to submit a quote to an upcoming solicitation as a prime contractor. Provide firm?s UEI Number. Evidence of recent (within the last five years) experience with work similar in type and scope to include: Contract Numbers Project Titles Dollar Amounts Percent and complete description of work self-performed. Customer points of contact with current telephone number and email address. All of the above information must be submitted in sufficient detail for a decision to be made on availability of interested qualified Buy-Indian parties. If adequate interest is not received from Buy-Indian concerns, the solicitation may be issued as another type of set aside or unrestricted without further notice. Point of Contact: Verni Harrison-Yazza, Contract Specialist verni.harrison-yazza@ihs.gov Place of Performance: Northern Navajo Medical Center US HWY 491 Shiprock, NM 87420 THIS IS NOT A SOLICITATION."

column1: Consulting: Dental, Eye, Healthcare, Hearing, Medical, Pharmacy, Therapy Bids,NM,"Buy Indian Set-Aside (specific to Department of Health and Human Services, Indian Health Services): Mobile Mammography Services - ACLIHC",Federal,,Department of Health and Human Services,"Jun 8, 2022",Department of Health and Human Services,https://sam.gov/opp/c49cd216aa6b4c509465ced00757419e/view,"75H70722R00011
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-690-7300,judith.mariano@ihs.gov,,"BACKGROUND: The Albuquerque Area Indian Health Service, Acoma-Canoncito-Laguna Indian Health Center, Department Patient Services provides services that requires the services of a Mobile Mammography which provide diagnostic imaging mobile services for screening mammography in a competent and professional manner.? The Contractor will furnish all management supervision, labor, transportation, equipment supplies, quality controls and incidentals necessary in providing mobile mammography in accordance with the performance work statement. PURPOSE: Currently the Indian Health Service, Albuquerque Area does procure services and supplies from Small Business Indian Firms pursuant to the Buy Indian Act 100% of the time. STATEMENT OF OBJECTIVES:????? Locate eligible and qualified Small Business Indian Firms to support IHS procurement needs under NAICS code: Q522 ? Medical - Radiology / 621512 ? Diagnostic Imaging Centers. Utilize the information received with future acquisition planning efforts and potential Buy Indian set aside.? Possibly create one Firm-Fixed Price Contract amongst eligible and qualified Small Business Indian Firms. HOW TO RESPOND: This is a sources sought notice under the authority of the Buy Indian Act. The Indian Health Service (IHS) is attempting to locate qualified and eligible Small Business Indian Firms, ?Native American Indian Owned and Operated businesses,? that can provide services/supplies to the Indian Health Service.? This is a request for information only.? Responses to this notice are not considered offers and cannot be accepted by the Government to form a binding contract.? Any information submitted by respondents to this notice is strictly voluntary with no obligation or incurred cost by the government. Provide with response ? E-mail response.? Shall be in a printer friendly format, Word or PDF, 8x11 page size, 5-page limit. Certification as a Small Business Indian Firms. The government is ONLY interested in Small Business Indian Firms. (See attached Representative Form). The government requests that interested parties respond to this notice if applicable and identify your business status to the identified NAICS code.? Pursuant to FAR 52.204-7, prospective vendors shall be properly registered in www.sam.gov; this includes proper registration as an Small Business Indian Firms and if eligible, registered as applicable small business certifications (e.g. Hubzone, 8(a), Service Disabled Veteran Owned, Veteran Owned, Women-Owned, Small Disadvantaged), in order for IHS to issue an award and claim procurement actions with eligible Small Business Indian Firms. Provide detailed capabilities statement, website, and e-catalog as it pertains to Q522 ? Medical - Radiology / 621512 ? Diagnostic Imaging Centers. Provide Dun & Bradstreet (DUNS) and Unique Entity Identifier (UEI) used to create www.sam.gov registration. Identify Business Size: ?Small or Large GSA/FSS contract holders ? provide GSA/FSS/VA or other GWAC contract number, only if applicable."

column5: ",Contracting Officer,,202-586-4403,esther.archuleta@nnsa.doe.gov,,"Psychological Assessment Services are provided by board certified psychiatrists and licensed clinical psychologists (hereinafter referred to as ?clinician? or ?clinicians?). These services include Personal Security File (PSF) reviews, clinical evaluations, final reports, formal testimonies at administrative review hearings and other related special requests, as needed. The services are used by OPFCC in determining an individual?s eligibility or continued eligibility for a DOE/NNSA access authorization (hereinafter referred to as a ?security clearance?)."

Consulting: Dental, Eye, Healthcare, Hearing, Medical, Pharmacy, Therapy Bids,NY,X1DB--Intent to Sole Source to Insight Health Corp for a 6 Month extension to lease a MRI Trailer,Federal,,Department of Veterans Affairs,"Jun 19, 2022",Department of Veterans Affairs,https://sam.gov/opp/1435d462011b448c8549c23fa953d742/view,"36C24222Q0761
column5: ",Purchasing,,202-461-4300,enell.riley@va.gov,,"NOTICE OF INTENT TO AWARD SOLE SOURCE: Department of Veterans Affairs, VISN 2, intends to award a sole source modification to Insight Health Corp, 26250 Enterprise CT, Suite 100, Lake Forest, CA 92630. The VA Medical Center in Brooklyn New York is currently seeking a 6-month extension on a lease for an MRI Trailer. Locations: Brooklyn VAMC, 800 Poly Place, Brooklyn, NY 11209. The MRI unit will be on site 7 days a week. The MRI must meet the specifications: VA MRI technologists are already trained in the Philips Ingenia MRI that will require minimum applications training. System must be able to transfer image and data to multiple modalities including PACs, VISTA Imaging, and printers. OEM Engineer will establish network and printer connectivity at the site in coordination with local IT staff. Verification of connectivity must be made prior to the start of patient procedures. System scan protocols must be verified and validated by VA reading radiologists. The system will be installed and operated in compliance with all applicable VA security and privacy standards, practices, and policies. The Vendor is responsible for transporting the unit to and from the location. The Vendor is responsible for the maintenance of the unit, including all preventive maintenance, and all parts and labor. The Vendor is responsible for the removal of the mobile unit as well as the existing retired Siemens Symphony MRI. Biomed will remove system Hard Drive at contract end and destruct/dispose according to VA policy. Period of Performance(s): June 1, 2022 to December 31, 2022 NAICS: 621512 (Size Standard $15.0 Million) For future consideration, interested parties may identify their interests and capability to respond to this requirement by May 27, 2022 at 12:00 pm. (EST). Any response to this notice must show clear and convincing evidence that competition would be advantageous to the Government. Information received will be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether or not to conduct a competitive procurement. The determination not to compete this proposed contract action is solely within the discretion of the Government. The Government will not be responsible for any costs incurred by responding to this notice. Responses to this electronic notice must be made by 12:00 pm. EST on May 27, 2022. Contact: Enell Riley, Contracting Officer Email: enell.riley@va.gov"
